Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Google Maps and other highway and street GPS services have replaced what? Choices:  A: united states B: mexico C: countryside D: atlas E: oceans<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>### Response Reason: A: united states<n>B: mexico<n>C: countryside<n>D: atlas<n>E: oceans<n>#### 400-60=<<40-60=2285>>2285<n>Answer: 2285<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following question.<n><n>####Demonstration:<n>###Input:<n>####Input:A local farmer has started an 11-day-long livestock sale.  A friend who wants to buy livestock asks, “If a cow costs $20 to buy and is sold at 20 cents each day, what is the minimum number of days that you have to attend to buy all the cows?”<n><n>##**Rationales:**<n>For 11=<<11=3>>3 days there are 20,000 cows. The other days it will cost $20 + 1/20 = <<20+1/20=1>>1 day cost $20<n>The answer is: 11 - 3 = <<11-3=8>>8=3<n>####3<n>Answer: 3<n><n>###Instructions: Answer the following multiple choice question<n><n>###Demonstration:Input: How much does a cow cost per day? A: 1/19 B: 1/20, C: 1/36, D: 1/35, E: 1/25<n>Rationales A: If the days in the week are: 7x3/7, then 36, a cow costs $36 per week.<n>B: 20 days of the week is 20 cows but 1 cow = day.<n><n>####3.32258064517185791260244146264310415625<n>Answer: 3.322345486679211313138388<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:The forgotten leftovers had gotten quite old, he found it covered in mold in the back of his what? Choices:  A: carpet B: refrigerator C: breadbox D: fridge E: coach<n><n>### Response:		A.<n><n>### Answer: C<n><n>### Demand:The price of airplanes fell in 2021 because of a large number of airline bankruptcies.  What word refers to the change of the amount supplied caused by a change of the amount demanded?<n><n>### Response/Demand: A.<n><n>#### Answer: A<n><n>### Rationales:<n>Low demand because of high costs of airplanes lead to a low price/supply in order to have customers.<n><n>### Inputs:There are many different types of automotive transmission in use today.  For example, the three most common types are the manual transmission, the automatic transmission, and the continuous variable transmission.  What is the term for the change in the position of a gear that results from a change in the rotational speed of an automobile engine?<n><n>### Rationale:Transmitter<n><n>1. An output is caused by an input.<n>2. Cause is the rotation of the engine and the effect is the changing of a gear.<n>### Input:Electric cars are a relatively new technology.  What word refers both to a single car and to several electric vehicles that are able to communicate over the Internet?<n><n>### Input/Response: An input is to have multiple of the same type of car but for them to be able to communicate over Internet at once.<n>![image of cars](./Images/CarCame.png)<n>The multiple electric cars can communicate with eachother over the Internet.
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Before getting a divorce, what did the wife feel who was doing all the work? Choices:  A: harder B: anguish C: bitterness D: tears E: sadness<n><n>### Response:		Anguish.<n><n>#### Anguish:<n>The adjective anguish feels like, “a feeling of bitter anguish.”<n>Anguish feels like the wife is working harder than her husband.<n><n>#### Bitterness:<n>Bitterness feels like, “a sharp or sour taste.”<n>Bitterness feels the husband’s wife feels bitter to her husband doing all the work.<n><n>#### Tears:<n>Tears feels like, “a salty fluid secreted by and flowing from the eyes,” as well as, “to shed tears.”<n><n>#### Sadness:<n>Sadness feels like, “a state of profound sorrow.”<n>As well as, “a deep and poignant feeling of grief or loss.”<n><n>In conclusion, she feels anguished.<n><n>### Input<n>What did the husband feel who wasn’t doing any of the work? Choices A: anguish or B: happy or C: grumpy or D: joyful or E: sad<n><n>### Response<n><n>Happy:<n>Happy feels like the husband is enjoying himself. Since he is married, and doing no work, he must be happy.<n><n>Grumpy:<n>Grumpy feels like the husband is grumpy at his job. Since he is doing no work, he is probably doing something tedious. Therefore, he most likely feels grumpy.<n><n>Sad:<n>Sad feels like the husband is sad at work. Since he did not get a promotion, he probably feels sad.<n><n>Joyful:<n>Joyful feels like the husband is happy and pleased. This is most likely the case because he did not do any work and still receives a pay check.<n><n>Joyfully he says:<n>I am now joyfully married,<n>Joyfully.<n>To you he says:<n>I’m here because of you,<n>The way that you love me<n>And what you gave to me in our own fairytale,<n><n>Without you, I can’t love you<n><n>Therefore, the husband is feeling joyful! <n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n><n>## Demonstration<n>Input: The price of oranges is four for $1.59, seven for $2.19, and twelve for $4.19

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Bill is stuck in marsh when a man comes up to him peaking Cajun, where is he? Choices:  A: low lands B: new york C: forest D: louisiana E: everglades<n><n>### Response:		<n>Rationales: In the case that Bill is in Marsh, he will endure the 12 feet to escape 11 feet below him<n>In the case that Bill is a 12 feet under Marsh, he will attempt to ascend from the level of 11 feet to the 1 foot level.<n>For that matter, if a person were to fall 11 feet he would be under the water with no ability to rise above the water to see the forest<n><n>### Rationales:<n>There is more than one answer to the question of where his home is, he is a 12 foot under the marsh and not able to see a forest that may be a half mile away.<n><n>### Input<n><n>Ralph wants to buy a new 2004 PT Cruiser from a local car dealer. He qualifies for a ten-year loan with a 10,000-year mortgage. Ralph can only afford to pay 253 dollars per month.  What is the annual interest rate of this loan?<n>#### ANSWER:<n>#### 6.66%<n>#### EXPLAIN:<n>Ralph will be required to buy $253 pay monthly payments for either 10 or 11 years.  This means that he will pay $36,456 for the car.<n><n>### RATIONALES<n><n>Since Ralph is paying a set monthly payment he will have to borrow more money to pay for the car (see above)<n>the 1000+ or the 1100-253 = 747 194 dollars for 11 years<n><n>### This leads him to pay for the above in 10 years or 11years, but since his payments do not match the amount paid, he will pay for the car in 11 years with the amount to be paid in 10 years<n><n><n>### Since he plans on paying 11 years to pay for 10 years, the interest rate is 11/10=<<11/10=.11>>. Since 10 is a multiple of 3 the rate of change is 0.3 so the equation is 11/.3 = 36 194/11 for

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:When eating everything on the tasting menu, what does one tend to feel? His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:He wanted a house that was gated off from other places, where should he start looking? Choices:  A: neighborhood B: subdivision C: city D: suburbs E: street<n><n>### Response:		<n>#### E<n><n>|Rationales:|   |<n>|----|----|<n>|A is correct. He would start by looking in the different neighborhoods within the city or town. In a neighborhood, houses are often very close to each other and the gates may not provide much privacy. Neighborhoods often have a well-defined shape and entrance, which you usually find near a main street, which also means you will see many more other people in and out of the home. On the other hand, if he picks the subdivision, he would have privacy, but often less room and little to expand the house. Suburbs often have their own gate, just like the city would, though there might be less gates in each suburb. Subdivisions and suburbs are usually more spread out, so you will not see as many people.|<n>|<n><n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple-choice question. The answer is shown.<n><n>### 
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Mark's semen was very thick, but after his vasectomy it was also what? Choices:  A: blank B: sparse C: thin D: clear E: free flowing<n><n>### Response:		Answer the following multiple-choice questions.<n>#### A<n><n>### Demirstion<n>#### B<n><n>### Deminstion<n>#### C<n><n>### Demistion<n>#### D<n><n>### Demnistion<n>#### E<n><n>### Demostion<n><n>### Answer:<n><A>A: sparse<BR><n><n><A>B: thin<BR><n><n>### Demestic<n><A>C:<BR><n><n><n><n><n><n><A>D: clear<BR><n><n>   <A>E: flowing<n>

How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. She will travel there by plane and stay at a hotel. Each night, her stay in the hotel will cost her $200. Her total travel cost will be her stay plus two nights’ dinner cost plus travel costs for her roundtrip journey to New York City. Write a formula that calculates TravelCost, in dollars, and plug in values to answer the question.<n><n>Rationales:<n>Cost For Hotel $200<n>Day 2 $200 + $40 = $240<240><n>Day 1 $200 + 40 = $260<260><n>Day 0 $200<200><n>$200+40+240+260+240 = 860<860><n><n>#### 860<n>Answer: 120<n><n>### Response to task(4):<n>Which number is in the first place?<n><n>4<n><n>### Final:1.1.4<n>#### 7<n>Answer: 21<n><n>#### 21<n>Answer: 41<n><n>#### 41<n>Answer: 62<n><n>#### 62<n>Answer: 83<n><n>### Solution:<n>### Task Instruction:<n>Answer the following multiple choice questions<n><n>### Task Rationale:<n>The input is the number of the correct answer and a list of choices<n><n>### Task:<n>Input:<n>A hurricane is approaching Texas and 20,000 head of cows need to be moved up the coast to higher ground. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:What is a grumpy person likely to have? Choices:  A: headache B: understand themselves C: compliments D: own house E: happiness<n><n>### Response:		They are Grumpy. <n><n>### Rationales:<n>We don't know the person's characteristics.<n><n>### Choice:<n>A<n><n>#### A<n>Answer: A<n><n>### Input:[479, 582, 685, 788, 891]<n><n>### Response:[479,582,685,788,891]<n>#### 479 582 685 788 891<n>Answer: 891<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Where could a fungus grow and not be disturbed by sunlight? Choices:  A: under rocks B: manhattan C: toenails D: grocery store E: fallen tree<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>In all of these places there is less sunlight. Rocks are typically found in many places where the sunlight is not able to easily reach them.  This also excludes them from fungal growth.<n>Melissa does not travel to Manhattan often or at all, so this is not an acceptable answer.<n>Toenails grow on your feet. This is a safe place for fungal growth (this fact is provided in the input.)<n>The grocery store is not a safe place as it is a constant high traffic area.  It is possible, but rare for this to occur.<n>Lastly, in the input it states that "the fallen tree..." where fallen trees are subject to fungal growth, meaning this is the correct answer, but it is not provided in the input. <n>#### C<n>Answer: C<n><n>### Input:"The car-rental aggreement says that all charges are subject to Florida sales tax. How much, in cents, does the sales tax total? Give your answer correct to the nearest cent, if necessary.<n>><n>> "If you rent a car from the car-rental aggreeement for 18 days, what is the total charge to pick up and return the car? Give your answer in dollars and cents to the nearest dollar."<n><n>Input: Given the information provided "The car-rental agreement says that all charges are SUBJECT TO Florida sales tax.," this tells us that the Florida sales tax will not be included in the original cost, therefore it will need to be accounted for with additional charges.<n>To complete this task, we will need to calculate the tax amount based on the cost of the rental.<n>To do this, use the following formula: Sales Tax = (Cost * Sales Tax Rate)<n><n>In this case, the total of the 18-day rental would be calculated to be = $180+400 = 580.  So, a total of 580 is charged to the renter.<n><n>In this case the cost of the renter is charged 9.5%, so the sales tax we need to account for is = 9.5% of 580 = $54.90<n><n>#### Total Payment = $580+$54.90 = $634.90<n>Answer: $634
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:What does sex often make happen in people? Choices:  A: making love B: feel good C: happyness D: wonderful thing E: cloud judgment<n><n>### Response:		<n>(You can select only one.)<n><n>### Response Justification: I picked the answer because it is talking about "making love", as in making love with some one or making love with some one you would not like to do anything wrong and cloud judgement will not let you do anything wrong.<n><n>### Input A family of four (two adults and two children) went on vacation. They drove 400 miles. Each adult drove 40 miles per day. The family car averaged 20 miles per gallon. That meant 80 miles would use up one gallon of fuel. Thus, they used 3gallons of fuel during their vacation, costing them $30.00. How many days of their long weekend vacation did they have?<n><n>### Response<n><n>#### #Answer<n>The answer is 6 hours<n><n>### Response #Justification<n>It took the family to drive for 15 hours which is 15/(24 hour day) = 0.625 The fuel would be 400*0.625/(10*1000) = 240 miles/gallon which is correct to 2 decimal places I do not know exactly how to round it to 4 decimal places without using calculator. <n><n>###Input:A family uses 340 kilowatt-hours a month in electric power. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:The fat man refused to accept what was possible, he complained that he what the simplest activities? Choices:  A: no go B: unlikely C: unable D: cant do E: impossibility<n><n>### Response:		The easiest way to answer the multiple choice question was to use the alphabet and the word impossible is the last letter.<n><n>#### E<n>Answer: Impossibility<n><n>*<n><n>### Input- How often would the following statements be true for a 3-year span?<n><n>* A: A person has at least two new cars during<n>* a 3-year period<n><n>* B: During a 3-year time period, there’s a<n>* 10% or greater chance of a person having at<n>* least one new car.<n><n>* C: One year ago you owned a car, you didn’t<n>* have two new cars during the 3-year<n><n>* D: Last week you owned a car, it is impossible for<n>* you to own a car that’s brand new in 2 years<n><n>Input-<n><n>#### C<n>Answer: One year ago you ownership of a new car is possible<n><n>* You owned a new car at one point<n>* This point could be 1 year ago<n>* Or this point could be at some other point<n><n>* Since we are interested in at least one new car per 3 year span<n><n>* This year you owned a car<n>* This ownership did not last for more than 3 years<n><n>* Next year you might own a new car<n><n>* You most likely will not own a new car next year because the 3 year period has to start again<n><n>* Since you need to have a new car at least one time during a span of 3 years you are correct if this answer is C<n><n>### Renters Agreement<n><n>Input: A house rental agreement was broken.<n><n>Output: A tenant broke a lease and owes $0 to his landlord.<n><n>Rationales: It says that the agreement was broken so the tenant owes money, but the $0 means that the tenant isn't being charged at all, but is being told to leave.<n>#### $0<n>Answer: $0<n><n>#### $1<n>Answer: $1<n><n>#### $15<n>Answer: $15<n><n>#### $13<n>Answer: $13<n><n>#### $60<n>Answer: $60<n><n>Input: The store wanted $10 off of everything in your shopping cart.<n><n>Output: I spent $20 on
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:What is someone who gets angry after getting drunk likely to participate in? Choices:  A: violence B: falling down C: vomiting D: vomiting E: lower standards<n><n>### Response:		<n>D<n>#<n><n>### Input The 2007 movie "Superbad" cost $70,000,000 to make. The 2011 movie "Drive" was filmed in 27 days. The 2006 movie "Talladega Nights" cost $60,000 less than Superbad and took 3 days longer to film. What was the budget for "Talladega?"<n><n>### Rationales<n>If Talladega was $55 million cheaper, then Superbad would be $55/70 mill $<$0.81618 million dollars.<n>Since Drive took 27 days it would cost $55/7 x 27, which gives a final answer of $14.51657 million.<n>### Answer $14.5 million.<n><n>### Input A 36-ton ship traveling downstream sails into a 24-foot-wide channel at $4.10/hr. The current in the river is running at $7.80/hr and a 6-foot-wide stream flows at $9.90/hr. After 3 hours the ship has moved 80 feet downstream. Which speed current is the 36-ton boat in right now?<n><n>### Rationale For the first 3 hours if current cost $4.1, traveling at $80/3 = 26.67 ft/hr.<n>$${5}/{100*120} = 11.11\text{f/hr} $$<n>After 3 hours it has moved 80 so in 3 hours there was a 80/26.67 conversion $3.025 f/hr<n><n>### Answer $3.024 f/hr<n><n>#

If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:They were getting together for the big game, he wasn't hosting but made sure to bring pretty of food with him over to where? Choices:  A: picnic B: friend's house C: table D: space shuttle E: fairgrounds<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Rationale: Because there are food choices: Table, Picnic, and fairgrounds.<n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Sam went to Paris where he ordered a blowfish at a sushi place.  Where was Sam? Choices:  A: books B: france C: fish market D: atlantic ocean E: cuba<n><n>### Response:		E<n><n>### Instructions:Please choose the correct response to the following scenario.<n><n>### You are at an intersection waiting for a traffic light to turn green. As you wait, you notice that a car 250 yards away at another intersection runs its light.  When the light turns green at the intersection, what do you think will happen to the distance between you and the car?<n>#### Option A:<n>It will not change.<n>#### Option B:<n>It will get smaller<n>#### Option C:<n>It will remain unchanged<n>#### Option D:<n>It will get larger<n><n>### Option B<n><n>### Answer:It will get smaller<n><n><n>### Rationales:<n>Let a and b be the distance from your car to the intersection where you meet a car.<n>Let c be the distance from your intersection to the intersection where you see the cars (e.g., light) run.  c=<<c=250>>250<n><n>After you and the car in the intersection both hit the green light, the new distance between you and you and the car in c is (2a-c) because you and the car in a move together by (2a-1)(2a-c)=<<a2+a-1=2a>>2a+2ab-1=(2a+a+a)-1>>(1)<n><n>a=250 yards so (250×2)-250=750 yards<n><n>### After the cars running the light hit the green light, you move 750 yards away from the original intersection.<n><n>### Answer Summary:<n><n>1. The original distance from yourself to the cars running the light c (750 yards) will be less than the present distance between you and that intersection.<n><n>## Instructions:<n><n>### Rationale for Question:<n>There is a 50% probability that the probability will occur.<n>There is a 25% conditional probability that the result of the probability will occur. (25% /50% =.5)<n>Therefore, The probability of the result is 25% plus 25%<n>25% + 25% = 50%<n>### Answer:<n><n>### Instuctions:<n><n>## Rationale:<n>The probability of the probability
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Where would there be many people sitting in chair and listening to religious speech? Choices:  A: auditorium B: office C: synagogue D: confession E: church<n><n>### Response:		The correct choice is A in auditorium.<n><n>### Rationales:<n>An auditorium is where you go to listen to or watch things, for example, play or religious speech. Church on the other hand is a place of worship.  A synagogue is where people go to worship and celebrate religious holidays and a confessional is a place where a person may tell a priest his sins or confess to them. But none of these are sitting places.<n><n>#### Choice A: Auditorium<n><n>Input:The city of L.A. and San Francisco are close together. In one city, there are 40,000 people.  In the other, there are 55,000 people who share their city's air and water in similar ways.<br>Which city?<n><n>### Response- San Francisco.<n><n>### Response Rationales<n><n>40000 people living in Los Angeles plus 55000 people living<n>in San Francisco are sharing resources like air and water.  The 5500 is a bigger number so it should be assumed to be the one with more people living there.<n><n>#### Choices B-> Los Angeles & D ->San Francisco<n><n>Input:If we travel 10 meters east and then north, how many meters have we traveled?<n><n>### Rationale:<n>Since all we travel in a straight line East, then we travel 10M East and when we travel 20M away from the point of origin, we should travel in a North Direction. Hence, We have traveled 10 + 20 = 30 Meters.<n><n>Answer(C) 30<n><n>### Sample Solution:<n>https://docs.google.com/document/d/14gLtXJr5_YpZKLH6V004UA5HvK1s4VXzY1B2M6X4KDQ/edit?usp=sharing<n><n>### Problem 3<n><n>Input: Which month of the year has the most people born in it?<n><n>### Answer: December because it has 4 weeks in it.<n><n>### Solution<n>https://docs.wixstatic.com/ugd/78c719_
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:What is a mobile launching platform found in the ocean? Choices:  A: launch pad B: circus C: aircraft carrier D: large open area E: space station<n><n>### Response:		Answer “Mobile launching platform found in ocean” is D. Answer “Launch platform,” is C, and Answer “Aircraft carrier,” is A.<n><n>### Input:#1. What type of engine can be found on a car? Choices:<n><n><n>### Choices:  A. petrol. B. diesel C. electric D. steam <n>#2. What does a person take with them on a trip? Choices: <n><n>### Choice:A. luggages. B. luggage. <n>#3. What is the name of a large flat-bottomed boat, with sidewheels or propellers? Choices:  B> A. tugboat C. barge D. ferry<n><n>### Chooses:<n><n><n>## Instructions for Part 2<n><n>Input: A man and a woman are visiting another city. They rent a suite of rooms for one week at a monthly rent of $1,200.  They rent two room in each of the 5 weeks they are there, the first two weeks costing $1,400, and the other 3 weeks costing $100 less than $1,40. How much did the couple spend?<n><n>Rationales: We do have two different options:<n>We have the option of doing it, so two week of the couple.<n>Or, we have 5 weeks the couple spent.<n>Now, it takes $100 for us to know that we are paying less money for.<n>Thus, it means each week, $1200-100=-<<$1200-200=-<<2400>>$2400 and then the couple spent $2400.<n><n>Answer: 2400<n>

Choices:  A: laugh B: sit C: being entertained D: math E: meet<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Explanation:<n>A: laugh before go? A can be math, sitting or being entertained<n>B: sit before go? A can't be sit<n>C: meet before go? A and B can't be meet<n>D: math before go? A can not be math<n>E: math before go? C can be math<n>### Instruction<n>Input: What might a kid do with her friend before going to play?> Choices: a. math b. laugh c. being entertained<n>Rationales: A can not be math, since, play, she can't, math c can be math.<n><n>### Input<n><n>### Exercise:<n>The math class at Jenny’s school has to raise $15,000 in four months.  It has already raised<n>$7,500.  If they continue at their current rate, how much money will they have after four<n>months?<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>Fill the blanks to make a correct multiple choice answer<n><n>#### 125<n>answer: 35000<n><n>### Input/Answer:<n>The first part of Jenny’s question is<n><n>[Roman](r/roman_numerals/) numerals.<n><n>### Examples:<n>*29-4=8 and  8-2=6*29-4-6 = 3<n><n>### Instructure:<n><n>How does the roman numeral correspond to a number<n><n>If the value is less than 1000 then the position in the roman number with a one digit number follows the tens place.<n>For example, the value is 1. Place a one over the number itself. 4=IV. <n>If the value is between 10 and 99 place the corresponding digit above the one. For instance. 9 = IX.<n>When the number is more than one thousand, 2888 in this case, position the one in the first<n>location of the Roman numeral in the place of the current first position. for example, 2889 = CMVIII.<n><n>### Rationales:<n><n>#### 899<n>Answer: II<n><n>In addition, if Roman numerals are in excess of 3990,

Choices:  A: playground B: mexico C: town D: outside E: world cup<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Input:(21/2)*76 =? A: 31 B: 34 C: 34.5 D: 35 E: 41<n><n>### Rationales:<n><n>### Answer:<n><n><n><n>### Input:"20/3=70, so 150-70=80"<n><n>### Rationale:<n>### Step 1: The first step is to determine how many gallons of liquid the container could hold. To do this you determine how long each gallon of liquid would be if one were using a full container (1 gallon) then multiply this amount by the number of gallons you need.<n><n>### Step 2: To find how much weight you could store in the container you need to know how much weight is in each gallon of fluid.<n><n><n><n>**In this case the weight of a gallon of water is 8.3 lb.**<n><n><n><n>##Step 3: Next, subtract the weight of 1 gallon of liquid from the weight of a full container of liquid to get the weight of a 1 gallon amount (1/4th of the container's liquid capacity.**<n><n>## Step 4: Now that you know the amount each gallon of liquid weighs you can use this to perform the multiplication from Step 1.<n><n>##Step 5: Subtracting the weight of a 4th of the container with 4 gallons of liquid to get the amount that is left after 4 gallons have been used (the container cannot hold more liquid due to it being full).<n><n><n><n>##Answer<n><n><n><n>##Rationales:<n><n><n><n><n><n>##Assuming the task asks for volume instead of fluid weight you may need to use the conversion in the table above; the volume of a gallon of liquid is 231 cubic inches.<n><n>1 ≈1/4<n><n>1 gallon = 128 fluid ounces<n><n>16.02 pounds<n><n>In this example we have a container that 16 gallons.  Since 16 gallons / 1 gallon = 8.3 the weight of this container is 8.3 pounds multiplied by 16 gallons (2 gallon times 8 = 8

Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Sky diving scared him, once they jumped out of the plane he began losing consciousness while what? Choices:  A: injury B: death C: playing uno D: coma E: falling down<n><n>### Response:		B - Death.<n><n>### Rationales:B - (5, 6, 9)<n><n>### Note to instructor:<n>Write a question that provides context for the task.<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:If you did well on the test, you might get an A as a what? Choices:  A: see work B: practice C: quiz D: school grade E: homework<n><n>### Response:		If you did well you would get an A or an F or an A+ if it was the best, it could be any thing but it couldn’t be a B<n>A<n>Answer: A<n><n>### Input<n>The car-rental agenct charges you $30/day fo a car, or $4 for the first hour, and $30 for every hour after than. How much does it cost for an hour?<n><n>Rationales: If I rented for 3 hours, the cost would be $75<n>If I rented 6 hours it would be $180<n><n>$30.00 for the 6 hour span<n><n>$30-180 = $<<30-185= -25>>-25<n><n>$25 for each hour, total of 3 hours is $75 <n>#### 75<n>Answer: 75<n><n>### Rationales:<n><n>### Instructions: Answer the following multiple choice question using one variable.
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Where is a fox likely to be caught? Choices: 1: eight 2: nine 3: seven 4: four 5: six<n><n>Input: If you were buying an apple pie and the price was $8.89, which of the digits below are actually in the bill?<n>Rationales (Note: the list below is in the order 9,8,7,6,5,4,3,2)<n><n>#### 8 and 8 are both in the prices.<n>#### 8 and a 9 are both in the price.<n>#### 8 is in the price and an 8 is not.<n>#### 7 is in the price<n>#### 6 is in the price and 8 is not. <n>#### 5 is in the price and a 9 is not.(5 is higher)<n>#### 4 is in the price.<n><n>### Response choices:3&5<n>#### 3<n>Answer: 3<n><n>### Input/Output:<n>Input: The area of a perfect square is equal to four times its width.  If its width is equal to three feet, what is its length in inches?<n>Rationales<n><n>#### 75 inches<n>#### 100 inches<n>#### 125 inches<n>#### 210 inches<n>#### 240 inches<n>#### 300 inches<n>The answer is in inches, so if 75=4x3, then 75 divided by 4 means it'll be 18.75, and because it is 18 and not 19, then the number is 180. Finally, 180 divided by 3 is 60, 60 would be divided by 2 which would get you a whole number 30, finally 1 would be left over which means it is 30,000. The answer 30,025 is NOT in the multiple choice responses.<n><n>Answer: 30,030<n><n>### Input;How can you determine if a figure will be a geometric shape?<n><n>If you are able to make an equation for the figure using all of the given values, then it will be a

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:When people discover something new while chatting with friends, why are they likely to continue talking? Choices:  A: agreement B: to fill their time C: discomfort D: misunderstanding E: learning about<n><n>### Response:		D) When people discover something new, they are more likely to want to explain it to the other people. A person wants to feel that the time they spent talking was worthwhile. Even if they agree with the topic, if the group doesn’t understand when they explain the topic, the person will not feel it was worthwhile.<n><n>### Input>A: If we don’t learn what we want to do at school<n>B: we will probably get a job doing something we don’t want to do<n>C: you should probably follow your dreams<n>D: we need to do something to help us prepare for when we<n>E: will leave for college<n><n>### ResponseA:<n>If we didn’t learn what kind of job we want in school we would probably get a job doing a job we don’t want.<n><n>###Input:Which statements about graphing an equation do you agree with? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Janet knew she was dying from her injuries because she could feel herself doing what? Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. What is the mathematical form of the equation to represent the best product? It's more than just two times thinner than the other two!<n><n>### Rationales:Thin-moderate(a)/thick-moderate(b)=>>thin-moderate/thick-moderate=a/b<n><n>The equation is (a/b).<n><n>1/b=A is less than 2(A/B).<n>So a/b is less than 2 (1/A is less than 1/B).<n><n>1/2.5=1/2.46=0.404.<n><n>#### 404<n>Answer: 4.04<n><n>### Instructions:Complete the following.<n><n>### Input:"A:  $20.00  B: $18.25  C: $16.45  D: $14.67  E: $12.90<n><n>### Demos:"A:  $17.xx  B: $17.xx"<n><n>### Write:Answer.<n><n>### 1<n><n>### Answer:$17.45<n><n>### Input:{4 213 {52 { {74} {81 8 } { < 8> }161 {179 {185 {200 A: > <6> }235 { <2> }264 } <5> }314<n><n>### Demoser:<n><n>### Write:{102 314<n>514<n>6<n><n>### Rationale:<n><n>### For 5:  ( {22} > ({45 223 {223 = {22 * {11 = 137} 41 = 222 = 405 }<n><n>### For A: (38<n><n>### Ranswers:<n><n>### Answer:384
