If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:They checked the weather one more time during the flight, they were on their way to paradise and wanted it to what? Choices:  A: look beautiful B: be happy C: change quickly D: occur here E: surprise us<n><n>### Response:		E<n><n>### Input : They checked the weather one more <n>time during the flight, they  were on their way to <n>paradise and wanted it to  what?<n><n><n>#### A: Look beautiful<n>#### B: Be happy<n>####  C: Change quickly<n>####  D: Incur here<n>####  E: surprise us<n>A : The answer is A i.e. look beautiful.<n><n>### Input A farmer wants to know how much money he will save by buying 200 dozen eggs in bulk at 120 eggs for $29.95. The farmer is charging $4.38 for 12 eggs.<n><n>#### Question: How much money, in dollars, will the farmer save by buying in bulk?<n><n>#### Answer: 940<n><n>### Input There are 255 students  in a class, and their teacher wants to know how many students are enrolled in her class. How many students are enrolled?<n><n>#### Q : How many students are enroled in her class?<n>#### A : The answer is 255 i.e, all students are enrolled.<n><n>### D<n>#### <n><n>### Input<n>Brian wants to know if there are any odd numbers between 100 and 150. Which of the following is a valid response that is the correct answer to Brian’s question? Choose all that apply.<n><n>#### A: 112<n>#### B: 133<n>#### C: 151<n>#### D: 152<n><n>#### Answer: All these are valid response  i.e 112, 133, 151 and 152 are valid response. All have 40 or greater and are odd numbers between 150 and 99<n><n><n><n><n><n>### Input D: 150<n><n>### A: $132.00<n><n>### B: $40.00<n><n>#### A: $13.20.<n><n>### B : $40.0<n><n>#### A : $13.2<n><n><n>### D: 151
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:What has a master of their craft done about that craft? Choices:  A: drill B: committed murder most vile C: bargemaster D: learn E: understand<n><n>### Response:		B<n>### Instruction :Choose 1 answer from the list.<n><n>### Detailed solutions:<n><n><n>

Choices:  A: cross street B: stand upright C: speak spanish D: speak chinese E: further education<n><n>### Response:		A is correct. Everyone can do cross the street, B says that some people can't even stand upright, and C only says that some people speak spanish, but that's a different thing. A is the only one that covers everyone and not just a minority of persons in the category. And you can always find and education system that is better than the one in your country. Some people even cross the street to visit other countries! E does not include the fact it is not available to everyone. E is wrong because not everyone can afford to have education.<n><n>#### A is correct response.<n><n>### Input How many hours a week do you work? (hour count 0)<n><n>### Response 5<n><n>### Input You spend 5/8 of your salary on food<n><n>### Response After you subtract your 5/8 of salary spent on food you have 5/8 of whatever you earned left. The remainder is 5/8 of 5/8 of what you earned:<n>#### 5/8*5/8<n>Answer: 5/8*3/8<n>So you subtract the 5/8 of money you spent on food from your original salary and you have $3/8 of what you originally earned. You spend 5/16 of your 3/8 on food.<n>3/8 * 5/16= <<3/8*5/16=3/8*16/8=18.75>>18.75/8=<<18.75*8>>151.25<n><n>### Instructions:A train is going 8 MPH when it passes a station and 80 minutes later at the next station, it is still going at 8 MPH. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. Choices:  A: country club B: rich person's house C: pool D: park E: fitness center<n><n>### Response:		D<n>#### D<n>Answer: D<n><n>### Input:"We tried to solve it, but we needed the second step" is written on the answer sheet.<n><n>### Response:"We tried, but we needed _____"<n><n>Rationales: To use a subtraction sentence, the answer would most likely be a subtraction sentence that gives a result of $0$.<n>If the answer is left as a complete sentence, it would imply that there is an unknown value somewhere.<n>Thus, the answer is the "second step" in a subtraction sentence.<n>#### 0<n>Answer: 0<n><n>### Input:'That' is written on the answer and the student has filled in the blank.<n><n>### Choices:"That's amazing" is written on the right but the student filled in the blank. <n><n>### Choice:"That's amazingly cool" is also written on the right but that choice is incorrect.<n><n>### Selection:"It's ___!" is also incorrect.<n><n>## Response:<n><n>#### Thats!<n><n>Answer: Thats!<n><n>### Input:$17 is written on the answer key.<n><n>###Response:$360 is written on the bubble sheet.<n><n>## Answer:<n><n>#### $360<n>Answer: $360<n><n>## Instructions:Answer the question.<n><n>1. Choices:  A: top of home B: older houses C: victorian house D: own home E: material<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>Input: What type of home is most like to have an attic full of historical items.<n>Given: Type of Home<n><n>#### A<n><n>Answer:<n><n><n>### Instructions:<n>Which of the following numbers are equivalent to 14?<n><n><div class="btn-group" data-toggle="buttons"><n><n><label class="btn btn-info active"><n><n><input type="radio" id="btn14" name="gender" value="14" checked><n><n><input type='radio' id="btn13" name="gender" data-toggle="radio" value="13" checked><n><n></label><n><n><label class='btn btn-success'><n><n><input type ='radio' id ="btn12" name="gender" checked><n><n>12<n><n></label> </div><n><n>Rationalization: <n><n>14=<<14=14>><n><n>13=<<13=13>><n><n>12=<<12=12>><n><n>We can conclude that (13=<14=14>)(13=<12=12>)(13=<<12=3>>)<n><n>#### 5<n>Answer : 5<n><n>### Instuctions:<n>A person is preparing a budget, and will need to spend money on three items. The three items cost $120.00, $150.00, and $88.00. Write a recursive algorithm that computes how much money the person will need to spend and store the result in a list.<n><n>**WARNING** This program runs in Java. If you are using a different language, you will need to adapt this program to use your code.<n><n>#### 6<n>Answer:<n><n>### Instructor:Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n><n>## Instruction:<n>Selena is preparing a budget based on the following data she obtained from her supervisor.<n><n>-	Sales for February were $20,780.<n>-	The budget for last month’s sales was $20,800, and for the year, the budget is $187,000.<n>-	Sales are predicted to increase by 
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:How is someone who loves their TV likely to feel about their remote? Choices:  A: attached B: nostalgic C: companionable D: likely E: close<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Rationale:A<n><n>### Rationales:A choice that is attached, nostalgic,  companionable, or  likely probably  relates to people who really know the TV and its remote and use them all the time.<n>They may not be close, and they probably don't like it,  but they are very familiar with and accustomed to their viewing experience.<n>They may even know the name of their TV and remote,  such as Lucy's television set in the movie _I Love Lucy_ or the remote control on _Malcolm in the Middle_.<n>Someone who is close, however, is a very affectionate  person who is attached and very familiar with their remote and TV,  but whose affection does not stop there.<n>They will probably be close to every member of their family.<n>While being companionable is an excellent trait,  it refers to a person who enjoys being with people, which  is admirable; however, a close person will be fond of others  too.<n><n>#### A<n>Answer: A<n><n>### Input<n>> I'll be there in 20 minutes<n><n>### Task:<n>> How many minutes will he be there?<n><n>### Rules:<n>> Do not include units in your answer.<n><n>### Solution:<n>> 020 = 020<n><n>#### 020<n>Answer: 0<n><n>### Instructions<n>Input: The car renting company you went with charges $8.99/mile for the first 50 miles and $0.09/mile for every additional mile. Write a sentence that describes the additional trip in a logical way.<n><n>### Task<n>Input: The car rental company charges $8.95 per mile for the first 55 miles. What is the total cost of driving 43.6 miles?<n><n>### Input A: What is the speed, in miles per hour, you need to ride to go to the airport?<n>### Input B: Write a sentence that describes driving.<n><n>### Input C: Drive to the airport. What does it mean when they say the price of rental cars will be 7% less than what they were last year?<n><n>### Instractions<n>* Answer in words what does it mean to rent a car
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:The camper looked up at the vast night sky, it left him feeling mighty what? Choices:  A: unimportant B: insignificant C: stellar D: somewhat E: helpless<n><n>### Response:		<n>Based on the story below, write a response that appropriately answers the question about the night sky.<n>I have never felt as helpless as I did at midnight under the vast night sky.  Stars seemed to be falling upon us!  It was terrifying.  Everyone was screaming and scrambling for the nearest building to hide under.  At first, I thought I was mistaken.  But then, I felt it...the tickling on my skin.  It was raining stars!  It was just like in the movies, but I couldn't think of a good plot twist to go with it.  So I ran for a building.  It seemed to take forever to get to the building.  I looked up as I ran and saw that there were stars everywhere.  But, as I ran, my leg caught on a root, or something, and I ended up falling. Then the rain got even heavier.  It must have been the beginning of a hurricane, but it was as cold as ice.  That is until the rain began to fall.  I finally got into the building, a cemetery I'd noticed along the way.  I crawled towards an open grave and got in.  I didn't feel any warmer, though.  I was freezing.  The rain stopped but the whole sky was black now.  The only thing you could see was lightning.  It was the scariest thing ever.  Suddenly, I heard footsteps.  Then I saw a shadow.  It was the Gruncher, the scariest monster that ever lived.  He was even scarier because he was in a mask!  And behind him were all his monster friends!  Their bodies were all messed up and one even had a bunch of sticks and leaves stuck to him.  I've never felt so scared in my life. The Grunchers were coming at me with their strange weapons and I didn't know what to do.  I knew I had to get out of the grave I was in or I would be eaten.  And that would be even scarier than the Grunchers!  So then, I ran into the shadows behind the tombstones.  It was so dark I couldn't see my hand in front of my face.  It felt like forever, but in the end
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:To properly instruct children attending school you would need a great deal of what? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Mom is tidying a house, where would she put the loose dictionary? Choices:  A: shelf B: library C: classroom D: table E: desk<n><n>### Response:		I would store the loose dictionary on A, the shelf<n><n>### Rationale:Dictionaries are large books that give you meanings of every word in a language.<n>Since they are large the desk or table may be difficult to hold the dictionary.<n>The other choice is library as in a building where they hold lots of books, however, that is a place where people look for books for reading.<n>The choice is A, a shelf.<n><n>### Input:"My dog ate my homework. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:John joined the army because he wanted to see the world.  When the fighting started, he only saw what sort of things? Choices:  A: fort B: orphans C: battlefield D: other countries E: war<n><n>### Response:		A fort<n><n>### Answer:<n>The answer that describes a task.<n><n>### Input16:<n>1)  Rationales 7x12 = <<7*12=84>>84 miles.<n>2)  Rationales A. $ 20.00 B. $ 400.00 C. 2346.00 D.  $ 6,150.00<n>3)   Rationales $5 $15 $40 $25 $200 $50<n>4) Rationales 60 miles/hour 1 hour 20 hours<n>5)  Rationales The total would be 13.<n><n>### Answer16:<n>A. 20<n>B. 40<n>C.200<n>D.15<n><n>

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:what happens to a company when it is bankrupt? Choices:  A: liquidated B: own resources C: branch out D: commit crime E: game over<n><n>### Response:		<n>Let’s define what this all means first. Firstly, let’s go to a dictionary to learn the definition of a branch-out.<n><n>\`\`\`\-dictionary.com\`\`\-\`<n><n>\`\ `Branch\`Out\`\<n>1. Extend; grow\<n>2. Become branch\`out\`d; spread\`\<n>\`\`,\`\`<n><n>Let’s look at the definition of a bankruptcy now.<n><n>\`www.dictionary.com\`<n><n>A bankruptcy or insolvency situation involving a person or other entity that is unable to pay debts within a certain period.<n><n>\`Based on these definitions, it seems that a company is bankrupt when it is unable to pay for something, such as a loan.<n><n>We’ll continue the response later…<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Use the following diagram to answer the following multiple choice questions.<n><n>### Diagram:<n>A diagram is presented that gives the lengths of the pins of a pinball game, their positions on a side of the game board and their starting values.<n><n>A diagram is presented. We’re told that the side of the gameboard is a right angled triangle. The lengths of the pins are given for each end and the starting value of the pins is also given.<n><n>The first step in solving this problem is to first note the lengths given. They are all given from the top of the side of the game board to the bottom of the side of the gamboboard. Using Pythagoras, we can find the diagonal length of the side of the board. That’s the first answer. Let’s call that x. Let’s call the remaining information from that diagram y and z, since they are lengths.<n><n>\`y=8\`<n>\`z=7\`<n><n>Let\`\`y=8, z=7<n>Next, we will use that information to find the answer to each part of the multiple choice answers for this one.<n><n>#### 1.What is the diagonal length of the game board?<n><n>\`y+z=15\`<n><n>\`8+7=15\`\<n>\`-\`<n><n>#### 2.

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur. Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Subtraction is indicated by $<n><n>## Input:8-$<Subtract 5>=$3<n><n>## Output:$<Subtract 100>$90<n><n>The question above is 8 + negative 5.<n>You can use this method to subtract a negative multiple choice question.
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:What would a document be if it is not obtuse? Choices:  A: pointed B: bright C: easy D: clear E: acute angled<n><n>### Response:		A: E F G H J K N O P Q<n><n>### Democracy:<n><table><tr><td>Rationales: </td><td>The letter 'E' is written by the English letters E. 'E' is obtuse for its alphabet.<n>Obtuse is not necessarily the same as blunt. 'E' is oblique. It's 'E' is not angulated in respect to the vertical.<n></td></tr></table><table><tr><td rowspan='2'> </td><td>Answer: E</td></tr><tr><td> </td></tr><tr></tr></table><n><n>### Democrat:<n><table><caption>DEMOCRACY?</caption><tr><td rowspans='2'>A: E F G<n>H J K N O P R S T </td><td>G</td><tr/><n><table><tr/><n></table><n><n>## Cryptic Crosswords<n>Cryptic crosswords (crosswords where there are clues) are very popular in the UK.<n>Each clue will lead to a word or a phrase so that at the end you should have a sentence that makes sense,<n>and you should be able to check whether the letters you have filled in are correct.<n><n>The crossword below is cryptic, and you have to work out what it means.<n><n>### Crossword:<n><table><thead><tr><th width='120'>Letter</th><th width='100'>Hints</th></tr></thead><tr><td row='0'>1</td><td>Word that is said to be in front of you (6)</td></tr><td row='1'>7</td><td>Part of a door that swings (5)</td></tr><n><tr><td>8</td><td>Woman with a lot of hair not wearing a hat (5)</td><td row='7'></td></tr><n></table><n><table><thead><n><tr><th width='200'>Answers</th><th width="350">Word Play</th></tr><n></thead><n><tr><n><td row='0' colspan='2'><n><table><tbody><n><tr><
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Where is a note likely to indicate a melody? Choices:  A: fridge B: a classroom C: envelope D: medical chart E: sheet music<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Instructions:<n>#### A<n>#### F<n>#### B<n>#### D<n>#### C<n>### Instrucution:<n>#### G<n>#### H<n>#### E<n>#### A<n>#### B<n><n>### The instructions are below. Write a response in your own words that appropriately completes each request.<n><n>## Instruction:<n>#### D<n>Input: The sum has 14 digits.<n>One  of the digits is a 6, and the other  is an 8.<n>What is the sum?<n>Rationales<n>The number of digits is even so it is a pair 3,3 and the sum is 9<n><n>#### B<n><n>15-13=3, 15-14=<1-3=2><n><n>37+10=<1+7=8> 8 is two digits 5 is one digit 5+5=<5+5=10> <n><n>5 is the smallest and so is the other one 5+7=<1+7><n><n>10-5=<1><n><n>7-5=<1-5=3><n><n>#### A<n><n>13 and 14 is the answer which are 3 digits<n><n>#### D<n><n>Four<n><n>One is less  than <n>4<n><n>14<n>8<n><n>#### E<n><n>6 digits with 3 as the smallest  or  1 digit with 6 as the smallest<n><n>#### A<n>

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:The child pounded his mitt in excitement while enjoying his first game in the bleachers where? Choices:  A: football stadium B: laboratory C: baseball stadium D: pharmacy E: soccer game<n><n>### Response:		D – The word “stadium” is in D and soccer is in E.<n><n>### Input A: 7 boys and 8 girls rode bicycles across the state line.  How many miles long was the trip with bikes? Choices: 1: 25 bikes 2: 5 bikes 3: 7 bikes 4: 3 bikes 5: 8 bikes<n><n>### Response A: B – Answer choice 1 does not fit since only 1 or 2 bikes are across the boundary. Answer choice 2 is not correct since you must go back and forth.  Answer choices 3 and 5 are correct.<n><n>### input B: Which of the following can be read in reverse? Choices: - a. b. c. d. e.<n>Rationales: - 3425 – reverse 2543 is not correct. - 401 – reverse is 140 is not correct – 1235 – reverse is 5321 is not correct. - reverse of 3201 means 1321 – this is correct<n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:The spoiled child's playroom was massive, but only one of many rooms in the what? Choices:  A: big house B: nursery school C: preschool D: building E: retirement home<n><n>### Response:		E: building<n><n><n>### InputThe spoiled child'sclayroom was massive, but the only one of many rooms<n>in the what? His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. Choices:  A: throw things B: play sports C: play games D: play ball E: play chess<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>### Instructions: Read each statement carefully and decide whether each one tells the reader how to respond to a request.<n><n>## 1. I thought about how you said earlier that we could have the party in the park.<n>This statement supports the request made earlier by providing an idea for how to respond to the request.<n><n>**Example: "Let's use the park as the place for the party." "I thought about how you said that the park would be a good place for the party." = Support**<n><n>## 2. I didn’t realize that the band was too loud to sing.<n>This statement supports a request that was not made earlier by informing someone who is making the request. It provides information that might not otherwise have been known by someone making the request.<n><n>```Example:<n>You: "I hope you like the music I put on. I can't really hear it but maybe it will be OK anyway."<n>Me: "I didn't realize how loud it was. It was fine for me." = Support**<n>```<n><n>## 3. You are asking me the same question and I already said that!<n><n>### Inappropriate:<n><n>### Appropriate:<n><n>**Example: _You are asking me the same thing you asked when we first met. I already told you!_ = Respond**<n><n>### Instructor Directions:<n>In this exercise, you will read texts and decide if each statement supports or responds to a request.

Another bus leaves Chicago 5:00pm.  What is the earliest time that both buses will meet<n><n>### Rationales: In order to answer this we need to know that the two cities are 1151 miles away from each other.<n><n>In order to solve  for the earliest time they can meet we need to take the first bus time and subtract the second bus time, 9-17=<<9-5*7=17>>17<n><n>Thus, 9-10=<<9-10=1>>1<n><n>Thus, we found the time that the buses will meet in the future and not in the past.<n><n>#### 17<n>Answer: 17<n><n>

If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:The person knew the police were after him, so what did he do? Choices:  A: the sun B: catch cold C: prepare to go D: feel humiliated E: hunt for food<n><n>### Response:		The correct response was answer letter D: feel humiliate<n><n>### Input:[Anna is selling chairs in the flea market. She knows that these chairs cost $120 if she purchases them from the manufacturer. She also knows that she does not want to sell them for less than $50. If it costs her $10 to move the chairs to the flea market, what is the most that she could sell them for and still make a profit. ] Answer:600<n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Where would you get a bass clarinet to take home? Choices:  A: orchestra B: school band C: music store D: opera house E: home<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Instructions: Which of the following is equivalent to.2%?<n><n>### Demostration:<n><n>### Equivalent to:<n>####.2% =.002<n><n>### Multiple choice answer: B<n><n>### Instuctions: In the expression, x + 10, the variable ‘x’ is called:<n><n>### Demstration:<n><n>## multiple choice answer: A<n><n>### Instrutions: Write two expressions that are equal.<n><n>### Demo:<n><n>Expressions that are equal:<n>2x=6xy 2=6y    24=6y<n>y=44   6y=8y    15=4y<n><n>### Insttructions: Rearrange two different expressions according to the first expression that is displayed on the right.<n><n>### Rearranged expression: 1-3x<n><n>### Demo<n><n>1-3x=2x-2x  1+1 = 2<n>1/3-3/(8-1) =  2<n><n>### Instructins: Write an expression that represents 48 in a multiplication set.<n><n>### Response<n><n>48 = 8 x 6<n><n>### Instutrions: Find the value of b:<n><n>### Demo response: 12<n><n>### Demo answer: b=<n><n>## Instructions: Find which expression that is equivalent to<n><n>## Demo response: 1000<n><n>## Solution: 1 + (1 - 2)(1 - 3)( … - (100 - 99) )<n><n>## Instrucions: Place the numbers 1 through 6 in order for the first 6 digits of the number 1,029,009,100.<n><n>## Solution:<n><n>Write 1,02 through 1,05 on paper and place them in order.<n><n>## Instrucitons: Find 3 + 3 + 3<n><n>## Demo respnse: 9<n><n>## Demo answer<n>3+3+3=<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:An electronics store had things damaged from the rain, where should these things be stored? Choices:  A: large city B: strip mall C: building D: shopping mall E: aquarium<n><n>### Response:		<n>```<n>Input:An electronics store has items damaged from the rain.<n><n>Choice A: large city (653 words):<n>An electronics store is made up of a whole area that is used to sell electronics.<n>Most electronics stores are located in a large city with lots of people in the area.<n><n>choice B: strip mall (490 words):<n>Electronics stores are often found in a strip mall.<n>A strip mall is a large shopping center that has multiple stores connected and located in one place.<n><n>Choice C: building (464 words):<n>An electronica store is often located in a building.<n>The building can be located either in a large city, a strip mall, or other places.<n><n>Choice D: shopping malls (455 words):<n>A shopping mall is where electronic stores are often located.<n><n>Choice E: aquarium (453 words)<n>An aquarium is a place where people go to see water animals while they are at a shopping mall.<n>```<n>####Answers:<n>`Choice A: large city:  (194 words)`, `Choice D: shopping Mall: (155 words)`, `Choice B: strip mall: (153 words)`, `Choice C: Building: (119 words)`, `Choice E: Aquarium: (38 words)`<n>####Answer:  A: large City<n><n>### Instructions:<n>1) Use mathematical symbols that are familiar to you to complete the statement.<n><n>### Example:<n>35a ²/30a ³ =____/ 35a =<n><n>### Submission:<n>> The answer is:<n>`b = a**0 (9/4)`<n><n>### Instrumented Solutions:<n><n>### Instructor:<n>You are requested to complete the following calculation. Choices:  A: vent B: think C: shouting D: work off E: exercise<n><n>### Response:		<n>\textbf{A:}  The \textbf{answer is A.}<n><n>### Rationale: This question is related to kinetic energy (the energy stored in an object because of its motion).  K. Energy released in your muscles is exothermic (energy released in an external form, e.g. heat).<n><n>### Input:# of days since May 12, 2011<n><n>### Answer #<n>125, 146, 80, etc.  <n><n>### What are the first and last day of the year where the month is not a multiple of 30?<n><n>### Rationales:<n><n>- The first day of the year where month is not a multiple is March 1st<n>- The last day of the year (December 31st) is the last day of a month (so multiple)<n>- Since you don't want the same number, if month is a multiple, the year must not be a multiple<n>- We don't want March 1st or February 30th, either, since they won't be the first day of the year<n>- February 29th won't be the last day of the year<n><n>I.E. Year 1 is not a multiple of (12 months), year 2 is not a multiple of, and since 30 and 60 days is 12 months, multiple, we can't go any further<n><n>so since the 1st of year 1 is on a month that isn't a multiple, and year 1 is not a month multiple year 1 is not 12 months (1-720?)<n><n>### Solution:<n><n>365-30*12 = 30<n><n>### Input:$1.16+$4.07=$5.23<n><n>$1.16+$13.73=$14.99<n><n>### Input$16.94-2.67=$14.27<n><n>$16.99-$3.22=$13.77<n><n>### Input-1 $16.99-2.67=[$14.27], 2 $16.94-$2.67=14.

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Someone who is awake is likely to know what's going on because they are this? Choices:  A: alert B: deep sleep C: drink coffee D: open eyes E: conscious<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Instructor Solution:<n>#### A<n><n>### Demonnestication:<n>#### A<n>

How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:What do humans do when in a race? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:What happens to people playing games? How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:What could be happening near you if the ground is getting wet? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:A water spout was seen in the ocean off the coast of what? Choices:  A: florida B: basement C: sink D: beach E: fountain<n><n>### Response:		<n>A: florida<n><n>### Instructions<n><n>If each car in a caravan can travel 60kph, and there are 14 cars in a caravan, how long will it take for the caravan to travel the 21km from the car park to the start of the hike.<n><n>#### 60<n><n>Answer:<n><n>19<n><n>### Solution<n><n>Rates - Speed = distance covered in x amount of time<n>$${14 \cdot 60 \over 100}$$ = ${840 \over 1 \cdot 100 }$$<n>$${840 \over {1 \cdot 150 }}$$<n>$${5 \cdot 840 \over{19}}$$<n>$${46 \over 1}$$<n>$${0 \cdot 60}$$<n>$${84 \over 4}$$<n>$${21 \over 2} =$$<n>$${10 \over 1}$$<n>$$$21$$$<n>### Instrucciones<n><n>Colección de letras que representan números enteros de 1 a 75. ¿Que es el orden de la colección?<n><n>### Respuesta<n><n>$$<n>\begin{pmatrix}<n>N1&N2&N3&N4&N5&N6&N7<n>\end{pmatrix}<n>=<n>\begin{pmatrix}\cdot\cdot\cdot\cdot<n> \cdot\cdot\cdot \cdot\cdot\end{pmatrix} \<n>$$<n><n>### Instraciones<n><n>Un vendedor en una tienda está vendiendo un producto. El producto le cuesta $25.00. El vendedor vende productos a $0.50 más que lo que le cuesta, e ingresa los siguientes de $438.09. Cuál es el número de $0.50 que el vendedor ganó?<n><n>### Response<n><n>${438 \over 400}$ = $0.5$<n><n>### Instrirucciones<n><n>La vendedora tiene cincuenta ventanas en la tienda. Le cuestan cada uno de los ventanas $10.00. Ella vende el do
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:what is the goal of going jogging? How long will it take this runner to run 5090 feet?<n><n>### Response :<n><n>60 X 5 = 300ft/minute, 300 X 5 =1500ft/5minute/mile = 300 ft/second<n><n>5090 = 1500 seconds ≈ 25 minutes<n><n>### Input(Golf) :  in 5 min,a golfer can drive the ball 360 yards,in three minutes, he can drive it 1100 yards what is the approximate time it takes this golfer to drive 2500 yards.<n><n>### Response<n><n> 5 minute X 10 yards ÷ 3 = 30Yards/ min<n><n>2500 = 105 Minutes = 1.75hr<n><n>### Input (football): if during a football game it takes three minutes to complete a quarter, how many minutes are there in a game?<n><n>###Response<n><n> there are 3 quarters each with 15 min = 45 min<n><n> ## #Input -  "The car is designed to travel at 60 m.p.h. for 500,000 miles before needing major repairs.<n><n>###response<n>40,000,00miles ≈ 50,000 yrs<n><n>###Input -  A plane can fly at 650 m.p.s. when the wind speed is blowing at 25.m.p.h.
