Multiplying a fraction by a number requires that the divisor be whole, so it is always best to simplify the problem with the numbers you are trying to multiply by a fraction.<n><n>__EXAMPLE__<n><n>18 divided by 4 gives 4, but 18 times 3/4 is 6 2/3. 18 times 10 is 180<n>__EXAMPLE 2__<n><n>56 divided by 1/4 gives 56, but 56 times 6/4 is 16.<n>__EXAMPLE3__<n><n>64 divided by 32 gives 2, but 64 times 1/32 is 2 with no remainder, or a factor of 1. 64 times 32 is 20736.<n><n>#### 10/3<n><n>#### Answer: <n>Explanation: <n>Simplify: <n>10 times 3/3 is 50<n><n>### Input 2:<n>The cost for a family of five to ride the gully whieper at the local theme park is $18.00 if two or more ride.  The regular price per person is $3.00 per person.  How much less does it cost a family of five to take an extra five thrill rides?<n><n>### Answer: $30.00<n><n><n>### Input3:<n><n>The local diner has a special offer during the week: Buy a

How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:How does a flea locomote? Choices:  A: attack B: suck blood C: stay D: lay eggs E: jump<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>#### E<n>Answer: E<n><n>### Input:(3(x)) - 2(x) =-4 <n>Answer: x=(3x-4)/x<n><n>### Input:-2<=>-2<2<n>Answer: <2<n><n>### Instructions: Answer the following multiple choice question<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Input: If a car is traveling at 60mph, and an accident takes place, how many hours will the police take to arrive? Choices: A: 30 minutes B: 60 minutes C: 120 minutes D: 360 minutes E: 1080 minutes F: 1920 minutes G: 2400 minutes H: all choices are correct<n><n>### Response  : G<n><n>#### G<n>Answer: G<n><n>### Input : The cost of filling a tank of gas is $100. For each additional gallon, the price increases by $1.  How many gallons of gas can a driver put in the tank?<n>####<n>Answer: 0<n><n>### Input <n>$50 a gallon<n>####<n>Answer: $25<n><n>### Input<n>Car: $20 a gallon<n><n>####<n>Answer:<n>$10<n><n>### Question<n>When you go to the DMV to get a license or register a car, how much money do you end up paying?<n><n>### Answer<n>I think $50<n><n>The state has a $25 registration fee, and $25 for driver’s ed (plus you need to buy a 25 buck book too, and pass a test).<n><n>### Instructon:<n>The following is a mathematical equation. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Sam was against Allison's decision.  Joe was the opposite.  What was Joe, regarding that decision? Choices:  A: being for B: away from C: combined D: for or E: conjunction<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>### Input : The banking law states that if you make a minimum of 36 monthly payments, then your loan will be paid off.  How many payments will be needed if the loan is for $42,777.00?<n><n>### Demolition : 50% of 48 x 2<n><n>### Response : 95.52 payments<n><n>### Input  : How much money does Sheri have to borrow from the bank? The bank charges 8% annual interest on the principal borrowed. She has no account balance.<n><n>### Response  : Sheri has to borrow an amount of money. The bank charges 8%. She has no account balance, and she must have an amount of money. That's the principle because she must have that money and the interest on the principal.<n><n>### Input   : A 1999 Toyota Avalon was sold for a total of $10,468.30. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Where could you find a bookstore? Choices:  A: town B: carpeting C: city D: phone book E: magazines<n><n>### Response:		You should read one of the books that you have.<n><n>### Rationale: The answer is 'D'.<n>

How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Which effect of stress could cause death if not treated immediately? Choices:  A: age grieving person B: heart attacks C: depression D: hair loss E: headache<n><n>### Response:		<n>The correct answer was B (heart attacks)<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following question or incomplete task.<n><n># Hurricane Sandy<n>A hurricane is approaching and you are looking for shelter. You decide to seek refuge at the local community center in Queens.  It is open around the clock. How much shelter will you be inundated with, given that this service is available to you in one-minute increments?<n><n># Restaurant Reviews<n>Several hundred new web sites are appearing that claim to provide honest reviews of restaurants.  You want your site to stand out from the crowd.  Given each web site receives $100 in advertising revenue for every positive (5-star) review, how much would your site earn if it posted 5 reviews of the food at a single restaurant that are all 5-star reviews?  Assumption: Advertising revenue will only come if web sites post positive reviews.<n><n># Writer's Block<n><n>There's a lot of hype about people having to deal with so called writer's block.  To deal with this situation, you've decided to write a short essay on the cause(s) associated with this phenomenon.  To simplify the task, you have decided to only write about the cause, not the cure.  However, you know from experience that writing about the cause is often less effective than writing about the cure.<n><n>So, how many words would you likely write if the topic of choice was the cure, rather than the cause?<n><n># Inventor<n>Roger was recently diagnosed with OCD and given a $100,000.00 stipend from the US Government to spend on his ideas for new technologies.  Unfortunately, a large share of his funding comes from his health plan.  <n><n>If Roger had spent 1/4 of the funding purchasing a car, what is the percentage of funds that would have been spent on his ideas for new technology if Roger had invested the funds at an annual rate of 4%?<n><n>Ask for the problem to be clarified.<n><n>Solution (1):<n>```<n>Solution (2):<n>```<n><n>### Instution:Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n><n>Solution 2:<n><n>Input: A
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Where might you have cake with your ice cream? Choices:  A: earth B: movie C: party D: served cold E: freezer<n><n>### Response:		Ice cream is served cold.<n><n>### Why?<n>The ice-cream in the question is'served cold'. So, it is'served' in cold things. There is only a chance that something cold can be something different than cold, then it is cold too.<n><n>### Rationales<n>1. The word cold is in the sentence. Since the word is the same as what is asked in the question, the choice must be false.<n>2. The word cold is an adjective. Because it is an adjective, it describes the noun. The word cold is not given any noun to describe.<n><n>### Input1:Which is a better way to keep the temperature of your room cool when it is hot: Keep the windows open or close them and turn on the air conditioner?<n><n>### Response2:Close them and turn on the A/C.<n><n>### Your input is wrong! In 35 minutes, the bus makes 26 stops. When it comes to her stop, it takes Diana 5 minutes to get to the bus stop. How many minutes has the bus traveled when Diana reaches the bus stop?<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Input:  Diana lives 3 miles from the nearest bus stop. It takes 5 minutes to walk from her house to the bus stop. The bus she takes travels at 30 miles per hour.  Diana's favorite bus driver has the following routine.<n>1.  Every 30 minutes, he leaves the bus station with an empty bus. He always leaves with an empty bus.<n>2.  He makes exactly 26 stops between the station and where he starts to pick up passengers.<n>3.  Each stop takes him exactly 5 minutes to make.<n>4.  He must complete picking up all his passengers from the bus stop where Diana lives and return to the bus station in 35 minutes in order to make sure all his passengers are where they need to be at their next scheduled stops.<n>5.  In the 35 minutes that it takes to complete this trip, it is safe to assume that each minute he has spent driving in those 35 minutes has taken him the same distance from his bus station to Diana's house, or from her house to his bus station. So if he spent 5 minutes at Diana's stop, that means he must have started to make the 26 stops with passengers before he arrived at Diana's house.<n>Rationales: 1. Every time he leaves the bus station he has an empty bus.<n><n>2.  He goes through 26 stops so that 26*5=<<26*5=130>>130 minutes are taken at the stops and he is done in 35-

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Where could you find some large pieces of paper that are not for sale? Choices:  A: cabinet B: computer printer C: suitcase D: office supply store E: artist's studio<n><n>### Response:		If A, C and D are incorrect, the answer will be a computer printer or suitcase.The answer could be B, but A, C & D are all incorrect.<n>### B<n>#### B<n>Answer: B<n><n>### Input<n>Some time ago, I borrowed $350.00 from the bank to buy a lawn mower. The loan had a 4.5% annual interest rate and was repaid in 8.25 years. For simplicity, assume that all interest due is paid each year, not compounded.<n><n>1. How much does interest owing on the original debt when the loan matures plus the principal, in dollars?<n>2. How much does interest paid on the loan during the life of the loan, in dollars?<n><n>#### A<n>#### Answer: A<n><n>### Input 1: How much does interest owed on the original debt (the principal) when the loan matures, in dollars?<n>The principal is 350*3.5%/100 = 350*0.045/100 = $256.<n><n>#### A<n>Answer: $256<n><n>### Input Number 2: How much does interest paid by yourself on the loan during its life?<n>The number of years is the total years minus the last full year. Therefore, 163/12 = 13.5 months / year.<n>163 x 0.045 = 7.445 x 13.5 = $103.0275<n><n>#### B<n>Answer:$359.0275
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Why would professionals playing sports not be able to compete? Choices:  A: pain B: mudslide C: sweating D: injuries E: rain<n><n>### Response:		<n>We may not be able to play sports because pain<n><n>### Input/instructions:A storm has flooded your home. You and your family move in with friends until your home is repaired. On the 1st day of your relocation, the family that is hosting you provides all the food that your family needs for free. On the 2nd day, each person eats 1 can of soup and 1 can of fruit for breakfast, spaghetti for lunch, and hot dogs for dinner. How many people were there in your household for the first 2 days?<n><n>### Instructions:Write a response that appropriately solves the problem<n><n>### Demostration<n>Input: <n><n>A storm has flooded our home.  We move in with friends until our home is repaired.\<n>On the first day of our relocation, our hosts provide all the food our family needs for free.  On the second day, each person eating 1 can of soup, 1 can of fruit, 1 spaghetti, and 1 hotdog.\<n>How many people were there in our household for the first 3 days?<n>Rationales First can of fruit is one can of fruit<n>First can of soup is one can of soup<n>Second day each person ate one can of soup and one can of fruit<n>A family of 3 would eat 1 can of soup for 1 day and 2 cans of soup total for 2 days<n>And 1 can of fruit which would be for 1 day<n>And 3 people are in my family, 1 day of fruit, 2 days of soup and 3 people for the second day<n><n>#### 7<n><n>Answer: 7<n><n>#### Input:For the past 5 days, each of her clients has requested that Mary charge $15.00/hour before 6:00 p.m., and $10.00/hour after 6:00 pm. How much will Mary have earned in total since last Sunday?<n>#### Answer: 160<n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:James's bouncing rubber balls were at rest, and so he could sleep.  He would get up in the morning, and then put them in what state again? Choices:  A: upside down B: in motion C: active D: wakefulness E: resthold<n><n>### Response:		(D-wakefulness)<n><n>### Explanation: The rubber balls are at rest and he can sleep. So they are no longer in motion as in Choice B. Also the rubber balls are not active as in Choice C. They are already in motion so upside down is out as in Choice A. So he just wakes up in the morning and puts them in a state of rest, therefore Choice E is the correct answer.<n><n><n>

What is a factor of 160?<n><n>### Response A.80 (or 80 is a factor of 80)<n><n>Cause: If you take both factors and combine them, you get  160.<n><n>Effect: 160 is a factor of  160.

Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:The shore was now a tourist attraction with nearby little shops, but at one time this what was home to a bustling fishing industry? Choices:  A: seaside town B: resort C: ocean D: california E: beach<n><n>### Response:		The shore was now a touristic attraction with nearby little shop<n><n>```ruby<n><n>if option == 'A' || option == 'B'<n>  puts 'option selected'<n>else<n>  puts 'Wrong option!'<n>end<n><n>```<n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:When someone falls from a mountain it will lead them to? Choices:  A: too much B: act dead C: die D: rush E: explode<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Instructions: Answer the follwing multiple choice question and choose the one correct answer.<n><n>Input: Two identical 8-foot pieces of wood are laid together to form a board 16 feet in length. One had an odometer reading of 193 and the other was 234.  Which car is newer?<n>The question is written in the following format: 193 > or > (in front of 234) <n><n>Rationales: We are told the higher number is newer than the lower number <n>```sh<n>193 > 234<n>```<n>Therefore 234 is the older age<n>#### 1<n>Answer: This is the older of the 2 and the response to this is 1<n><n>Input: What is five hundred dollars and ten cents divided by three?<n>Input: What is 169 added to 150?<n><n>### Response 2:<n><n>### Input 1:<n><n>### Instuctions:Answer the follwing multiple-choice question.(Write the number for the correct answer in the space next to the question.)<n><n>Output A: 179 Input A: 510 Output A: 899 Input A: 1048 Output A: 12314 Input A: 5204 Output A: 17070<n><n>### Input B<n><n>### Instutions: Answer the follwoing multiple-choice question. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:There was a saucepan used only for marinara, where was it kept? Choices:  A: georgia B: the south pole C: kitchen cupboard D: italian restaurant E: boil eggs<n><n>### Response:		The saucepan was located in the kitchen cupboard<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Input: It cost $2.16 to ship a book you purchased at the university bookstore. How much tax was charged?<n><n>### Rationales:<n>If it cost $2.11 to ship, then there was a shipping charge of 50&gt;=.15(50% of 1.16 is.15)&gt;=.15<n>&gt;This implies there was a tax of.15.<n>The final answer is.15(1-.15)/.5= 287.<n><n><n>#### 287<n>### Answer:<n>Input: There were 17 apples in a bowl, and 7 were eaten. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Where is a system of electronic devices likely to be used in school? Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. The net income is $~31,820.<n><n># 8.8. A Math Test <n>### Input:<n><n>### Response<n><n>### Input - Math Test - Fractions<n>Given the following rules:<n><n>Fractions are divided out.<n>Fractions are multiplied out.<n><n>Explain how to solve the fractions.<n>1. (4 - 1 = 3) - (x - y = 5)<n>2. (2/3) x y<n>3. (3 + 2) x 2<n><n>### Answer<n><n>#### Problem 1<n><n><n>```<n>    (4 - 1) - (x - 5)<n>      3 - 4<n>```<n><n>#### Problem 2<n><n><n>```<n>       (2/3) * y<n>    `4/3`<n>```<n><n>#### Rational<n><n><n>```<n>     3 / 4<n>```<n>```<n>(2/3)*(3/4)=5/12<n>```<n><n>### Input Math Test - Long Division<n><n>**A) Show an example of how to conduct a long division procedure using a calculator.**<n><n>```<n>    9 ÷ 3<n>```<n><n>```<n>   7-1 <n>   6 <n>```<n><n>````<n>0 <n>```<n><n>**B
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:What is someone watching a person who is playing guitar doing? Choices:  A: auditioning B: hear sounds C: listening to music D: making music E: arthritis<n><n>### Response:		A(A is for auditioning)<n><n>### Input and Response:<n>#### Question<n>What is someone watching a musician playing guitar doing?  Choices: A:  auditioning B:  hear sounds C:  listening to music D:  making music E:  arthritis<n>#### Your Choice<n><n>```<n>A<n>```<n><n>### Input<n>#### Question<n>What song is the lead vocalist for this band singing? Choices: A:   The way you are B:   Don’t wanna be your lover C:   The way you made me feel D:   My love ANSWERS AT THE END OF THE POST<n>#### Your Choice A-D<n><n>```<n>A-D<n>```<n><n>## Input:<n><n>In response to the lead singer’s choice, the audience is sure to be cheering and dancing in the aisles.<n><n>### Question<n>What song is singing in the choir?  Choices:  A.  How great thine art B.   Praise the Lord C.  The battle Hymn of freedom D.  I can’t make you love me<n><n>### Question B and Response:<n><n>### Input C and Answer:<n>C(C is for Praise the Lord)<n><n>### Answer:<n><n>#### What song is singing in the Choir?<n><n>*A: How great thine art*<n>*B: Praise the Lord*<n>*C: In my opinion the battle hymn of freedom*<n>*D: I can’t make love to you*.<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:James thought that giving the AI a secular upbringing would be the better choice.  He felt that the alternative might have results that were too what? Choices:  A: eternal B: religious C: unpredictable D: holy E: monastic<n><n>### Response:		James felt that the secular upbringings will results that might unpredictable.<n><n>### Input : <n>Input: A babysitter is typically paid based on the age of the baby she babysits.  A baby that is 3 months old costs $15.00 per hour to babysit.  From there, the cost goes down one dollar each additional four months.  What is the cost ($102) of a baby that is 3.5 months old?<n><n>### Rationales:If the time is 3.2 months she has to pay one dollar extra than baby which is 3 months and it is $15 so it will be $16.00<n>If the time is 4.3 months it will be $19.00.<n>If she had a new born then it will be $25$<n>If her age is exactly $3$ she has to pay $15.0.<n>Therefore the ans is$15+14.97+14.85+14.78=102.13$ or 102 $<n><n>### Answer: 102<n><n>###Input:A bus rental service charges $30/hour plus 30 cents per mile.  A customer has a large event, and he wants to rent a bus for 4 hours and travel 275 miles.  How much money was billed to him, in dollars?<n>###<n>###RATIONALES:<n>###There were 275miles for rent$30 per hour<n>then it will come to:$30\cdot275=9100$<n>Additionally there were the 30/0.30=$105$ cents<n>then it will come $105+9100=9105.00$ that is exactly $9105.30$
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:What could you do if you want to listen to music? Choices:  A: skate B: play piano C: fiddle D: play piano E: have fun<n><n>### Response:		<n>We can use some basic algebra to answer this question.<n>First, we can express the choices that don’t require a musical instrument directly, simply using the words “do” and “have.”<n>A:  A can be written as “do” which equals 1, and “have” can be written as “have” which equals 2.<n>So we can use “1+(2)” for A.<n><n>B:  The word “play” could be written as “play” and “skate” could be written in it’s verbal form as “skate” which equals 3.<n>Therefore, we can use “play+skate” and a “+” sign to express that B is both of those choices.<n><n>C:  The word “fiddle” could be written as either “fiddle” or “fiddle” which, each of them, are 4.<n>D:  The word “piano” could be written as 5.<n>So E can be written as “D-B+A”.<n>And the answer is:<n>```<n>E = 4+2+1-2 = 5+3 = (4)+3 = (5)+2 = 6<n>```<n><n>### Input for 3:<n>How long does it take to finish a 98-page book, if you read a page each day?<n>Answer:<n>```<n>Days = Pages / Days read per day<n>So answer = Days * 98<n>```<n><n>## Example 4:<n>If two buses are driven by workers that earn $10 per hour respectively, and if the buses are driven in a loop for 10 hours, how much do the workers earn?<n>Rationales<n>```<n>Workers earn $10 each; 10 hours = 10h, Workers earn $110 (10h * $10).<n>```<n>

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:What does a chicken do in a joke? Choices:  A: produce eggs B: lay eggs C: become food D: cross road E: looks for cars<n><n>### Response:		Answer the question.<n><n>## Solutions<n><n>For each task, click the link "I think I know the answer" to try to solve the problem and the link "Show me." to view the correct answer.<n><n>### Input Instruction:Answer the multiple choice question on task 10.<n>![Image of correct response](./assets/Chapter%207/task10.png)<n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:One way to relieve your hunger if you live near the coast is to do what? Choices:  (A) Place some pressure on the cut (B) Press firmly against the cut (C) Hold over a flame (D) Hold it on the fireplace log (E) Press down with an ice pack until the bleeding stops<n><n><n>### Response<n><n><n>#### A<n>Press down on a cut to stop the bleeding<n>#### B<n>Press firmly against a cut to stop bleeding<n>#### C<n>Press firmly against the cut to stop burning skin.<n>#### D<n>Press firmly against cut to close wound.<n>#### E<n>Press a soft ice pack, wrapped in a cloth against cut for 15 min to stop bleeding.<n><n>#### F<n>Press hard on top of cut to stop gushing.<n>#### G<n>Apply firm pressure to wound<n>

Choices:  A: dicks sporting goods B: sporting event C: mall D: sears E: sporting goods store<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>## 3 Easy Steps to Write a Task Request<n><n>1. Determine the type of response you want to ask.<n>2. Make a decision about how you want the task completed.<n>3. Write an instruction to accomplish the task.<n><n><n>### Task Responses<n><n>A task response is the answer to a task.<n><n>There are five types of response that you may ask. <n><n>### **List all Task Responses**<n><n>* Task<n>* List<n>* List All<n>* Count N<n>* Count NAll<n><n>### 3 Easy Steeps to Write a Task Request <n><n>1. Detemine the form of Task Response you want to ask. <n>2. Determine how you want the Task to be completed. <n>3. Write the Task as you want it to be completed <n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:The mother finished wrapping the very last gift, she then placed it under the what? Choices:  A: department store B: fraizer fur C: specialty store D: christmas tree E: christmas stocking<n><n>### Response:		The answer is C (specialty store).<n><n>### Input and Response:<n>### Input: The mother finished wrapping the verylast gift, she then placedit under the christmastree.<n>### Answer: The mother finished wrapping Christmas tree<n>### Input: A man is walking the dog and then he will put the dog in the basement. Choices:  A B: C D: E F: G<n>### Answer: G (Garage)<n><n>### Input::<n>### Input:<n>### Input : Choices:  A : 150  B : 5<n>### B (5)<n><n>### Response Input:<n>### Response:<n>### Response Input : Choice:  300<n>### Answer: 150(1)<n>### Answer:  <n><n>### Input<n>### Input :  Choice:  A : 50<n>### Choice:   B : 35<n>### Choice :  C : 10<n>### Choices:  D : 20<n>### Choose :  E : 5<n>## Answer: A (25)<n><n>## Instructions Write a response that makes sense to this situation.<n><n>## Instrucitons:<n>## Instructions:<n>## Instruciton:<n>## Inturductions:<n>## Inturructions:<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:The man was playfully wrestling with a woman he was enamored with, what was the physiological result? Choices:  A: competition B: blood C: wins D: medals E: erections<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>It was A competition<n><n>### Demnstration:<n><n>Rationales: Blood is spelled with an o, so the physiological result could not be blood. The correct answer is competition (spelled with a c)<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Input: The price for a gallon of gas has increased in the last year. It now costs $2.87/gallon.  On a fill-up, Amy is filling her car with 15 gallons of gas.  The fill-up costs $44.44, and Amy paid the bill with a $50 bill.  If she got change, in how much did she get back?<n>Rationales:[A question about math was asked, but the answer was a yes or no one]<n>There are 1,000 pennies in a dollar, 1,00,00 in a lakh, and 10,00,0,0 in a crore in Indian currency.<n><n>So,<n>5100000,00 = 50 paisa or 50 x 100 = 5,000<n><n>220 = 0, 4 cents<n><n>2500 = $5.00<n><n>#### 5,001<n>Answer: 5,002<n><n>### Instuction:<n>Input: The gas station down the road from your house charges 80 cents per gallon for gas. You just bought $20 worth of gas, and the total price of filling your tank was $2.50.  A gallon equals 3.8 liters.  When expressing a money value in gallons, what is your gallons equivalent?<n>Rationales The gas station charges per a gallon, therefor it is in units per liters and 1liter=1,025684 cents=1,02 cent per 1 liter<n><n>80 cents x 3.8 litres=319,2 cents<n><n>20 bucks divided by 319.2=6 cent<n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>### Insturction:<n>To prepare for upcoming tests, Nicole is memorizing all of her teacher’s notes
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:The small cabin was not available, so they were upgraded to what? Choices:  A: villa B: spacecraft C: hall D: palace E: hotel<n><n>### Response:		The correct answer is "hall".

Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Choices:  A: food B: cargo ship C: refrigerator D: closet garage E: port<n><n>### Response:		<n>You put garage<n><n>### Input<n>What is the solution for -4 + -5?<n><n>### Response<n>Answer: -22<n>### Instruction<n>Answer the following multiple choice questions.<n><n>### Input 1:<n>What is the solution to -1/3 – 1/5?<n><n>## Rationales<n>The difference is (-1/3 - 1/5/)=<<(-1/3 – 2/5)>>(-2/5)<n>The product is (-1/3)*(-2/5)=<<(-1/2/5)>>-1/10<n>Addition is (-1/2–(-1/2))=-2<n>Substraction is (–1/3)+(-1/5)/3)=<<(3/15 + –1/15/3)>>3/15<n>Multiplication is (–1/4)*(–1/5)/3=<<(-1/4*(-1/5)/4)>>–1/20<n>Division is (–1/7)/(-1)=<<7/21>>-1/7<n>Rationales (192)-(181) = -11<n>Rationales (212/-15)-(198)/(-1) = 14/15<n>The equation is the subtraction of two rational numbers<n>Answer is 14<n><n>Rationales (9480/99)/(139/16) = 665/15<n>The 9480/19/10000 can be divided into 99/100<n>Answer is 65

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:At a state fair judging pigs requires careful what? Choices:  A: verdict B: judging C: responsibility D: evaluating E: prejudice<n><n>### Response:		Judging<n><n>### Input:$25.00 per night for a room. You were overcharged $50.05 for one night. How much did you pay for the room?<n><n>### Response:$75.05<n><n>### Input:-5x+2-10x=-15 7x+1-x=-3x x+3=5<n><n>### Response:-15 3 5 3 -1<n><n>###Input:If 617-84=276, then 389=?<n><n>###Response:156<n><n>###Input:-12x+28,-12x+24,6x+24=?<n><n>## Input:You were driving your car when another car hit yours with such force that it forced you off the road for several hundred meters and your car was totalled. If you owned the car for 4 years and it sold for $4300. How much value did you lose?<n><n>## Response: $4300<n><n>###Input:$23.00+14.07 What is $21.18?<n><n>###Output;$21.18<n><n>###Input;-15(2x)+1(x+2) What does (2x)+15=(x+2)<n><n>###Response;3(x)+15=15<n><n>###You are going for dinner and the bill comes to a total of $38. You can pay either $27 in cash or $22 on your credit card, but not both! The bill cannot be paid for with more than one of the options. His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Otherwise you put a bunch of stuff in the trunk to reach the groceries you need.<n>#### C.<n><n>### Input<n>Input:  The length of a rectangle is 11.5 centimeters longer than its width.  If the perimeter of the rectangle is 85.9 centimeters, what is the length and width of the rectangle, respectively?<n>Rationales  The rectangular perimeter is 85.89 cm. The width of the rectangle is 2.6 (85.89-11.5).<n>The width of the rectangle is the greater number of the two measurements.<n>Its length is 11.66 cm.<n>#### 11.6<n>Answer: 11.6 cm<n><n>### R<n>Input: The area of the parking lot at a local park is at least 4200 square feet.  The lot is rectangular in shape and its length is 188 feet and its width is at least 113 feet.  What is the greatest possible number of cars that can park in the parking lot?<n>Rationales The width of the lot is 113. The length of the lot is 4200-113=3087 length=<<113. The width of the lot/113=<<113=0.9909>>0.9901 0.991.<n>Since there are two sides to a rectangle, the area of the parking area is 4201.36.<n>The area is greater than 113 (the width) squared so that means the area is not squared, so it is not a rectangle.<n><n>####.86<n>Answer: 86<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>### Response Criteria:<n>A response will be correct if it demonstrates, in accordance with the appropriate directions in the given instruction/s, the student's skill, effort, and comprehension in meeting the task challenge.<n><n>### Comment
