Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Jame's bare feet were burned as he walked, because the sunshine had made the surface hot.  Where might he have been? Choices:  A: disneyland B: snow C: windowsill D: street E: summer<n><n>### Response:		B<n><n>### Instructions: Choice A is incorrect because Jame's feet would be burned if he was in the sunshine.  Choice B is incorrect because Jame is not in snow, so his feet would not be burned.  Choice C is incorrect because Jame would not be walking on the windowsill so his feet would not get burned. Choice D is incorrect because his feet would not get hotter if they were walking on a street.  So choice B is the correct answer.<n><n>### Input:(7^3)+3(6^3)+2(5^3)+1(4)^3<n><n>### Response:(512+1824+700+336)<n><n>### Instructure: Answer the question below.<n><n>### Question: What is the sum three plus seven plus fourteen plus twenty five plus eleven?<n><n>### Instiction:A:91<n><n>### Answer:91<n><n># Exercise 1: Using variables<n>Write a program that takes a pair of integers as input.  Output the larger of the integer pair.<n><n># Code: <n>```<n>if x > y:<n>	print(x)<n>else:<n>	print(y)<n>```<n><n>### Challenge:<n>Change the program to use two variables, x and y, to store the integers (as separate values).<n><n>Here are some challenges to assist you to complete this exercise on your own:<n>* Create a variable to hold an integer<n>* Assign a value to a variable - this will add the integer to the variable<n>* Use a comparision operator to compare two variables<n>* Output the variable with the larger value<n><n># Exercse 2: Using a function<n>Write a program that accepts the name of an apple varietal as a user input.  The following are valid varietals:<n>* Granny Smith<n>* Red Delicious<n>* Macintosh<n>* Fuji<n>* Empire<n>* Pink Lady<n>* Golden Delicious<n>If the user enters a single letter, instead of a valid varietal, ask the user to enter another word.  In this case, the letter will be processed as an invalid entry, and the user will be prompted to enter another word.<n># Code:<n>```<n>if word[0]=='G'||
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:The man was eating lunch, but rushed when he looked at his watch, why did he rush? Choices:  A: gain weight B: late for work C: heartburn D: bad breath E: early for work<n><n>### Response:		The correct answer is A: gain weight.<n><n>#### Correct:<n>A: ____________<n><n>#### Rationale:<n>When he checked his time.<n>Because it's the lunch he eat, he gain weight<n>C: ____________<n>___<n><n>**D: ____________**<n>___<n><n>**E: ____________**

How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:The body guard was good at his duties, he made the person who hired him what? Choices:  A: better job B: irritated C: feel safe D: save money E: headache<n><n>### Response:		The body guard was good at doing his job so the person who hired a body guard must be feel safe.<n><n>### Input Choice A:<n><n>### Rationale: The person who hired a good bodyguard must feel that he is safe, especially since there are many criminals around him.<n><n>### Answer Choice:<n><n>### This is the answer<n>#### c<n>Answer: c<n><n>### Input 2:<n><n>### Response 2:<n><n>#### e<n>Answer: e<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following short answer question.<n><n>## Input Choice C:<n><n>## Rationales:<n>This problem asks you to write a rational number that is greater than the given number by a specific amount.<n>The given choice doesn't have a specific wording on how much greater it is.<n><n>So answer should be:<n><n>#### 5<3<n>Answer: 5<3<n><n>## Input Choices D and E:<n><n>**Rational Choice D:** The rational choice for this problem is that the person in the sentence did not understand how much money was in his account, so he went to the bank to find out.  He could have been angry if he were unaware of his balance and a teller told him how little money he had. The person in the sentence could be upset and the only thing that could make him more upset is to receive the amount of money he withdrew from the teller.<n><n>**Rational for Choice E:** This choice only has two lines, which are both very different and make no sense.  The first sentence makes no sense because he is not making himself more miserable by receiving smaller withdrawals because the second sentence does not follow the first.<n><n>#### b<n>Answer: d<n><n>### Instruct:Answer the following short-answer question<n><n>### Choice E:<n><n>#### d<n>Answer: d<n>

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Where could you see an advertisement while reading news? Choices:  A: television B: bus C: email D: web page E: la ville<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>### Rationale: Web page<n><n><n><n>

The text is: "She continued to "dispare",<n><n>### Instructions:Review your notes from the previous two sections and then answer the following questions.<n><n>### Question: <n><n>What does it mean when a word, phrase or number is underlined or italicized in the text?<n><n>### Answer:<n>**Underlined:**  indicates that the reader should focus on this concept or term<n>**Italics:**  indicates that it is used as a word in a foreign language<n><n>### Question 2:<n><n>What does it look like when the definition for a term is italicized and then followed by the term?<n><n>###Answer:<n>Term and definition in italics: the definition.<n><n>###Question 3:<n><n>What is the difference between a noun and a verb?<n><n>###  Answer:<n>**a noun:**is a person, place, or item. **a verb:**is a group of letters that is the action part of a sentence. It tells us what the subject is doing.<n><n>###  Question 4:<n><n>Look at these phrases and see if they are simple or compound:<n><n>###Answer <n><n>**Simple:** The dog is biting her.<n><n>**Compound:** The dog is trying to eat the man's sandwich.<n><n>###Rationales:<n>- Simple: The dog is biting the man. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:She loved buying products, she was driven by her what to shop more than any practical needs? The following figure shows a plot of total gas budget versus the total number of miles traveled on several trips, each taking a different number of hours.<n><n>![](../assets/images/0722_L07_2_SampleProblems/figure2.png)<n><n>In dollars,<n><n><n>  The car with the higher rate of speed and the same average speed had<n><n>4.5 times the fuel budget of the car with the lower rate of speed and the<n>  same average speed, and 3.5 times the fuel  budget of the car with<n>  the same rate of speed and the lower average speed.<n><n>![](https://github.com/OpenGenus-Blog-Images/master/2019/10/Car-Driving-L07-2.png)<n>What is the  rate, in hours,  for the car with the lower average speed <n>and the lower rate of speed?<n><n><n>  (Enter your answer as an exact unit rate that does not include a<n>  decimal point or a negative sign. For example, 3/2 is 1.5 and<n>  5/2 is 2.5, but not 0.75 or –2.5. You can type in fractions by placing<n>  a decimal point after the numerator, such as 2/3 or 3/4. Be careful<n>  not to over type. If your answer uses a fraction, then you must also<n>  give the denominator, such as 7/4 or 2/3.)<n>  Answer: (Enter your answer.)<n><n>What is the lower rate of speed for the car with the lowest total<n>  gas budget?<n><n>  (The first figure shows that the lower of these speeds is 80. A nightmare is a dream that makes people feel awful because of what they are imagining.<n>* C-While in a dream: In a dream, people can see and hear things while they are in a dream, just like awake. A person can determine if they are in a dream or awake if they know that they were asleep and they are awake, while they are awake and if they can see and hear things.<n>* D-Both: Both (nightmare and during a dream)<n><n>### Answer:B<n>### JustificationB:During a dream<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Answer the following multiple choice questions.<n><n>### Input<n>Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n><n>In the future, we may be able to use _______________ to travel far distant places. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:At the end of your meal what will a waiter do? Choices:  A: serve food B: eat C: set table D: serve meal E: present bill<n><n>### Response:		If a waiter is done serving a meal.<n>There should be a table set and ready to seat me and the other customer/s waiting for my meal; The waiter should take an empty plate when he is done serving me.<n><n>### Input(Question):There are four customers in the restaurant and a waiter has 5 seconds as a time limit to pick up food for each customer. If he has two customers that order for two plates and the other two customers orders one item, who is most likely to be served first?<n><n>### Response(Answer):I think that it would be the one customer that ordered the food for 1 plate because he has one person waiting; The time limit will increase to 6s for the customer(s) that orders 2 plates and the 1st customer that ordered for 1 plate can be served at the time that the waiter would be on the 5th second and the other 2 customers would be served after the first customer that ordered for 2 plates.<n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Which region has the most famous temple? Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:She was sick and staying in bed the day of the event, unfortunately this meant she was what? Choices:  A: child's hand B: the last straw C: hobby shop D: end of line E: toy store<n><n>### Response:		The correct answer is C: The last straw;<n><n>- When someone uses the last of a supply, they get to the end of that supply.<n>- The last of this supply slipped through Sally's fingers and she lost it.<n>E: The answer is E: toy store.<n>- The toy store has a variety of toys and other supplies at the end of the line, so the toy store.<n><n>- If it does not include the toy store it is the least appropriate answer for describing the string coming off when Sally's fingers held the string and let it go. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:What could listening to music cause you to be? Choices:  A: happy B: smile C: calm D: entertainment E: relaxation<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Rationales:B: no it has not the only possible answer<n>C: no it has not a good answer should be<n>calm/ peaceful<n>D: no<n>E: calm that is the only true answer
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:"There are 10 apples on an apple tree.  Three fall off.  Now there are X apples."  What is this an example of? Choices:  A: park B: coloring book C: garden center D: math problem E: gravity<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>**A: park**<n><n>#### 32<n>Answer: 5<n><n>### Input: What is the value of x if 15x^2= 15x +101?<n><n>### Demostration<n>Input: 15x^3=15x(3)+101<n>Multiply 15x^4 to get 15x^5<n>15x^5 = 15x(5)+101<n>300x^4=763x+101<n>15x(300-763)/101 or 300*583/101 which is 171*18<n>Or x^3=171^2 or 31051 or 310 or 31<n><n>#### 31<n>Answer: 3<n><n>### Input"A 5-digit number is composed of the numbers from 832. Sam didn't like company.  He prefered what? Choices:  A: you B: abbreviation C: solitude D: loneliness E: alone<n><n>### Response:		Sam is known to prefer solitude.<n>Clarification: John came to see Sam and he kicked him out.<n>This is Sam's way of saying that he doesn't like company.<n><n>Sam's way of liking company is by preferring solitude.<n><n><n><n>### Input :What is the number of integers greater than 1 that contain a given 5-digit integer as their only factor?<n><n>### Rationale: <n>There are<n>The number of integers greater than one that contain "12345"  as their only factor.<n>First find the range of whole numbers i.e. [0, 9]<n>Then check  the 1st element as (0) it is even number => false <n>Do this for each case and move on to the next element and do the same things in order to get the result.<n><n>### If there is no factor means there is no integer.<n>Find the number of even integers means do the same thing for each even element but move backwards for even numbers as a first element in each case.<n><n>### Solution: <n>We can see that there are 5 digits which means five cases.<n>Thus, the number of integers in each case is 5 and for each integer case we have to make the boolean conditions that each case is true then we will get the results as 1 for all conditions.<n>Thus, for getting the answer divide 256 (= (5*32) number of elements in case of even elements)<n>by 5 since there are 5 cases in each integer case we get the number of integers greater that 1 that contain a 5-digit integer.<n>We get 512 as the answer<n><n><n><n><n>## <n>### 48:Find the sum of 1 + 2 * 3 + 4<n>Rationals: Add two numbers and multpy that by three and add that to 4.<n>1 + 2 * (3 * 4) = <<1 + 2 *(3*4) = 12>>12<n>Add 1 and 12 = <<1 + (12)+1 =13>>13<n><n>## 49: Find the sum of the following <n><n>## 50: Which of the following is greater than zero?<n> 4885<n>

Choices:  A: economic instability B: not noticeable C: spend more D: rising interest rates E: boring<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Demnstration:<n>Input : One of the signs of an economy in recession is that the interest rates charged for credit cards, car loans, and other loans are often very high. If the interest rate on a loan is at a normal level of 8 percent, how many percent is it below the economy's normal inflation rate?<n>I used a equation that is : A=B-C. So if A equals B-C then you got: B/100+C/100=100/A.<n>So 0.08/100+0.06/100=2/A<n>0.92/A=2<n>Now divide 0.92 by 2 and you got:<n>`92 / 2 = 46`<n>And the answer is in % C.<n><n>`46%`<n><n>#### 46<n>Answer: 46

Choices:  A: exposure B: patience C: study D: cooperation E: thought<n><n>### Response:		<n>Exposure A B C D E<n><n>### Instructor:<n>1. Identify the answer. The best answer is A. <n>2. Explain why. <n>__* __<n><n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:What is a characteristic of thin glass? Choices:  A: break easily B: shattering C: melt D: bend E: hold water<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Correct Answer:C: melt<n>

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:What enables most people to transport themselves? Choices:  A: helicopter B: own cars C: speak words D: believe in god E: dance together<n><n>### Response:		<n><b>Response:</b><n>A: A can be inferred as a helicopter is not a ground based vehicle and is not a means of transportation.  B: Own cars can be inferred as most people do not work on the poultry farms as is depicted in the question.  C: Speak words can be inferred as the questions and answer in no way implies this can transport people.  D: Believe in god can be inferred as god can not be visibly seen when riding a car or bicycle nor would it be a safe means of transportation. E: Dance together can be inferred as  it would most certainly not be safe for everyone to dance together on a highway.<n><n>### Input/Instruction:<n><b>Input/Instruction:</b>Write a response that appropriately combines the given sentences.<n></p><n><p>The house was built of stone. It was two stories tall.</p><n><n>### Response/Output:<n><p>The stone house was two-story.</p><n><n><p><n>  <b>Hint</b>:  Add a comma after the first sentence.<n></p>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Where must one wear a white shoe? Choices:  A: wedding B: tennis C: closet D: left foot E: house<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Rationale:<n><n>### Input, Output, Explanation:<n>C: closet<n>No, shoes in closet are not commonly white.<n><n>Answer:<n><n>### Democracy<n><n>

Choices:  A: hair salon B: hair of woman C: barber shop D: pincushion E: woman's hair<n><n>### Response:		<n>Hairpin is a very common item found at women's hair salons and woman's hair.<n>However, it is also found at barber shops as well as pincushions.<n><n>### Input 2:Mabel’s car is going through a tire and she needs to replace them so she can go on a trip. A: she can get a set for $84 and have 4 extra for $3 which means she’ll spend a total of 4*$48=<<4*$48=192>>192 or B: she can get a 5th set for $95 which would cost a total of 125+45=<<125+49=174>>174. If she decides to get the set of 4 tires plus 5th spare tire, what are the differences between the two car’s purchasing cost?<n><n>### Dem:<n>In the question, there is a scenario that describes what Mabel will need to pay, so we know she will pay at least $3 for 4 extra tires. There is a choice about what set of tires she wants. For choice A, it says if she wanted a set of tires that costed $84, she will get a tire for $48 and she has 4 tires. Therefore, option A’s total will be 4*$48=$84$. Since option B says if she want a set of 5, she will have to pay $125+$40=$165. Therefore, option B’s total cost will be $165. So, the option with the lower cost will be A. Option A will cost $84 or less, and option B will cost $165 or more, so A is the right answer.<n><n>### Additional Scenario:The rental agency charges $20/hour for a car. How much is left over?<n><n>### Response:-220<n><n>### InputA: Write a program that takes in a number n and print every number between 1 and n, inclusive.<n><n>### Response1: <3>54<n><n>### Response2: 1234<n><n>### Input1: How many letters in “I’m a cute bear.”<n><n>### Response<n><n>### Input2:How many letters in “I like to sing.”?<n><n>###<n>Answer<n><n>###<n>Input-If Lance earns \$19 per hour and works 8 hours. How much does he earn?<n><n><n>Rationales:(8)(19)=<<8*19=152>>152If you make \$152 and work 8 hours you make $18.<n><n>#### 18<n>Answer :18<n><n>###<n><n>Input-If Layla was in the front of the car, she would earn \$19. If she was in the back, she would earn $15. How long does the car trip take?<n><n><n>Raionales:If Layla is in the front of the Car then<n><n>$(8)$(19)+(8)(<<<<19>>15) =<<19+18=39>>39<n>If liea is in the back of the Car then<n>She would take **0** days.<n><n>#### 0<n>Answer:0<n><n>###<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Where is basketball court likely to be outdoors? Choices:  A: high school gymnasium B: city C: park D: use E: los angeles<n><n>### Response:		<n>1. A<n>2. C<n>3. D<n>4. E<n><n>### Input :What type of weather is likely to cause damage to a building? Choices: 1. dry/low humidity 2. wet/high humidity 3. cold<n><n>### Response :<n>1. 3<n>2. 1<n>3. 2<n><n>### Instructions :Answer the question below.<n>1. What is the square of 100?<n>2. How many times is 500 cubed?<n>3. What is 3356 squared?<n>4. What is the cube of 71?<n>5. What is the square root of 10?<n>6. What is the quotient of 23 and 13?<n><n>### Input<n><n>### Response<n><n>### Input what is the quotient of:<n><n>### Response what is the quotient:<n><n>### Input What are the coordinates of this triangle?(Please use an ordered pair that represents each vertex):<n><n>### Response Vertex<n><n>### Input Write a math sentence using order of operations to explain what is the quotient.<n><n>### Response What is:<n><n>### You are given two numbers and the problem is to multiply <n>### what is the problem<n><n>### what do you do to solve<n><n>### your answer<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Where is microphone boom likely to be used to record an album? Choices:  A: radio station B: recording studio C: concert D: tv studio E: new york<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>####  A<n><n>####  B<n><n>####  C<n><n>####  D<n><n>####  E<n><n>Answer: <n><n>### Demos:<n>[Click Here](https://docs.google.com/presentation/d/1QsHl5ZW6RZYQ-UjQqvJ63K7y0rFNuqrK9i4JlEcXlqM/edit?usp=sharing) [Click Here](https://sway.office.com/n2YjVi9K4a3YuMbI?ref=Link)<n><n>### Question (4)(1):<n>#### <n>Answer: 30 hours<n><n>### Question:<n>#### <n>Answer A 1<n><n>####  Answer B 45<n><n>### Question(5)

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Bob thought that his Pokemon cards were common and worthless, but he was wrong about them. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:The old man was retired and liked the simple things, he would do crossword puzzle every morning simply just to do what? Choices:  A: you're bored B: pass time C: relax D: mentally challenged E: win<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Input:"Which two sides of a parallelogram have equal length?" Choices:  A and (A and B) B and (B and C) C and (C and D) D and (D and E) E and (E and F)<n>### Response: A & B<n><n>### Instructions: The instructions below describe a task. Using the rationales to complete the task may earn you credit points.<n><n>### Input:'Rationales' : Write an answer to each of the following.<n><n>### Answer:Rationales: The correct answer is the 11th letter of the alphabet.<n><n>### The instructions:  The figure below describes a 4-sided shape. We call the two pairs of lines that divide it sides. What letter of the alphabet is represented by each shape?<n><n>### Response:"Rationales": The answer is A and J and the 5 letter word would be 'Rationales'.<n><n>### Input :'Rationales' Choices:  A - B - G - E - D - C - H - F - I - J - K - L - M - N - O - P - R<n><n>### Response:'Rationales':Answer: Rationales<n><n>### Input'Rationales'Choices: A - B - D - E - F - G - H - I - J - N - O - R - S - U - V - Z<n><n>### Response'Rationales':Answer:'Rationales'<n><n>### "Rationale" is an acronym that stands for 1<n>### What letter of the alphabet stands for 'Rationales' in this acronym?<n>#### Answer 'Rationales' is the 11-letter word and the answer is D.<n><n>### "The instructions:A teacher tells his students that tomorrow they will be quizzed on four operations- addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division-that they have been studying. To make sure they remember how to use each operation, she tells them that they will be shown different shapes. These shapes can then be used to practice these operations. Draw these shapes.<n>#### Answer: This is how I drew it:<n> ![](images/uploads/4-sided-figure-image.png)_2.

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:If I want to maximize my number of potential customers, where should I build a new department store? Choices:  A: idaho B: shopping mall C: big city D: in town E: new york<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Reason: If you were to build a new department store you shouldn't go far from your current store because the customers will go to the mall and that is not good for business.<n><n>### Answer: <n><n>## #<n><n>#### Instruction:Write a response to one of your classmates.<n><n>#### Demonstration: <n><n>#### Choice: A: <n>#### Response:<n><n>#### Reason: <n><n>## Choice: B: <n>## Reason:

Choices:  A: accompaniment to meal B: waitress C: cafeteria D: home E: menu<n><n>### Response:		<n>If they don't it's a fail, If they do it's success.<n><n>### Input;If I have $1000, How much will be a total of $1500?<n><n>### Rationales:  $300*4=<<$1000/4=250>>250$250*4*$300<n>$$ 1000*4*1500 1500*3 4500 <<1000*1.5=1500>>1500*2=3000$$<n><n>### Answer: $1150-500<n><n>### Input<n> <n>### Rational:<n>Mother’s Day is coming up and you want to get your mom some flowers for the day. If the total price is to be rounded to the nearest penny, how many stems should you buy?<n>Mother's Day comes 3 times a year so we don't have to use division.<n><n>### Solution:<n>If the price is rounded up there are going to be too many flower stems and the total for the rounded price is going to be close to the rounded cost.<n><n>If the price is $3.65 and rounded to the nearest penney it will be $1.99 and there is to be $0.02 extra which will not cover the cost for the rounded price and will only make it higher.<n><n>$0.38 will not round to the closest penny so rounding it will be $.20 for each flower.<n><n>A flower is worth $0.20, there are 1500 pennies in a dollar so 1500*.20=300.<n><n>There is $300 in stems and it has to rounded to the nearest peny to be.<n><n>The answer should be 1500-p.<n><n>### Answer:$300-1500<n><n><n>### Instructions: If Sam spent 75 cents on postage to mail a letter, how much is the postage to mail a
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:What could happen after driving car that does not involve pain? Choices:  A: automobile accidents B: backache C: eye strain D: getting tired E: car crash<n><n>### Response:		A: automobile acc<n><n>### Demstration:<n>Rationales: Driving car could lead to accident and pain<n><n>### Instructions:<n>There were several choices and each choice has a different meaning that includes each option from A (automobile accident) to E (car crash).<n>D (Getting tired) does not cause any pain as there is only pain after automobile accident.<n>Hence The answer is A<n><n>### Input<n>How many seconds does the pendulum take to complete a full swing?<n><n>Input: A pendulum swings back and forth every 4 seconds. How long does it take for it to swing an entire 8-foot distance when it is unobstructed?<n>Rationales Since the pendulum swing back and forth in 4 secods. so 8 foot distance will be completed in<n><n>8/4*7=<<8/4*7>>28 secods<n><n>#### 28<n>Answer: 28<n><n>### Input :1. The cost of a ticket sold in the upper deck is $2.00 more than the cost of the ticket sold in the lower deck, even when sold separately.  In which section are the two sections together sold as a single ticket? Choices: A: lower deck B: upper deck C: both sections D: either section<n><n>### Response :<n>1. The cost of the ticket sold only in lower deck is $2 more than cost of ticket sold in upper deck. The second half of question implies that both prices are sold separately. The ticket sold in upper deck and lower deck will cost the same and the ticket of both in higher deck can be sold as a single ticket costing $2 which is the difference among the two. 2. The price sold in upper deck is $2 more compared to the price sold in lower deck and hence, it can be sold together as a single ticket if the price increases with $2.
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:The dog ran to the front window and barked, this is because of a presence at the what? Choices:  A: building B: friend's house C: classroom D: window E: front door<n><n>### Response:		The dog ran to the front door and barked.<n>Since the dog is barking at the front door which is how it is able to contact its owner.<n><n>### Input<n>Jason has a carriage house that rents for $750 a month. He is willing to reduce the rent by $50 per month, or $200 total, if you agree to a 4 month lease. Your friend would save $700 per month if she rents for a year. How much, in total, would she pay Jason over the course of 12 months?<n><n>Rationales: I can break this down by giving the following answers for each month of the year.<n>Month 1- $750-$200=-550<n>Month 2- $750-50=-700<n>Month 3- $750+50=$800<n>Month 4- $750+$50=$801<n>12 months x $801=$9612<n>Total- $9612<n><n>#### 9612<n>Answer: 9612 (Ensure that all 1s in the decimals line up!)<n><n>### Instructions: What you are doing below is working out the cost of an item.<n><n>### Cost: $2.95<n><n>Cost=$2.95<n>Delivery fee is 50 cents and there is a 10% tax.<n><n>### Purchase Cost=$2.95+0.50=3.45 <n><n>### Pct Tax 10% of 2.95=0.19<n><n>### Total Cost (1+0+0.19)/100=2.70<n><n>Total cost=$2.70<n>

That's how it goes."<n>Rationales: This answer choice is logical because the answer option doesn't actually say the event occurred but rather uses words to imply that it did.<n>Logically, the answer options are all either factual in nature or vague references to the event.  A logical answer would be some form of fact.  The second answer choice uses the word 'happened' when describing the event even though it doesn't explicitly state the event as having occurred.<n>Because it uses the word happpend, it is considered logical.<n><n>### Response:'You have to be kidding, I still have a lot of projects to do.'<n>Rationales:The answer choices are grammatically correct.<n><n>### Choice: 'It's unbelievable, but I have no choice now.'<n>Rationales:'It's unbelieveble, but I have no choic'<n><n>### Choices: 'Unbelievable. You have to stop eating that.  I'm starting to worry about you.'<n><n>Choices: 'Too much.'<n>'It's unbeliveable, but I have to start losing weight.'<n>Chosee: 'How about starting to eat healthy?'<n><n>### Choose: 'Do you really expect me to believe that?'<n><n>### Respond: 'But I am not kidding.'<n><n>### Choosed: 'Do you really believe that?'<n><n>Choosed: 'Well, I'm not lying.'<n><n><n>### Choosen: 'How about this:  It's not like the first person to say no is going to miss out on anything important.'<n><n>### Response Choosen: 'You're kidding me.'<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:What is a sign that you might not be living soon? Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:What is a great, but non-specific, overall benefit of exercise?
