Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Where will a bullet projectile be found during a war? How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Where is a paper notice likely to be left on a house? Choices:  A: front door B: conference C: classroom D: refrigerator E: suitcase<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>Input: How fast was the ferrari going when the police clocked it? If the refilling cost is $20 and the total cost is $220.00, how many times was it filled?<n><n>### Instructed answer:Because the answer was $100. 2.00+$100.0+(20.00-100.0)=320.00<n><n>### Instrumented answer:We know that a tank costs 100$ and a filling costs 20$. It will cost a total of 220$. So if a tank costs 1, refilling will cost 20$. Thus 220/20=11. Each tank costs 11 times refilling since 220 is evenly divised by 20<n><n>### Demostration:1/11*(220-100)<n><n>### Instraction answer:11 times refilling<n><n>### Instution answer: $11$(220-110) times refilling<n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:If you are fiddling through a music book when you should be playing, you probably dont have? Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Where do farmers keep toothpicks? Choices:  A: mouth B: grocery store C: constructing models D: shed E: box<n><n>### Response:		The answer is D<n><n>Input: Which of the following statements is NOT true about a square? Choices:  I: All sides are congruent<n>J: All angles are the same<n>K: No matter where we place the first vertex, the second vertex will automatically be on the center of the square<n>L: If we divide a side by 2, we will get a half of a new side<n><n>### Response<n>The answer is D, K<n><n>### Instructions<n>Answer the following multiple choice questions:<n><n>Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n><n>Input - Input- Input: Which of the following is NOT a common word that ends with _sure ?<n><n>Answer: The answer is: C<n><n><n><n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Where would you put a dictionary while you're using it? Choices:  A: library B: study area C: table D: classroom E: shelf<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>D- library<n><n><n>### Instructions: Answer the following multiple choice question by typing an appropriate response in the text box below.<n><n>### Output:<n><n><table><n>  <tr><n>    <td><img src="images/1520178510_2.png"></td><n>    <td></td><n>    <ul><n>      <li>What would you do if you wanted to go to the second table?</li><n>      <li></li><n>    </ul><n>  </tr><n></table><n><n>### Output<n><n><n>1. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Bill did not abandon the fight, but did what to the enemy? Choices:  A: arrogate B: retain C: embrace D: smile E: engage<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>#### E<n><n>Answer:<n>

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. A single sentence response does not require a complete sentence. <n><n>### Examples:<n>**Answer:  A**<n><n>*Input A: The input, <code>InputA</code>, is a vector of positive integers.<n>*Output A: The output, <code>OutputA</code>,<n>is a matrix of all of elements of <code>InputA </code><n>arranged by row instead of column.<n>#### Output A<n>```<n>4 5 9 6 7<n>0 1 2 3 0<n>```<n><n>#### 60<n>Answer: A. 4 5 9.<n><n>#### Input A: 20<n>Output A:<n>```<n>6 10 5<n><n>0 0 2<n>```<n><n>### Answer:  B<sup>*input b*</sup><n><n>### Input B: The second input is a vector of the same dimensions as the first input.<n><n>### Explanation: The input can be transformed to this matrix<n><n>#### Explanation

How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:The master control for the Tardis is where in the main room? Choices:  A: nuclear power plant B: center C: basement D: main office E: bowel of the ship<n><n>### Response:		<n>Ans: C: Basement<n>Reason: It is the only one that makes any sense.<n><n>### Input.The TARDIS has 144 functions that you can call for. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:There was a show on television about a ranger who loved flowers, but the next day it was about a gardener who also loved flowers. Choices:  A: countryside B: anthology C: dull read D: state park E: surface of earth<n><n>### Response:		Answer: B<n><n>### rationale:It is about a series of similar things, i.e. flowers, or shows, or books, etc.<n><n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:If you have trouble beginning work you're suffering from what? It can be frustrating.<n><n>### Rationale:<n>I used the word French not Italian because Italian is much easier language than French.<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Where is a likely place to view an old copy machine? Choices:  A: industrial area B: museum C: barn D: school E: office<n><n>### Response:		C<n>- Choice B: museum-C is correct<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n><n>## Demonstration: <n>Input: <n>1.The owner wants to charge a total of $25 each hour for use of her vehicle.<n>2.A rental period is not to exceed one week. <n><n>Rationales:<n>Given the owner wants to charge $25/hour, a rental period, the owner wants to ration to not exceed one week.  The owner can not charge for more than the entire days usage.<n>Thus, on day 1 the charge = 25*4= <<25*4=100>>100.<n>Thus if for day two charge = <<25*4>=200>>200 for the entire week: 200/4 = <<200/4=50>>50.<n><n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Input-Melissa is making cupcakes for a class party<n><n>### response<n>  A. 65 for a dozen (12) cupcakes B. 65 for 8 cupcakes (8) C. 87 for a dozen (11-1,2) D. 65 for ten (10) cupcakes E. 52 for a dozen (15-8)<n><n>### response answer: D<n><n>65(12)=65+65=310<n><n>65*10=650<n><n>65/12=54<n><n><n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:What would you put furniture on top of? I don't like C because the fussy furniture comes all the time.<n><n>### Cause-based thinking:  If you take a car will furn.<n><n>##<n><n>***<n>## Duration<n> <n>- It does 100 miles in 4 hours at 20 miles-per-hour.  If it goes 10 miles in 100 minutes at the same speed.<n>- I think  the number of miles 20.<n> <n>## <n>   #### 1000<n><n>- a mile<n>- 0h 4h<n>-  20<n>- -4 802<n><n>--<n><n>- It takes an hour to walk around the block at 2 miles-per-hour while going in one direction. If the next direction takes the<n>same amount of time, then what is the distance traveled?<n><n>- I think the distance traveled is 1<n><n><n>- I think 8/15 of a mile<n>- The next direction takes the **same distance as the walking**<n>- It is not the same distance as the walking<n> <n>---<n><n>- 8/15<n>- -4/15<n>- 0.8/15<n>

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. The bookstores revenue does not include the price of the magazine and is the same as if you didn't buy any of the other items.  You could use the $1500$ for your ticket on the train.<n>### A3.<n>Since the train station has the least expenses and gives the most money, the choice is A.<n>### Rationales:<n>##### Choice_A Rationale<n>- $1800$ for buying and reading the magazine. - $1200$ spent for the train station or $1800-1200=600$. - $500$ to get the magazine and take it to the home<n><n>##### Choice A Rationale<n>- $200$ spent on the train station<n>- $150$ spent on newsstand<n>- $1280$ spent on the magazine<n><n>### [Fundamentals of Arithmetic, Mathis, Mathis and Kozlov_1ed]<n>- Arithmetic<n><n>#### [A.6, A.7]<n>1. It’s likely an odd word choice.<n><n>#### D: I don’t think this is the best use of your precious time or mental space to solve this particular problem, which is why it’s a non sequitur answer to me.<n><n>#### E: In a perfect world, people who try to steal from car owners while they’re trying to open their vehicles would get arrested, but I don’t think that would be what the police do.<n><n>#### Direction is what we’re talking about here, so answer choice D is not applicable since it refers to cornering a thief (which is not an instruction, but is instead a crime in itself).<n><n>### You got it right!<n>Answer: H<n><n>Input: This weekend, we’re throwing a party to celebrate our team’s recent success. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:The color yellow is associated with the opposite of the characteristic, what is it? Choices:  A: fearless B: english carrier C: courageous D: brave E: achromatic<n><n>### Response:		<n>Rationales:<n><n>For this question the options to choose are; A or D. You can rule out option E as the color yellow relates to a feeling, not a characteristic.<n>

How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:When a newborn's eyes open for the first time it will be the first time the ever? Choices:  A: joke B: humor C: frightened D: fight E: laughter<n><n>### Response:		What makes people happy, when it is surprising and not expected, is laughter.<n><n>### Input : Which part of a sentence is an element that can stand by itself?<n><n>### Response : The main or subordinate clause, or one of them, is the element that can stand alone.<n><n><n>### Input  : A subordinate clause is what type of clause?<n><n>### Rationale: It is a dependent clause that serves as an adjunct to the main clause.<n><n>### Response  : It is a complement to one of the main clauses of related sentences. <n><n>### Input and explanation: One of the clauses in this complex sentence is a main (or independent) clause containing a related adjectival clause.  The complex sentence is structured to connect the two sentences using a comma, which would not be appropriate if the clause under consideration were the only main clause in the sentence.  Since the main clause contains a related independent clause, the main clause and the subordinate clause form a complex sentence.  Note that there is a semicolon after the subordinate (or dependent) clause of 4.  This is a good idea; it keeps you using the semicolons correctly.  If the question pertained to the subordinating conjunction under consideration, you would have used and or but.  If the subject of the sentence were an adjective, the question under consideration would be asking you to find the adjective for the clause.
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:The man took 3 hours every morning for grooming, what is the likely result with his job? Choices:  A: tardiness B: looking good C: injury D: vacation E: neatness<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Explanation:<n><n>### Input 2:The man takes 3 hours daily commuting how would the likely happen to his job? Choice: A: Tardiness B: injury C: Looking good D: Good time management E: Vacation<n><n>### Response 2:<n><n>### Instructions:<n>### Demonstarion/Explanation:<n><n><n>### Input<n>Renee earns $15/hour, working an average of 40.00 hours per week. She is expected to work an average of 52.00 hours per month. How many dollars does she earn in a year?<n><n>### Response<n><n>### Explantion:<n><n>#### 52*15+((5-52)/5*40) = 52*120+((78-900)/50*40) = $68, 560<n>

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Dancing for a long time will lead you to become what? Choices:  A: sore B: intercourse C: fatigue D: become tired E: expression<n><n>### Response:		Intercourse.<n>

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:David hurt all over. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Many containers full of goods are unloaded where after their long sea journey Choices:  A: port B: cargo ship C: refrigerator D: food E: lorry<n><n>### Response:		C:Lorry, port, cargo ship, refrigerator, food<n><n>### Rationales:lorry, port, cargo, refrigerator and food are the containers that are being filled up with good after arriving to land.

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur. Choices:  A: question B: dispute C: deny D: contradict E: refuse<n><n>### Response:		Incorrect answers are (B) dispute (E) refuse (C) deny (question)<n><n>### Rationale:This means that they won't respond to confirm an applicant has been their reference. Instead, the applicant has to follow up with them. I don't think we need to give their reason.<n><n><br><n>### Instruction :A hunter buys 24 cartridges for his rifle. He uses 6 in a hunting season. Choices:  A: open doors B: drink water C: need food D: annoy E: play<n><n>### Response:		<n>A <n>answer: A<n><n><n>### Input:-3, 9, 16, 25, and 36 are the first five numbers in the Pythagorean Triplets pattern. Write the sixth number in the pattern.<n><n>### Response:-9<n><n><n>### Instructions:Each row in the table below lists the number of people employed by a certain type of company in three cities. Choose the letter that best completes each answer.<n><n>### Input<n>Number of Employees   Seattle   Dallas   Los Angeles<n>Federal government 15  8,000  6,500  0<n>State governments  4,000  5,500  1,000<n>Local government   2,500  3,000  1,500<n>Private businesses 2,000  4,00   8,100 <n>Churches            1   ...    ...<n>Charities           2   ...    ...<n>### Output<n>A to C   D to G   H to I   J to L<n><n>### Output<n>4<n><n>### Response<n><n><n>Input:   A, D, 1.<n><n>Output:   E, J, 3.<n><n>### Reasoning:<n>A) The number of government employees is <n><x times 15> + <y times 8000> <x plus y equals 4> <n>=  5000 plus 64,000 <84,000> <d equals 64000 times j equals 8> <n>= 114000 <11400> <d plus j equal 6400> <n>= J <d plus j equal d> <n>equals 8. <n>D) The number of government <n><z times 5500> + <q times 3000> <z plus q equals 42000> <n><12000 plus 3000 equals 15,000>  <q equals 12,000 plus 5> <n><l equals 1 equal m> <n><m equals 800

Choices:  A: movies B: opera C: theater D: lecture hall E: hockey game<n><n>### Response:		Answer A<n><n>### Rationales:A, movies.<n>### B, opera.<n>### C, theater.<n>### D, lecture hall.<n>### E, hockey game.<n><n>### Input - a+b+c+d=n<n>### Answer -2a+2d+b+c<n><n>### Rationale:a+2a = 2a = 2*2 = 2<n>### And 2a = 4<n>### d = 4<n>##    d + 2 = 4<n>##      = 6 (d=4)<n>##   b = 6<n>##b+2=8 (b=6)<n>##c+4=10 (c=3)<n><n>A math professor at a large university had 20 graduate students in her class. This semester, she decided to use one of two different grading methods to determine students' grades in her class. She decided each student's final grade would be determined by the midterm exams as follows.<n><n>* If the student got 50% or less on the midterm exam, he received an overall grade of F.<n>* If the student did not get 50% or more on the midterm exam but received an overall grade of B or higher when all grades, including those for homework, class participation, and papers, were averaged for the entire semester, then he received an overall grade equal to the grade he got on the midterm exam.<n>* If the final exam score plus the grade received on the midterm exam was at least equal to 100%, then the student achieved a B; otherwise, a student receiving a B received an overall grade equaling 95%.<n><n>### Input-20 students, 100 for final+midterm<n>### Output: Final grades for all 20 students<n><n>### Input for N students<n>### Rationale for N students<n>* 50% or lower on midterm = F<n>* 100% or higher on midterm = C<n>* N/100 or B= N/100*A+B>=100%<n>* 105% or higher on midterms = A<n>##  50%<n>##  50/100

The gas station owner has a rule that he pays his workers per the number of hours they work. For a first offense, workers receive $7.50 for every hour worked. For the second offense, they receive $12.75 for every hour worked. After a third offense, workers receive no pay. How many total hours of work would he have to work at $7.50 per hour if he wanted to make $28o per week?"<n><n>### Rationales:<n>The first offense = first hour<n>the second offense = 2 hours = $12.70<n>the third offense = 1 hour = $7.50<n>so the total number of offenses is 3<n>$7.50+12.50+7.50=$27.50 = weekly pay of $350<n><n>#### 27.50<n><n>Answer: 27.5<n><n>### Instructio: Choices:  A) work  every week  B.) work a little less  C.) work a little more  D.) work two more hours  E.) work half as many hours<n><n>### Response Choice: D<n><n><n>### Input 1: If it rained more than 5 inches in the park, the ground was wet. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:What's the nickname of the monster the beauty loved? Choices:  A: beast B: ugly C: ugliness D: satellite E: top of mountain<n><n>### Response:		A: beast<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following two-part multiple choice question.<n>To get extra credit, include the mathematical steps and the mathematical reasoning of your calculation in a Word document. Upload the document with your test submission.  <n><n>Your response should follow these three rules of mathematical writing:<n>Each step should have both words and a mathematical representation.<n>The mathematical representation should match what you show with symbols.<n>The mathematical reasoning should be explained in words that can be understood by yourself.<n><n>### Response with Instructions<n>### Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n>Rationales: 1.  The cost of a single meal, c, is determined by the number of beers, b, being 2c – 6.6b + 0.5.  What is the first-order cost function?  (Answer: 2c – 10.4b + 0.3)<n>2.  Suppose your costs are $c(k)$ = 125 –.1k.  What is the constant term of the function? (Answer: 125)<n>3.  What is the slope of the cost function in the previous problem? (Answer: 0.03)<n>4.  Use the cost function from problem 1 to find the cost of the first meal incurred in a one-day session with 4 beers. (Answer: 10)<n>### Calculation:<n>### What do you notice about the function<n>Rationales: We notice the constant term.<n>If we put 0 in for x,<n>the constant is:<n>(0+0.1k+125)=125<n><n>### How do you find the slope of the function?<n>Rationales The slope of the line is a constant change in cost (a/b) or.1-.03<n>### Calculation The answer: 10<n><n>### Answer the remaining two-part multiple choice questions.<n><n>#### 2-part instruction<n>In the below problem, you’re asked to find the cost, c(x), of one meal (x units), given how much it costs for each additional beer (b units), and write the formula for the function.  Assume that one meal costs $137.95 and it costs $0
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Where is a telephone booth likely to be red? Choices:  A: airport B: gotham city C: london D: city E: gas stations<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>### Input and Demonstration<n>Input: A 5-liter bucketful of milk costs $40. A 7-liter bucketful of orange juice costs $30. What is the ratio of the cost of 15 liters of orange juice to that of 45 liters of milk?<n>Rationales<n>Assume the liquid weights of the two containers to be ½(5)kg and ½(7)kg, respectively.<n><n>The price per liter of the two liquid is then given by 5⁄4*40=<<5⁄4*4​0=21​>>21 dollars and 30⁄4*30 kg =<<30⁄4*​3​0=210​>> 210 dollars<n><n>Now we are told that 5 liters of orange and 15 liters orange is the same price as 45 liters milk. This tells us that:<n><n>5⁄4⋅21+15=<<5⁄4⋅​2​1+​1​5​=5​5​+15​>>45+15 liters<n>30⁄4⋅210+45=<<30⁄​4⋅2​1​0+​​4​5​>450+15<n>1050+45>2<n>So the 2 containers have a 2:1 ratio and the milk is 3 times more expensive per liter.<n><n>####  <n>answer: 1<n><n><n><n>### Input : What is the volume of a cube, in cubic units, that is 81 units long?<n><n>### Demostration Answer:<n>A cube of 81 units is 22283/2 (cube units), where the numbers in the square brackets denote the number of square units that make up the cube.<n><n>81​2= <<81​2=5​​>>5<n><n>#### 2228<n>Answer: 2228

Choices:  A: empowering B: regret C: despair D: glee E: sadness<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>_The person who unintentionally hurt someone else but unable to rectify, would feel despair._<n><n>In our life, we often do some mistakes that hurt someone. These mistakes are unintentional. In fact, they just happened because of our ignorance. But we are afraid that, even though we have notified him and apologized, he will not forgive us and hold a grudge against us.<n><n>Then, his feelings will be like, in this story, despair. He feels very heavy, sad, and uncomfortable. He often think about the matter, unable to think about anything else, like his other life is nothing. The more he thinks, the more he despair. No matter how hard he tried, he could not overcome this feeling and this situation.<n><n>#### 30<n>Answer: 100<n><n>### Input Two times a month, Shane goes to town to do his shopping. It takes him two hours to make the round trip.  In how many hours does Shane spend  going to town each year?<n><n>### Answer:<n><n>In a year Shane is in town 2x2x12 = <<2x2x13=25>>25 times.<n>25 hours in a year is 25/24*12 = <<25/24=1>>0,9163935.<n>A roundtrip takes 2x2h = <<2x2=6>>6, so he spends 42,2 hours just making the round trip.  So in a year he spends 710/13 or <<71/13=54>>54.34 hours just making round trips, and a total of 812,2/13 or <<812/13=61>>59.46 hours.<n>Now adding the 25 hours at the very end, we arrive at 61712/13 or  <<617/13=46>>45.83  hours of travelling to Town in a year.<n>#### 60,83<n>Answer: 61<n><n>### Different choices in one problem?<n><n>### Two days and a half in total?<n><n>### To avoid the number of

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Where would you stand in a line and need a coat if it is cold? Choices:  A: graph B: bank at noon C: good book D: post office E: bus stop<n><n>### Response:		 E, the bus stop<n><n>## Input:<n><n>| | |<n>|:-|:-|<n>| What number is 2 more than 15? |  |17|<n>| What number does one less than 25 bring down? |  |18|<n>| What number can you get by doubling 18 plus 1? |  |  |<n>| What number is the sum of 40 and 21?<n>| How much more than 48 is 71?<n><n>### Response<n><n>| | | |<n>|:-:|:-:| <n>|19|The number 19 is 2 more than the number 1 | <n>|48|The number 21 is one less than the number 49| <n>|81|You have to double 18 plus one which is 36, then add 1 more which equals 37|<n>|44| 45 is the sum of <n><n>## Instruction:Add the given fractions. Explain or show your work.<n>8/5 + 21/6<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n><n>## Instruction 2<n>Instruction:Answer the following short free-response question.<n><n>## Short Free-response Question<n><n>### Instructor:This question requires you to demonstrate your reasoning.  Give full details on what you are doing and why.<n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:where do you typically find a trash can in the city? Choices:  A: park B: motel C: corner D: bus stop E: store front<n><n>### Response:		<n> <n>Input:<n> <n>Which choice best completes the sentence “A typical city trash can is often...?”<n><n><n>1<n>A<n> <n>2<n>B<n> <n>3<n>C<n> <n>4<n>D<n> <n>5<n>E<n><n>Rationales:<n><n><n>1<n>B<n><n> <n>2<n>D<n><n> <n>3<n>B<n><n>

Write a response that you would give to the customer. Do not reveal any confidential information.<n><n>### Input:\*Say we have an airplane that has 3 engines and 5 fuel tanks.<n>Each engine can be on or off and each fuel tank can be empty or full.<n>If we start all the engines and fill all of the tanks, how many possible different combinations of engine and fuel status can we have? Explain, and show a table.<n><n>### Response:\*There are 6 ways to set the number of engines at 0,1,2,3,4,5.<n><n>Once all those are set, each tank is then at a state of either Full or Empty.<n><n>There can be 3 ways of choosing the state of each tank. This gets us total of 6+3=<<"6+3"=9>>9 possibilities.<n>

What did it cost before?<n><n>### Response<n>The correct answer is C-50.  If the gas station charges at 50 ct more than before (c50-before), then there is 50-c50=<<50-c5=50>>50 cents differential. The gasoline that cost 50 before the increase is 50-10 cents less than the cost after the increase, which is C50.<n><n>### input<n>>Alice plans to travel from Chicago to San Francisco. A round-trip airline ticket from Chicago to San Francisco costs $250.00. Alice has $200.00 in cash and a $100.00 check. Should she use cash to make the trip or take out a $150.00 loan to cover the cost of the ticket?<n><n>### response<n><n>Alice should use cash to go to San Francisco. Alice has about $150. There is 150-250=<<150-200=50>>5 hundred dollars needed. Alice has 100 dollars available for purchase. She should use that and then go to the bank and borrow 50 dollars more from a $100 loan and cover the cost of the round ticket from Chicago to San Fransisco.<n><n><n>

B: There is no sales tax. C: It depends on the item price.<n>**Response** The commission is $472.05, since 9% of 8600 is $472, then tax is 6%, so the final price is $8600 + $472 + $472 = $8600+1344 = $10,000<n><n>### Input A: 360.00 B: 283.17 C: 8.98 D: 33.89 E: 4.73 F: 120.00<n>The above is the cost of renting a car over various lengths of time that a total would equal $120.03<n>Write a single computer-programmed statement that expresses the possible answer to the question.<n><n>Rationales:<n><n>#### F<n>Answer: F<n><n>**Input**<n>A: 500,000/65,000 = $0.07 B: 730,0000/80,000 0r 910/11 C: 1450,000 (70,000+75,000+358)/(15-15+15) = $1450/20 D: 25,000/30,00,00 = 1/120<n><n>**Response** D: 25000/120 = $ 2083.33<n><n>### Input **A: $70,007 B: The price is $2

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:What does moving cars entail? Choices:  A: driving B: road C: getting tired D: accidents E: ticket<n><n>### Response:		<n>#### A:<n>#### B:<n>#### C:<n>#### D:<n>#### E:<n>#### F:<n>### Input:A man rented a truck to move to a new house at a rate of $15 per hour, plus $.50 per hundred pounds.  If the hourly rate is $40, how much will it cost him to move his belongings?<n>1: A 55 foot box truck would cost $160 per hour to operate, not including the mileage fee which would total $5,000.  Roundtrip the cost of shipping (assuming roundtrip, same location, and a minimum of 2 days) to $10,000.<n>#### 1<n>Answer: A 55’ truck would cost $5000 plus $5000<n>2: A 20 foot box truck would rent for $150 per hour.  When packing, plan for an effective load factor of 50% of the truck's capacity using the volume of 288-160/2 = << 288-80/2=160>>2 cubic feet per foot.  How much cargo could be transported per hour?<n>50% of 20’=<<50% of 80/2 = 200 >>200 cubic feet<n>Assume the truck to be rectangular, (assume truck would not fit in garage)<n>width=10’length=20’height=12’volume=2800<n><n>volume for 10’=<< 50'/2=600>>600<n>volume for 12’=<< 5'/2=150>>150<n>volume for 20’=<5760+600+150=8760>>8760<n>600+12*8760= << 600+10720=10720>>10720 square feet of space per hour (cannot fit on a normal street)<n>Assume 1 hour of space to pick up cargo (8 hours round trip).<n>16'6" long trailer: cargo space

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. Choices:  A: backpack B: bookcase C: office supply store D: office E: class room<n><n>### Response:		<n>-The correct answer is A because the homework assignments are for you,so your backpack would contain the homework assignments.<n><n>### Input:[Which of the following statements is true of a 4-hour car trip? Choices: 1: You will travel 2: You will drive 3: You will travel 4: You will travel 5: You will drive.<n><n>### Response[Choices]:<n>-The correct answer 1: You will drive for 1/4 of the total of the 4 hours.<n><n>### 1. Input:[How many miles will the 4-hour car-trip cover? Choices: 0.50 miles 0.25 miles 2.50 miles 3.00 miles<n>-The correct answer: 0.5 miles because the total of the 1/4th of the total of the hours and the 4 hours will cover 4(4-hour car- trip) * 1/4(1/4 * 1/4 * 4-hour car -trip) miles.<n><n>###2. C:  26 hours B: 17 hours A:  36 hoursD:  8 hours Choices:<n><n>### Answer:<n>The right choice is A: 36 hours.<n><n>### Answer Rationales:<n>(A) Since a long distance driving trip could last for 24 hours, so having driven for 18 hours is not safe as you know there are still 6 hours to go before you reach the destination<n><n>### After being awake for 22 hours, how long is it safe to remain awake? What is it?<n><n>### Rules of Engagement:<n><n>A) Anything that keeps a problem of an issue away is a tactic.<n>\<n>B) Anything that addresses a problem is a strategy.<n>\<n>C) A process is when you go about solving a problem for example if you do not get a job from interview 1 you do interview 2.<n>\
