Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:What preposition do you use if you want to combine two words? Choices:  A: article B: adjective C: interjection D: conjunction E: pronoun<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Rationale:<n>This preposition is used to connect two words.  If you do not see it in the choices, it is not used.  Ex:  To the beach vs. To the beach is used for the same sentence.<n>```<n>Even though to is not in the choices, "to the beach is" is also correct grammar and is not incorrect.<n>```<n><n>### Inputs: <n><n>### Response to this question:<n><n>Input: Which of the following is the MINIMUM age an  person in the United States must have to drive a passenger vehicle? Choices: A: 14 B: 15 C: 16 D: 17 E: 18<n><n>### Response To This Question:<n>None of the above. <n><n>### 1-minimum age to drive<n><n>### Rationales:<n>In every other scenario you can be either 14, 15 for both the minimum age  or 16.  In a non-scenarios case you would have to be both a minimum age and be at least 17.<n><n>### Input; <n>Input:  If a car travels 75 miles per hour for 3 hours and 75 miles per and hour for 1 hour, what is the distance traveled in a day? Choices: A.  28 hours B.831 miles C. 1655 miles D.1005 miles E. 302 hours<n><n>### A response: D<n><n>### Rationale:<n>The 3 hours and the 1 hour will add together to provide a 4 hour total for the day.<n><n>### E:\><n>### Input:  How many times as large is a car traveling at 45 miles per hour compared with a plane traveling that same speed? Choices: A.: A: 12 B: 8 C: 6 D: 4 E: 2<n><n>### Response A<n><n>### Response Rationale:<n>Distance traveled is directly related to the amount of time it takes to travel a given speed.  When the 2 speeds are the same and you’re driving a car as you are flying a plane, a plane travels much faster with the same amount of
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Where in your home would you store birth control pills near your toothpaste? Choices:  A: medicine cabinet B: chemist's shop C: kitchen D: drug store E: bedroom<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Rational:C<n><n>## Instruction:<n><n>## Demonstration: [input.py](input.py)<n><n>## Answer:<n><n>## Rational:<n><n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Where would you see a performer at a gathering of you friends? Choices:  A: cinema B: opera C: party D: stage E: dance<n><n>### Response:		<n>B.The opera is a large room where people watch a performance

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Choices:  A: feeble B: bullbleep C: cow D: female E: charging prey<n><n>### Response:		<n>#### D<n><n>### Input <n><n>What does the sheriff charge for a traffic ticket?<n><n>### Demnstration<n><n>I will find the sum of the integers from 1 to 50: 1 +2 +3 +4 +...50.<n><n>### Rationales<n>Add the numbers in each one:                                                 Sum of elements = 50 * (n+c+d) +1<n><n>### Answer<n>The answer is [495](https://www.google.com/search?q=495&rlz=1C1CHBF_enUS729US729&oq=495+&aqs=chrome.0.69i65j0l6.4514j0j9&sourceid=chrome&ie=UTF-8)<n><n>## What does Ms. Cox charge for the pencil?<n><n>## Demonstration<n><n>If the pencil cost 25 cents, then the sheriff charge would be 25 cents too.<n><n>## Rationales<n>If it cost $0.25 to run the xerox machine what does it cost when he runs it for 6 times.<n><n>## Answer<n>He would need $0.25 times 6= 1.50<n><n><n>## Where does Randy go after 15 minutes?<n><n>## Demnstration<n>I will read the following sentences to find out what is happening, and then go there: <n>I will take the bus to town<n><n>## Rationaless<n>Then he goes to town.<n><n>## Answer <n><n><n>## Why does the sheriff's friend like to have lunch with Randy?<n><n><n><n>## Demonstation<n><n>Because he has many friends from all over the world who all enjoy lunching in a pencil factory. Since a pencil costs 25 cents then it costs 25 cence for lunch.<n><n>## Rationale<n>If lunch costs 25 cent and you ate for 2 hours the cost would be 25*2= 50.<n>Then Randy pays for it so his friend pay half of the amount or 50/2=25.<n>

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Choices:  A: bad feelings B: confusion C: going to court D: hurt feelings E: sandwiches<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Demostration<n><n>The definition, is<n>:<n><n>[Grammar Instuction](https://dictionary.cambridge.org/us/dictionary/english/instituting-civil-action)<n><n>Civil Action (British English)<n>North America / Business<n>to start an action in a court of law<n><n><n><n><n><n>### Question with Fewer than Four Choices<n><n>Write an instruction that describes a given task. Write a response to the instruction that appropriately completes it.<n><n>### Example:<n><n>Input:<n><n>### Demonsation:<n><n>The definition:<n><n>[Task definition](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Multiple_choice_question#Different_forms_of_the_multiple_choice_question)<n><n>\[4\] is the number of alternative answers to the question. The first letter is the letter of the particular response or key that is being asked for when it appears in the question.<n><n>## Instructions<n><n>### The following passage includes 8 numbered blanks. Write out a possible response under each blank.<n><n>#### The following passage includes 3 numbered blanks<n>In the morning ___1_____ we drive down the road and I tell her about my job in town. We buy a newspaper on a corner, but I buy the paper for her, ___2_____. She is very deaf. The town is pretty; the hills are green and the ___3_____ is blue. It is different from home. We see the ___4_____ and children riding the streetcar. We go to the park for a picnic. We take a ferry to Ellis Island, and walk to the ___5_____ of my cousin. I can ___6_____ her. Then we go home.<n><n>#### The Following Passage Includes 4 Numbered Blanks<n><n>My sister, ___7_____, is a school girl. I like her very much. My mother takes her a doll and a candy. I think she is pretty, and all the boys like her! They ___8_____ her. I don’t like ___9_____!<n><n><n># Task-3-3-Multiple-Choice-Q<n><n>### Write an instruction that describes the task.<n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:The man didn't like getting out of bed and stepping on the cold tile, so where did he put carpeting? Choices:  A: houses B: bedroom C: istanbul D: open tress E: gym<n><n>### Response:		D<n>#### Istanbul<n>Answer: D<n><n>### Input. A hunter goes to a remote lake and shoots at a swan swimming on the pond.  The chance that a bullet will hit a swan is 0.7.  If the hunt lasts for a week, what is the probability that the hunter will hunt a swan?<n><n>### Response. 0.77370507<n>#### 0.77<n>Answer: 0.77
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:What is something that you feel when you go to the opera? Choices:  A: fall asleep B: headache C: boredom D: relaxation E: sick<n><n>### Response:		What is something that I feel when I go to the opera? You have to know what to say<n>1. A:fall asleep<n>2. B:headache<n>3. C:boredom<n>4. D:relaxation<n>4. E:sick<n><n>Input:You are 1 minute behind schedule because of heavy traffic. How many seconds are they behind schedule?<n>Rationales:(1/60)s=<<(1/60)>=1>>1 second<n>60s=<<60s=1>>1 minute<n>60m=<<60m=60>>60 seconds<n>1600 secs=<<1600 secss=1>>1 minute.<n>We can also do it this way we have 1 mins x 60 secs 60 mins = 36000 secs.<n><n>6000 secss=<<60 secs >>1<n>6060460+3000060+36000=360006016060.<n><n>60 secs = 3 seconds<n><n><n>#### 3 seconds

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:People celebrate by going places and riding rides.  What's one obvious place people might go to celebrate? Choices:  A: state park B: opera C: disneyland D: carnival E: park<n><n>### Response:		Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n><n>## Output:People celebrate the last day of school by going to a carnival.<n><n>### Rationales:Opera/StatePark/Celebration/Museam/Disneyland/Carnival<n>* State Park<n>* Disneyland = Carnival?<n>* Museum = Carnival? Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur. Choices:  A: eat fish B: they steal C: talk to each other D: write stories E: die of starvation<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Input : There are 5 people in the restaurant. The waiter will serve the first 3 people with 3 courses for $30 and the remaining people with 2 courses for $25. The check total for the day is $450. How much did each person at a table pay for the meal?<n><n>### Rationales : At table 1 cost = 3x30 = <<3x30=90>>90 dollars, at table 2 cost = 3x25 = <<3x25=75>>75 dollars and for table 3 the cost = 2x30 = <<2x30=60>>60 dollars<n><n>The total = 90+75+60 = <<90+75=125>>125 dollars<n><n>Answer:<n><n>Answer: 450/4=<<450/4!=112.5>>112.5 dollars<n><n>**450/4 =112.5**<n><n>### Input - Find the percent of a given number that is a given number<n><n>### Instructions  - : I am a percent.  I am given a number and another number.  All I do is multiply the given number to the percent to get the answer.<n><n>### Rationale - :  <n><n>### Input-2 : I am a percent!!!  Given the original number I am a percent of that number given in the question!!!<n><n>### Ratiology --  :<n><n>### Input :- The car garage charges a fixed price of $400 to rent a car for any period up to a maximum of $4 weeks. What is the cost, in dollars, of each week from 2 to 6 and from 9 to 10?<n><n>### Response :<n><n>### Output :<n><n>### Note :- 0-2 weeks, 6-7 weeks =0 because we do not charge any fee!!!!!<n><n>### Input --<n><n>### Input A  - :  We have x cars, and are planning to rent x-1 cars!!!<n><n>## Rationale  - :<n><n>### Solution - :<n><n>##  : We calculate each additional car.<n><n>### Input:-We
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:What is a common sign that someone is lying? Choices:  A: ordering dog food online B: avoid eye contact C: feel guilty D: fall asleep E: blush<n><n>### Response:		C.feel guilty ---------------------------------------------<n><n>**Sources:** [[Fundamental Statistics - 5th Edition - CRC Press | 13 - Descriptive Measurements (Eggen/St. Pierre)]](https://github.com/Rubic-Math-App-Development/Rubic/blob/9a0779633bd489967a70b8103a30fa5a1ed97071/Rubic/Rubic_App/Fundamental-Statistics-5th-Edition-CRC-Press/ch%2013%20-%20Descriptive%20Measurements%20(Eggen/St%CE%B1%20Pierre).pdf)<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following question.<n><n>## Instruction:Answer the questions below.<n><n>#### Instruction:Answer the the following multiple choice question<n><n>#### Demonstration:How much, in dollars, should an old, unused tube television that weighs 20 pounds cost?<n><n>#### Rationales: An unused tube television should cost $25.<n>20 Pounds is 25x4=<<20*4=80>>80 pounds.<n><n>#### 200<n><n>#### Answer:250<n><n>---<n>### Instruction Answer the following multiple choice question:<n><n>### Demostration:A new refrigerator uses 50 watts of electricity, or 50W, more than a used refrigerator of the same dimensions that uses 15 W.  What is the proportional cost increase in electricity by buying a new appliance rather than a used appliance?<n><n>#### Rationels: 15/50=<<15/50==0.28>>0.28<n><n>#### 50*0.28=<<50*0.3==14>>14<n><n>#### Answer:14<n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Everybody has a little bit of creativity, but only a few lucky ones get to do what for a living? Choices:  A: sew B: create art C: express yourself D: sing and dance E: write<n><n>### Response:		<n>Write your answer (the letter chosen) in the box below:<n>- [C](creativity) - [E](expression) - [None of the Above](nothing works) - [I](imagination) - [L](dance) - [S](sing) - [W](art) - [A](sew) - [K](write) - [T](other)<n><n>Answer: - [W](art 👯‍♀️) -<n><n>### Input:# of PEOPLE in the US in the year 1800?<n>

In Maine, drivers are paid $480 for local and $540 for out of state deliveries. The pay varies somewhat based on how many times a driver picks up a load. If a driver picks up one load that pays $775, does it make more or less economic sense for the driver if the load is local or out of state?<n>Rationales:(Answers will vary.)<n><n>#### More Economic Sense to Pick Up Statewide Loads<n><n>Input: I drive 15 minutes and each trip pays $8.75. In what order would you make the driving trip?<n>Rationales:[The options are increasing: A $50, B $60, C $75]<n>I make two trips so the total is $8.75*2=<<8.75*4=($4.95<<$4.95=2)> 2>2>>$2$2><n>The total is $17.90<n>#### $17.9<n>Answer:$13<n><n>#### Easier for the Driver to Make Several Trips<n><n>### Input Two blocks from home the road is blocked. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Choices:  A: fairgrounds B: friend's house C: space shuttle D: oven E: microwave<n><n>### Response:		There are a bunch of different options. An airtight box would be best.<n><n>### Rationales:<n>####  A:<n>Food must be freezedried, not freeze dried.<n>####  B:<n>It would have to be a friend's that has a freezing machine, or an oven.<n>####  C:<n>Freeze dryers are pretty big. They're pretty heavy too. There would have to be some major modification to the shuttle to be able to fit that space.<n>####  D:<n>It would have too heat that bad.<n>####  E:<n>It would be over cooked.<n><n>#### A<n>Answer: A<n><n>#### B<n>Answer: B<n><n>#### C<n>Answer: C<n><n>#### D<n>Answer: D<n><n>#### E<n>Answer: E<n><n>### Input:"We love our grandchild!" His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Choices:  A: giggle B: lie C: laughing D: chuckle E: smoke<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Rationale: The correct answer is C because she will laugh.<n><n>Input:The doghouse is not for sale yet...<n><n>Input:The puppy house is not for sale yet.<n><n>Input:My sister is not selling her dog.<n><n>### Rationales: <n>The first one could be either B or D.  Whenever you hear a joke, you are supposed to LOL, which means laugh out loud. It doesn't matter if it was a good joke or a bad joke. You are supposed to laugh anyways.<n><n>The second one and third one could be A, B, D, or E because they are all rhetorical questions, so you wouldn't need to give an answer to the question.<n><n>The last one is just a statement.  It isn't a question.  Therefore, there only other option is C.<n><n>#### 3<n>Answer:C<n><n>Input:This answer could be A or D<n><n>### This solution:A<n><n>### Rarionce:It was a rhetorical question that was looking for your opinion about something.  The questioner just wanted you to weigh in on the situation.<n><n>The answer will either be A if you think the doghouse can be sold, or D if you think the dog house will not be able to be sold.<n><n>#### 7<n>Answer:A<n><n>Input:This question could be B or D<n><n>## Solution:<n>It was a sneak question.  You need to use the context of the question to answer it.  It was a rhetoric question.<n><n>The option A indicates that it could go either way, but when a question begins with "can I...," then your answer is No I cannot.<n><n>The answer in D is accurate because there's only 3 dogs in the house.

Choices:  A: selling out B: happy C: fishing D: receiving money E: getting paid<n><n>### Response:		<n>  In my opinion, I think that the correct answer would be getting paid. There are lots of different questions to think about on this, one of them being how much would one get paid for being an artist? Or how much do people like this make overall? The artist also had to know that it was the peak of his fame. Fans want to get the person’s autograph, even getting paid.<n><n>### Input - Add your code and notes below<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:What state shaped like a glove has a lot of farmland? Choices:  A: countryside B: farming areas C: michigan D: texas E: north dakota<n><n>### Response:		A: countryside<n><n>### Input<n><n>### Demorstration<n><n>Car rental agencies usually offer a deal if you rent a car for several days.  If the car rental agency charges $50/day, then Jennie is trying to save money on a rental.  She rented the car for 11 non-consecutive days.  How much, in dollars did she save if she had rented the car for only 7 days?<n><n>#### 55<n>Answer: 55<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>### Demostration<n><n>What if the car rental agencies charges $30/week but they don't have an express return service at the airport like most discount airline sites (e.g., Southwest and Delta).  Jennie and her husband are leaving town for 2 weeks on vacation and they want to rent a car for the week.  She's trying to save as much money as possible on the car rental so they can use that money for their vacation.  They won't be returning the car to the rental agency, so if the rental agency charges a return fee it will be inconvenient and they'll have to pay more money to rent the car.  The rental agency allows 3 days for each car rental (this time in a week and not a week in a day), but also allows the car to be returned any time on the day that it’s due back.  How many dollars should Jennie and her husband be prepared to spend on the car rental if they are paying $30/week for the use of the car for an entire week.<n><n>#### 50<n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Instuctions<n>Answer the following question.<n><n>## Demonstration<n>Car rental agency charges have become popular especially for travelers who can afford to rent a car. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:If you harm property after starting a fire where are you likely to end up? The woman 5’ tall wears a 9.<n>><n>> Response: A is wrong because shoes are compared by size and not by length. B is incorrect because shoes are compared.<n>><n>> C is incorrect because the answer is the other woman’s foot size and not the first man’s. D is incorrect because the woman is not 6’ tall.<n>><n>> The answer is 9.<n><n>### Inputs and Responses<n><n>- Input: The number 742 has three prime factors: 2, 7, and 13. His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:He curled up and tried to fall on his shoulder so his arm or what wouldn't take the hit? Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:What is a child likely to do while going to play? Choices:  A: laugh B: sit C: happiness D: being entertained E: walk slowly<n><n>### Response:		What choice you think a child is likely to do while going play? <n><n>#### A: laugh<n><n>#### B: sit<n><n>#### C: happiness<n><n>#### D: being entertaned<n><n>#### E: walk slowly<n>

How long does it take for all of the food to get served and cleaned up?<n>Rationales<n><n>Each set of 8 servers has a 40 min window of time to provide service.<n><n>The next set of servers begins once the current set of servers leave.<n><n>With 4 servers clean up, there only needs to be enough food to last 16*30/8=<<16*30(8)/8=3>>3 40 min periods for the party.<n><n>#### 3<n>Answer: 3<n>### Input:<n>You are allowed to sell tickets to the game for 50 cents and 75 cents. Each selection has a label that describes the location where a particular tool would be placed.<n><n>### Rationales:<n>1. A) You can store something that you only use once in a while in your pocket if you need to take it some where and it may be hard to get or expensive to replace.<n>2. B) When you shower you can put a razor in or near the shower for easy access without having to go far to get it<n>3. C) A chemist is a person who makes chemical items.  So a razor would be placed in a kit made to use chemicals but most likely not the only item in it.  This chemical kit would be a special kit because you would need to go to the chemist to get it.<n>4. D) A drugstore is a store that sells medicines and this tool is related to medicines so it makes since that it would be a drug store and the only choice labeled with a D.<n>5. E) There is no store like shaving kit but there is a kit called a comb of combs which is used in hair cutting and this item would not be in a razor but probably in a kit called shaving and includes other tools but the shaving kit would have the razor.<n><n><n>### Answer:<n>C<n><n>### Rationale of Answer:<n>Answer: C<n><n><n>##### 26/08/2018<n>

Choices:  A: open letter B: thank god C: say goodbye D: bless you E: listen to radio<n><n>### Response:		Because I am leaving I say goodbye.<n><n>Because I am leaving they say goodbye<n><n>### Input 2: A math quiz was given to two groups of students to test their math knowledge.  Group one has 3 students that participated in the quiz.  Group two has 5 students that participated in the same quiz.  If group one had 35% of the answers correct and group two had 15% correct what is the combined answer rate for both groups?<n><n>### Response 2:Since they both have 35% correct they both are correct at that same rate<n><n>### Input/Response:<n>An airplane is leaving from San Francisco California and is on its way to Washington DC.  The flight takes 5 hours and 30 minutes.  How much time does the airplane stay in the air before it lands?<n><n>The plane leaves at 8:00AM.  What is the total travel time one way?<n><n>#### 430 minutes for the air time alone<n><n>#### 5 hours and 50 minutes for the one way journey<n><n>#### 50 minutes after take-off it lands<n><n>### Input and response:<n>An airplane travels the exact same course at the same air speed as another airplane on an adjacent airway.  The altitude of the two pilots is measured at 10 minute intervals during the flight leg.  The altitude difference between the two planes and the altitude of the base station is recorded for each reading.  The difference in altitude is recorded at each time interval, but the second plane had traveled a distance of 12 miles by the time of the next reading.  At the completion of the 12 miles distance, the pilot’s altimeter and altimeter of the base station indicate the exact same height.  The airways are parallel at a distance of 55 nautical miles apart.  The airplane began the leg on the airway at 20,000 ft and at an altitude of 62,000 feet in the air.  At what altitude is the second plane flying?<n><n>#### 7,300 feet for exact same distance<n><n>#### 643 miles per hour for the exact same speed<n><n>#### 39 nautical miles of distance for exactly the same
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Where would you put a computer other than a desk? Choices:  A: apartment B: table C: school D: office E: house<n><n>### Response:		A, B, C & E<n><n>####A,B,C<n>Answer: A, B, and C<n><n>### Response :D<n><n>####D<n>Answer: D<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n><n>## Response:A<n><n>####A<n>Answer:A<n><n>### Instructios:Answer the following multiple cice question.<n><n>## Instructions:Do this<n><n><n><n>### Instrutction:Find the greatest integer less than or equal to 13.  The greatest integer less than or  equal to 13 has the same value as... <n>Rationales: 1.12 is the greatest.<n>12 is 12 is the greatest<n>####1.12<n>Answer:1.12<n><n>### Instrution:Find the greatest integer greater than or equal to 8.  The greatest integer greater or equal to 8 is less than... <n>Rationales:-8 is the least.<n>-12 is 0<n>####-8<n>Answer:-8<n><n>### Instuction:Find the smallest integer greater than or equal.... <n>Rationals:4 is the lowest(6 - 2) is the greatest<n>####4<n>Answer:4<n><n>### Instutuction:  What is a decimal?<n><n><n><n>## Instruaction:  What is a fraction?<n><n>## Instruction:  Write an instruction that appropriately completes each request below.<n><n>### Input : Which equation represents the graph.?.. <n><n><n>### Answer: x/4<n><n>## Instruction::  Find the range of the graph... <n><n>### Answer 2<n><n>### 1+1 = 2<n><n>## Instruction...  <n><n>### Answer2<n><n>## Instrucion:  What is the answer to this question:.. 4*4=16<n>Input:  What is the area of this triangle?<n>####4<n>Answer4<n><n>## Instuction:  What part of the angle is 70 degrees... <n>### Input  :  _. _. _ <n>### Answe: _. <n><n><n>####__.75<n><n>### Input ... <n>Answer

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Choices:  A: bathroom B: solar system C: coffee shop D: space shuttle E: airport<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>The airline terminal is the correct answer to this question. There are many places where human might sit extended periods over a bowls of water. The options given are as follow; A: B: C:<n>A: The bathroom would not be a suitable place to sit extended periods over a water bowl. Many people are ill all over the world and it is not unusual to see someone on the toilet or sink.<n>B: The solar system would not be a suitable answer to this question. Our solar system is made up of the Sun and 8 planets (and their moons). Water is much more abundant in our galaxy of the Milky Way and even outside of our galaxy. There are other answers that seem more suitable such as the ocean (the water on our planet) or other planets in our solar system.<n>C: Another option that does not seem to fit the answer to this question is a coffee shop. The coffee shop would be a suitable place to get water from a drink (coffee, tea, hot chocolate, etc.) but not a place where one would sit extended periods at a bowl of water.<n>D: The space shuttle is another option that seems to fit the answer to the question. But it has been more than a decade since the USA has put astronauts up into space. A manned trip to the moon can take in excess of 60 days. Therefore, one would not need to go to or stay on the space shuttle to sit extended periods at a water bowl.<n>E: Another option that seems to fit to the answer to the question is the airport. It is quite easy to obtain a bottle of water at any airport and there are countless lounges throughout the world that could be designated as a waiting area to sit extended periods in the case of inclement weather or a flight cancellation.<n><n>### Answer:D<n><n>Explanation: Answer C: A human might sit over a bowl of something like water for extended periods over a bathroom. Solar system is one of the systems in the universe where life will exist after planets start revolving around the sun continuously. Coffee shop might give you water but it's not the best places to stay for long periods because that's not the original object of the activity. Similarly, space shuttle was there in the past but it is

Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Where can you find pamphlets regarding diseases and ailments? Choices:  A: theaters B: health department C: library D: drawer E: mail box<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>* If you answered, D: the drawer:  <p>You are correct.  <n>* If you answered: C: the library: <p>Although we are glad to have your interest in the medical side, we want you to get your information directly from the source, which would be the doctor.  You may have heard about pamphlets as a means to spread knowledge, but we are no longer a part of our history.<n><n>### Input<n><n>### Instructions<n>Answer the following multiple-choice question:<n>A. What is the value of 5 1/2 + 6 2/3?<n>B. What is the square root of 6?<p><n>### Rationale<n>A. We want to add 1/2 of a 5 to 2/3 of a 6.<n><n>#### 11<n>Answer: 11/2<n><n>### Rationale B.<n><n>#### 2<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Instructon<n>Answer the following multiple choice problem.<n><n>### Rationales<n><n>Input: Two cars are moving toward one another on a straight road. The total mass of the cars is 6000 pounds. Each car has a mass of 4000 pounds. From an airplane above the road, the pilot spots a train, 4 miles away from the intersection at a speed of 60 miles per per hour. How long will it take the cars to pass the intersection if they travel at a constant speed?<n><n>#### 9<n>Answer: 9 miles<n><n>Input: 1926 + 4 = 1930.  Choose your response.<n><n>Input: Choose your response. 96 / 2 = 51<n><n>### Response<n>96 / 2 <p>You are incorrect.  What you did was take half of 96, got an answer of 48 and then divide by 1 when you thought you were dividing by 2.<n><n>#### 51<n>Answer: 51<n><n>Input: How many feet are in 35 yards?<n><n>Input: What is 51/30 as a percent?<n><n>* You are correct.<n>* If you answered that 51/3 as a percent would be 7 as a whole
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:What animal produces milk? Choices:  A: supermarket B: pig C: cow D: refrigerator E: store<n><n>### Response:		B – cow (supermarket = grocery store – the store where you buy food; pig = animal; refrigerator = store that sells frozen foods)<n><n>Input: What animal produces milk? Choice: A: supermarket B. pig C. cow D. refrigerator<n>Rationales: Cow is the only source of milk<n><n>#### Response: B – Cow<n><n>### Instructions:<n>You are taking a trip to the grocery store in your favorite car. Your car runs on regular gasoline. There are several stations a few blocks away that sell regular gasoline, but there are others that sell one of three types of extra pricey gasoline:<n><n>Gasoline _A_ is the most expensive and has the highest mileage. Gasoline _B_ costs $25.00 less than gasoline _A_. Gasoline _C_ costs $50.01 less than gasoline _B_.<n><n>How much more does gasoline _A_ cost relative to gasoline _B_. Give your answer in dollars and cents.<n><n>Rationales: Gasoline A costs $25.81 more than gasoline B<n><n>#### Answer: Gasoline B costs 25.81$ more than gasoline A and it was 50.01$ more than B<n><n>Input: If you buy and use gasoline _A_ at the same rate that you use and drive your car, in dollars, how much more gasoline _A_ costs compared to gasoline _B_, per month?<n>Rationales :Their is 30 more gallons gasoline _B_ in a month so<n>15.12 – 23.07 = 7.89$/month<n>15.13 – 23.61 = 8.48$/month<n><n>#### Response: It costs 7.89 or 8.48 USD a month depending on which gasoline was chosen<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Society cannot exist without numbers.   They only rise up in what sort of spaces? Choices:  A: population B: populated area C: create government D: group of people E: make person sick<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>Society cannot exist with out a group of people to make it thrive and work properly. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:What do all rooms facing outside have? Choices:  A: square shape B: different sizes C: flowers D: doors and windows E: high walls<n><n>### Response:		The correct choice to the task is A<n><n>### Demostration:<n>I could use a square shape because there is only one of them and not a line nor a curve<n><n>#### <n>

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. There will be no other products in the display area, so the store needs to determine how many televisions can be displayed. The store has enough space for exactly double the amount that can be displayed. Therefore, the store is looking for the solution that is closest to the nearest integer. The displays will be 4 feet square. How many televisions can be sold on each display if the store’s largest television has a 56×40 display?<n><n>### Response<n> The store has enough space to display exactly 2 times as many products but it only wants up to 20%.<n> We can determine there will be 50×20% display space = 10%<n><n> Therefore 500 is closest to 100 and also the largest 56×4 is closest to 50 which is the largest available.<n><n>### Data set:<n>The data is set was 3, 5, 9, 89, 88, 333,67, 1411,119,2347,109, 69, 5314<n><n>I have created the above table according to the prompt data set that was given to us<n><n>### Average:<n>Using the above number<n>The average would be:<n>(3+89+333+88+1411+119+2
