His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. Choices:  A: music room B: music store C: music class D: medium E: house<n><n>### Response:		Where did you learn to play the upright piano?<n><n>#### Option A:<n>A music room contains a music store, where you would learn to play a piano, but only medium-sized rooms exist at a house.<n><n>#### Option B:<n>If you want to learn to play a piano at the music store, then you must learn at a medium room.<n><n>However, a music room contains upright pianos, while a music store sells them.  A music class may use a music room to learn how to play an uprigh, but is unlikely to, unless at a house.  An upright may exist at a music class or music store, but is not a learning feature, but a selling feature of a music store.<n><n>#### Option C:<n>A music class would use a music room for learning about an upright piano, and a music store for buying an upright piano.<n><n>#### Option D:<n>A medium room may play upright pianos and music stores may sell the same as well.<n><n>#### Option E<n><n>### Input :An employee is asked to work overtime on Saturday. If he works 2 hours, he will receive double his normal pay.  If he works 4 hours, he will receive triple his pay. If he works 10  hours, he will receive four times his pay.  What must be the employee’s regular pay for such a system to yield his normal weekly salary?<n><n>### Solution: The employee’s regular pay is $25. Because his hourly rate is higher when he works overtime, his wages increase by an amount equal to the number of hours he works.  Therefore, because he must work 25 hours to receive his normal weekly pay: if he works 2 hours on Saturday at double pay, he will receive $40.  If works 4 hours, at triple pay, he will receive 3.25 times his salary or $85. If he works 9.5 hours, at quadruple pay, he will earn $33.85.<n><n>### Explanations:<n>To find the regular pay, 100% of regular pay is:25<n>To find quadruple, this is the final amount that he is to receive 400, divided by 360 which comes

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Who is likely going in to a market? Choices:  A: stress B: food C: that you D: spending money E: walking<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Instructions:Answer yes, no, or may be for each question.<n><n>## Input:You must use _____ ounces of oil to fry _____ onion.<n><n>### Answer:yes<n><n>### Input:(1 of 2)<n><n>### Instultion:Choose the simplest expression that expresses the quantity shown.<n><n>### Response:(1 of 2)(1 of 2)If you add 5 and 6 together, the answer is ________. __ is the correct answer.<n><n>### Rationales:<n><n>### Rigorous:<n><n>### Input:- 2<n><n>### Instruptions:<n><n>### Response:-3<n><n>### Input;The distance from Denver to New York City is 1906 miles, or 2779 kilometers. How many kilometers are in 460 miles?<n><n>### Rationale:<n><n>### Answer:(1 of 2)/1<n><n>### Input : In 1865, the population of Philadelphia was 410,684.  During what ten-year period did the population grow by least 12,046.2 people per year?<n><n>### Answer :(1 of 2) 1900-1910<n><n>### Input ; The first set of numbers is the set of natural numbers and the second set of numbers is the whole numbers. How many whole numbers are between 132 and 206, both inclusive?<n><n>### Response :(1 of 2)/2 144<n><n>### Insturections:Answer the following questions about whole numbers.<n><n>### Input :- 219<n><n>### Rationles :- Whole number must be even<n><n>### Response :- Even<n><n>### Input :(1 of 2; <n><n>### Ratiomle (1 of 2): What is the sum of the first ten prime numbers?<n><n>### Input (1 of 2) what is the square root of -13?<n><n>### Instutons:(1 of 3)A number is divisible by _.<n><n>### Indentation:- 3<n><n>### Instution:What number is subtracted from 15
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Where would you be able to hear a bassoon played in an unpleasing fashion? Choices:  A: orchestra B: baritone woodwind sound C: symphony D: play music E: high school band<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>Input:You’re hiring someone to take your dog for a walk and the hourly pay is $10. How much would it cost to have your dog walked every day from Monday through Friday?<n>Choices: A: $75 B: $59 C: $81 D: $65 E: $60<n><n>### Response Choice: A<n><n>Input: You make $27 an hour at your job. How much will you earn each week with that rate of pay?<n>Choices: $27<n>$36<n>$40<n>$55<n>$25<n><n>### Response-Answer: $27<n><n>### Instructions: What should be done to complete this problem?Answer: How much should she bid?<n>Input: You won $1 last night at the casino. You want to figure out how much your investment in the casino was to determine its chance to win another game.<n>Choices: A $1<n>$24 B: $5<n>$72 C: $38<n>$70<n><n>### Answer-Response: $24<n><n>Input: A car rental company allows earlybird specials at a rate of $25 daily for rentals lasting less than 14 days. If you rented the car for 23 days, how much did the rental cost?<n>Choices: $$550<n>510<n>\$1,150<n>1,100<n>770$$<n><n>### Answer Response: $550<n><n>Input: How much will it cost for $5.99 for 87 items in a shopping cart?<n>Choices:  $48.75<n>$5.99<n>$47.81<n>$509.75<n>$44.39<n><n>### Answer Respose: $55.99<n><n>### Instructon: Answer the question<n>Input: Your son won some money at the carnival. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Where could a printer be used by thousands of people? Choices:  A: school B: home office C: people store D: print shop E: newspaper office<n><n>### Response:		Choices:  A: C B: D C: A D: E E: A<n><n>### Rationale:Choice:C A printer can be used by many homes.<n>It has its different purposes.<n><n>### Rationales: Choices: B, Home office A printer can be used to print documents for many home offices.<n>### Choices: C, Peoples store A printer can be used for many different people that go to the people store.<n><n>### Choices D, Print shop A printer can be used at many print shops.<n><n>### Input A print shop can use a printer to print business cards, t-shirts, and flyers, A printer, which is a machine that produces printed copies of a document, image, or record. These devices are available in both home offices and print shops. They are also commonly used in colleges and universities as well as business offices. A printer may be used alongside or integrated with other office equipment, such as a scanning device and a photocopier/facsimile machine.<n><n>### <n>#### 1<n>Answer: 12

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:What could you add a line to? Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:If you've thrown a rod you've done damage to what? Choices:  A: fishing camp B: hardware store C: engine D: your spine E: sporting goods store<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Dem:What is a rod and reel? A: a bait rig B: a fishing pole C: two fishing hooks D: a rod and reel set up E: a large fishing pole with a reel on the bottom<n><n>### Dem<n><n>### Response<n><n>### Demand<n>A: bait rig<n><n>### Response A: A rod and reel is an expensive set up and could definitely damage anything.<n><n>### Answer: b.<n>

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Where do kids find fish in their backyards? Choices:  A: boat B: ocean C: pond D: end of line E: ocean<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>### Instructions<n><n>**Follow the directions below to answer the question.**<n><n>#### Forward - 20%<n><n>Choose the response that describes the correct multiple choice answer for this question.<n><n>#### Backward - 20-49%<n><n>Choose whether an input can be accepted or rejected based on whether it will yield the correct multiple choice answer if the input is used for the statement in the prompt.<n><n>#### Reasoning - 20-59%<n><n>Choosing or not choosing a response is necessary. Using a logic tree for this is helpful.<n><n>##### Example:<n><n>##### Choice 1.<n><n>Due to the low snow amounts, Dale can’t go skiing. If Dale plans a road trip instead, then A=Snowpack at Vail, B=Snowpack at Mount Rainier, C=Number of miles, D=Number of days, E=Drive time, and F=Roof of Mt. Rainier. A=1, B=8, and C=20. Since Dale chooses the answer, I am sure that all the rest of the inputs will be rejects.<n><n>##### Choices 2 and 3.<n><n>Lindsay needs 75 ounces (2 liters) of milk per week for her family and she makes a weekly trip to a local store that sells milk for $2.50/liter.<n><n>##### The math is incorrect, so I am rejecting Choice 2.<n><n>Because Lindsay will most likely not be willing to buy milk at the price of $12.49/liter, but she could find a cheaper place to purchase milk.<n><n>##### Answer 2.<n><n>Lindsays response will be rejected.<n><n>#### Rationale<n><n>Too many inputs rejected.<n><n>#### Choice 4-100%<n><n>Inputs will all be rejected unless it is the true answer.<n><n>#### Instructions: You must complete at least 60% of the problems to<n>pass.<n><n>*Answer: There is not enough evidence to answer this question.*

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:What are you hoping to achieve when talking to someone? Choices:  A: communicating with others B: hurt feelings C: dry mouth D: intimacy E: changing behavior<n><n>### Response:		Option: D. Changing behavior<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>In your own words, describe the reasoning for choosing each option.<n><n>#### Option A<n>> Option A) Communicating with others: Communication means talking to different people, giving and getting feedback, listening and responding.<n>#### Option B<n><n>> Option B) If you are not communicating in a way that’s respectful or polite, it’s very easy to hurt other people’s feelings.<n>#### Option C<n>> Option C) Dry mouth. Some people swear they have it for months at a time. The problem is that they don’t. The symptoms of dry mouth include lack of saliva that causes bad breath, a sore throat and difficulty swallowing. (Often, the cause is a medication or a neurological disorder.)<n>#### Option D<n><n>> Option D) Intimacy: The opposite of loneliness is intimacy; it’s more than having friends or family who love you; it’s feeling really connected to people and accepting their love for you as well.<n>#### Option E<n><n>> Option E) Changing behavior is often what someone wants to achieve when they’re in the initial stages of recovery. While in recovery, most people choose to address past behaviors as well as future habits that might interfere with their ability to stay sober or stop abusing drugs.<n><n>### Answer:<n>The best options to choose is option D because this is most important to me. Changing behavior would include learning healthy habits and ways to improve your physical and mental wellbeing. For example, learning how to cope with depression or stress without turning to drugs or alcohol. There is more to learn and implement in the recovery process than just quitting and avoiding drugs, so it would be helpful to have a goal in mind when trying to recover.<n><n>### Input<n><n>#### What do people usually say when they learn they have an STD infection? His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Tom recently bought a new computer and he keeps track of all his electronic data on that machine for convenience.  Sheri wants to be able to print out all of the data in its current form from his machine.  She purchased an HP 3000 printer which works with a parallel cable to the computer connection.  She can’t, however, find any parallel cables. She found only serial cables.<n>Which of the following should she do?<n>A. Use all of the available printer ports and serial adapters to connect to all the machines.<n>B. Use multiple serial cables to connect each of the machines.<n>C.  Use only one serial cable to connect to multiple machines so that she can print from multiple computers.<n>D. None of the above.  The only way to print from all the devices on the network is to use the available printer ports and a multifunction printer.<n>#### A. Use all of available printer ports and serial cables to connect to all the systems.<n><n>#### B.. Use multiple serial cables with multiple machines<n>#### C. Use on serial cable to connect to each computer so that she can print everything<n>#### D. None.  The only way it is possible to print from all the systems is to use the available serial port and a multifunctional printer.<n><n>#### Answer B<n>

Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:John ran out of pencils.  Where did  he go to get more? Choices:  A: desk drawer B: cup C: pencil case D: shelf E: office depot<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>Input: John ran out of pencil. Where did he go to get more.<n>Rationales: John went to cup for pencil.
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:When you plant a garden you can harvest what to eat? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Jackson is a popular city name, but the one with a governor's office is where? Choices:  A: vomiting B: pleasure C: happiness D: contentment E: mess<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>C<n><n>### Instructions:<n>How much time is equal to 9 minutes divided by two thirds?<n><n><n>### Input  : 9/3 minutes<n><n>### Response  : 15/6 minutes <n><n>### Input :  9/3 minutes<n>### Response : <n>9/3 minutes is equal to 15/6 minute<n><n>### Concept:<n>If you have 9 minutes of work to complete you can finish the job in 15 minutes by simply performing the same work 2/3rd times.<n><n>### Input<n>* Input = 9 / (3 * 2)<n>* Rationalize = 9 / (6 * 2)<n><n>### Conclusion:<n><n>* The answer of 9/3 is converted to 15/3 <n>* Then the same is divided by 3 and the solution is obtained.<n><n>---<n><n>### Input & Response<n>* Input = 4/4<n>* Divide by 4<n>* The remainder is always 0<n>* Repeat the same with 0<n>* Get 1<n>* Response = 1 / 1<n>* The division of 1 by 1 results in 1<n>---<n><n>---<n>---<n><n>## Input / Output example (Concept of Division)<n><n>### Input A: 17 / 7<n>### Input B: 2 / 3<n>### Input C: 8 <n>### Output A: 2 * 2 = 4 <n>### Output B: 1 * 3 = 3 <n>### Output C: 8 / 2 = 4<n><n>## Concept:<n>* Input : First Divide or break large numbers to make smaller numbers<n>```<n>Example : 17 / 1 -> 17 <n>```<n>* In this way, you can easily solve the bigger problems<n>* Now break down input B: 2 / (2 * 7) so that it can be solved<n>```<n>Example : (2 / 7) * 7 <n>```<n><n>* The above answer would be 2 / (2*7)<n><n>---<n><n>--- <n><n>## How to solve 4 x ( 4 y 2 )<n>* Use ( 2 x 4 ) and (

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:While laid up in the hospital she tried remembering good times, like that massage on vacation that brought great what? Choices:  A: dream B: knowing C: depression D: pleasure E: nostalgia<n><n>### Response:		This question requires you to use and understand the word what preceded each of the answers and make a choice that is the opposite of the answer. The best way to answer this question is to ask if the answer is the opposite and then give the answer.<n>The best way will result in: <n>#### F(A): A: dream → False so B: pleasure is True<n>#### F(B): B: pleasure → False so C: depression is True<n>#### F: C: depression → True<n>```<n>Answer(D): What(D): A: dream <n><n>Input:She tried remembering good times while laid up in the hospital.She thought of that massage on vacatiom that brought her great pleasure.<n><n>```<n><n>### Input:: In the first 5 years of the 2000s, U.S. homeowners spent $604 billion to replace windows that had become energy-inefficient.  In the next 5 years, they spent another $367 billion to repair and maintain the windows they already had.  Explain the difference.<n>Rationales:<n>Homeowners spend $604 billion in the first 5 years:<n>$604 x (5/10) = $<<604 x (1/2)>>302 billion in the second 5 years<n>This leaves a deficit of $367 billion:<n>$367 x (5/12) = $<<367 x (1/6)>>61.7 billion<n><n>```<n><n>#### D<n>Answer:<n>$362 billion<n><n>### Input<n>Input from the question: <n>Input from task:In the first years of the 21st century, Americans spent $4.27 trillion on their homes  That's more than ten times what the country spent on education that same year<n><n>#### Output:<n>The output would be:<n>The country had more than ten times as much money to spend on their homes, than on their education. So, the homeowners probably spent less on education, and more on their homes during that decade.<n><n>### Input
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Where could you put a dollar that would make it hard to get out without breaking? His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. Choices:  A: netherlands B: utrecht C: brussels D: belgium E: denmark<n><n>### Response:		<n>```java<n>//Java Solution<n>package practice;<n><n>import java.util.Scanner;<n><n>public class Bank{<n><n>	public static void main(String[] args) {<n>		<n>		Scanner input = new Scanner(System.in);<n><n>		System.out.println("Enter a country: ");<n><n>		String country = input.nextLine();<n><n>		scan(country);<n><n>	}<n><n>	private static void scan(String country) {<n>		boolean validInput = false;<n><n>		while (!validInput) {<n><n>			String input = "";<n><n>			for (char c : country.toLowerCase().toCharArray()) {<n><n>		            if ((c >= 'a' && c <= 'd') ||<n>		                    (c >= 'e' && c <= 'z') ||<n>				        (c =='') ||<n>			            (c == ',') ||<n>		                (c == '.') ||<n>		            (c >= '0' && c <= '9')){<n>			            <n>			                input += c;<n>			            }<n>			}<n><n>			System.out(input);<n>			<n>			System.out.print("[a-d] [e-z],. 0-9 Enter again: ");<n><n>	            int n = input.length();<n>	            <n>		    switch (n){<n>		    	case 0:<n>		                System.out.println(0);<n>		                break;<n>	    	    case 1:<n>		            System.out.println("a-z,. 0-9");<n>		            break;<n>		    	default:<n>		                for (int i = 0 ;i < n; i++){<n>		                    System.out.println((char) input.charAt(i));<n>		                }<n>		                 <n>	            }<n>	        }<n>	}<n>}<n>```<n><n>###Input: The car rental charges $30/Day for 1 day or $190/1 week. Your rental lasted 11 days so how much do you o

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Diving off a cliff for a cartoon character often ends in comedic what? Choices:  A: exhilaration B: dismemberment C: spinal injuries D: getting wet E: splats<n><n>### Response:		E<n><n>### Input and Demonstration: A tire dealer is offering a 30% off sale on all of their tires for the next two days. What, in dollars, if any, is the difference between today, and tomorrow's price, for a set of "A1" brand tires? Choices: 1: 0.00 2: $1,200.00 3: $2,400.000 4: $18,000.00.<n><n><n>### Response and Rationale: 3, the set of tires is 30% off so we have to multiply the original value by 0.7<n>A1 Original:$360$360<n>A1 Sale:=$360*(0.7) = $252<n>so 252-360=-(108)<n>#### -(108)<n>Answer: $0.00<n><n>### Input/ Response : A young girl is shopping for a winter coat. The salesperson tells her that she has 5 coats priced $127.90, $115.90, $75.90, and $32.90. The coats all come in the same size. She has several sizes of clothing, but she’s not very tall or short, and she also likes coats in neutral colors. What is the least amount she’ll spend on winter coats?<n><n>### Response : A girl has several coats but isnt very tall or short and likes her coats in neutral colors so all she needs is 1 coat <n>so let $127.5 is one coat$116:5 is another coat$76.5 is another coat$32 is the 5th<n>The least amount she can spend is<n>$127+116+76+32=$461.5<n><n>#### 461.50<n>Answer: 500<n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:James is apply for a job that he really wants. He knows that it will be a good fit and he has experience, but he doesn't have all the qualifications that they're asking for, so he's worried about what? Choices:  A: acceptance B: rejection C: hope D: less sleep E: employment<n><n>### Response:		D.<n><n>####<n><n>### Instructions: Complete and submit your response.<n><n>### Responses:<n>#### Response 1<n><n>### Instructor Response<n><n>### Instictions:<n><n>#### Instruction:<n><n>### Resonses:<n><n>#### Instractions:<n><n>#### Instructions:<n><n>#### Responeses:<n>

Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:The cabinets were imported from the south. John bought they because he knew that they would look good.  Where might they be installed? Choices:  A: kitchen B: pantry C: containing pots and pans D: in a flight E: mexico<n><n>### Response:		They should be installed in a kitchen.<n><n>### Input 2::Their prices are on their shelves. <n>### Response: What were the prices on their shelves?<n>### Answer: The price of the cabinets was $70.<n><n>### Response 2.In the marketing department, the secretaries’ salaries are listed on the 2nd floor, but the bosses’ salaries are listed in the C-Suite offices with the secretary’s salaries. <n>### Answer: They were in the C-Suites.<n><n>#### C-suites:<n>##### <n><n>### Instructions:Complete the table.<n><n>### Answer:<n><n>### InstructioINPUT:Which word could be used to complete the series: 20, 52, 83, 99, 100, 101, 102? Choices: <n>### Answer:: 220<n><n>### Instuction:Answer the following multiple question<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Input: Find the percent of the difference between $1.10 and $200.<n><n>Answer: The answer is 0.005625<n><n>### Input2::Input:In a department store, a woman bought 2 pair of pants that cost $155.68. Her total bill for one purchase was $232.44. How much change did she get back?<n><n>### Answer.: She got $76.86<n><n>### Instriuction:Complete the table.Write a response that appropriately answers the request.<n><n>#### How Much Will You Owe<n>#### I owe 3% on that<n><n>### Instuctiuon:Answer the following questions about the table.<n><n>#### What is the total sum of the percentages? <n><n>#### What is 10 more than the highest percentage?<n>##### <n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:A blowfish lives free. He lives on his own. Where does he live? Choices:  A: fish market B: pet shop C: great outdoors D: river E: little mermaid<n><n>### Response:		The blowfish lives in the great outdoors<n><n>### Input:(2+3)(3-4)<n>### Response: (2x3-2x4)= (6-8)=-2<n><n>### Instructions:If you have 18 hours to study for a math test, and you can focus on the test for 12 hours, how many hours can you spend studying other subjects?<n>### Demonstraion:If you have 24 hours to study, and you can focus for 9 hours on the math test and 3 hours studying for the science test, you have 16 hours to study for other subjects.

Choices:  A: overpopulation B: birth C: presents D: propagation E: fun<n><n>### Response:		Option A.<n><n>### Input 1:<n>A man on his 32nd birthday has a total of $3,055.93.  How much more money should he save (in dollars) each day so that by age 65 he will have $100,000 in the bank?<n><n>### Input2:The following table lists all 7 days of the week.  Which one is not a weekday?  Choices:  A. Monday B. Tuesday C. Wednesday D. Thursday E. Friday<n><n>A.Tuesday<n><n>### Instructions:  The correct answer is B.<n><n>### Answer:Option B.<n><n>## Solution 1: <n>We need to know how much we have at 65 and not 32.<n><n>Let's say that we have a little bit of money and can spend $452 on our birthday.<n><n>For example, if we've accumulated $3,053 for our birthday, then we can spend some money.<n><n>So let's calculate: <n><n>$$\sum_{i=18}^{32}i= 65$$<n><n>So we will have $3,052.82.<n><n>So, we have to earn: $$(3,052 - 3,052) = (0\ - 3,0\ ) = -3,05\ $<n>$$<n><n>Now we must figure out what to do to gain that much money daily.<n><n>We have to put this money into an account with interest of 5% (it happens everyday).<n><n>$$Earned Money = 3,053\times0.05\times\frac{365}{100\cdot365} = 1288.6\$<n><n>So, we must calculate:<n><n>$$Earn $6,851.00 in $32 years$$<n><n>$$3,053=3,052+0,32$$<n><n>$$\frac 3053}{32}\times32 = 1287.7\frac{\%}100\approx1288.7$$<n><n>So

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Where would you get a contraceptive if you do not have one? Choices:  A: health center B: vagina C: emergency room D: drawer E: medicine cabinet<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>#### A<n><n>#### B<n><n>#### C<n><n>#### D<n><n>#### E<n><n>#### Answer:<n><n>#### A and B<n><n>### Instructions:Furnish two rationales, using appropriate number symbols and notation, for each statement.<n>Rationale for each statement<n>RATIONALES: Given 3 statements<n>I)  $4-7-$$i+2$ = $23/4$<n>II)\$\$=$$i$$+4<n>iii)\$$-$$i$$+$$1$$=4<n><n>$4-7$<n>$4=3+1$<n>4=4<n>4<n>$4(1+1)(i+4)$ = $23$<n><n>$1$<n>$23=4\cdot (1+1)$<n>$23=1+1$<n>$\#$=#$\#$$<n>$23$=4<n><n>$14$<n>$23=\#$<n>$93=14\cdot (1\#2\#3)$<n><n>$73$=6<n><n>$-\$10; $$\$5;$$-$\$13;$$+$\$2;$\$0;$$+$\$0;+$\$0;+\$0;$$5;$$-\$12;$$6;$$3;$$-\$3;$$-\$4;$$-\$8;$$-\$17;+$<n><n>\$0<n>\$+$
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Sam found a giant hole in the plain.  What might this hole be called? Choices:  A: hill B: gorge C: sandplain D: cliff E: mountain<n><n>### Response:		<n>```<n>Sam is right the hole is really a canyon.<n>```<n><n>Input: The first row of an upper middle level triangular matrix is called the submatrix. A submatrix of an NxM matrix, A, is one of size 1x1, 2x2, 3x3, etc. up to NxM.  The triangular matrix below is an 8x8 matrix.<n><n>```<n>           3<n>         2      4      3<n>       1  4  2  1<n>     4  5  1  5<n>   1  5  7  1  8<n> 2  2  8  3  0<n>6  7  2  9  1  5<n>```<n><n>Rationales: A submatrix is a portion of an NxM grid matrix.<n><n>Input: A square is a special type of polygon.  What is the angle formed by the adjacent sides when a square is turned by an acute angle?<n><n>#### Answer: A: 360<n><n>Input: In a square, adjacent angles are always equal. The acute angle is 10 degrees. Which of the following statements is false?<n><n>#### Answer Choices:<n>1) 10 degrees is an acute angle.<n>2) All right angles are acute angles.<n>3) Adjacent angles are always equal in any quadrilateral.<n>4) Adjacent angles in a square must add up to 360 degrees.<n><n>### Solution:<n><n>Input: In quadrilaterals, adjacent angles are NEVER equal.<n><n>### Answer:<n><n>#### Adjacent angles are never equal in quadrilaterals<n><n>Input: 1) 10 Degrees is an acute angle<n><n>#### 10 degrees is acute angle.<n><n>Input: 2) All right angles<n><n>#### 2) All right Angles are acute angles. The correct answer is false that is because there square is 90 degrees and acute angles must be less than 90 degrees<n><n>Input: 3) Adjacent Angles in a Square must add up to 180 Degrees<n><n>#### 3) Adjjacent angles in a quadrilateral add up to 179 degrees or more because there must be a supplementary angle in

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Where can the legs of a stool be built? Choices:  A: jail B: internet cafe C: blacksmith's shop D: building E: bar<n><n>### Response:		If the legs can be built in the jail, the stool could be assembled with jail time, which is incarceration. The jail is a place of incarceration that one could spend 1 to 12 months, in a month; the 12 months are the leg of the stool. You could also go to prison instead of jail if given the charges of murder.<n>However, if the stool legs are built in the building, they are not incarcerated.<n>Therefore, it could not be jail.<n>If the legs are built in the blacksmith's smith, there are only two possibilities: <n><n>  * the legs are assembled for free or they are purchased.<n>The blacksmith's building is where one could be incarcerated or have a job.<n><n>  * If the legs are assembled in the internet cafe, the stool is built with time. You cannot sit under a tree and ask someone to sit on the stool, and it will be assembled, it will not be a stool.<n>Thus, it cannot be internet cafe.<n><n>  * In the bar, the stool is not assembled because there might be drunkenness or someone trying to steal to pay for another stool.<n>Therefore, the stool can be assembled in the internet café building with two choices: free or purchase.<n>So it could not be the bar.<n><n>  * There are three possibilities for the internet café building: free, purchase and assembling.<n>Therefore, if the internet café building is free, the assembling cannot be there.<n>Then, it can only be free or purchased.<n>So, it could not be free, and thus it must have been purchased.<n>The stool can be assemble in the blacksmith shop with two choices: incarceration and for free.<n><n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n>### Rationales:<n>* Choice E says bar. B, C, D, E are all possibilities for where the legs of a stoll can be built. The correct order is: bar, blacksmith's and then Internet cafe. I choose A,E as my response in the order of A,E bar,blacksmith's and internet cafe.<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:What are students trying to do? Choices:  A: study philosophy B: become adult C: ask questions D: further education E: study together<n><n>### Response:		<n>Answer A<n><n>### Demostration answer A<n>Input: Students are trying to study Philosophy<n>Rationales: Philosophy is a topic that students study in school that is geared to help students learn about what makes them human and their place in the world they live.<n>#### <n><n>Input: Answer the following multiple choice question:<n>How many ounces in a quart?<n><n>Choice A: 2*quotient<n>Choice B: 2*divide<n>Choice C: 1/twice<n>Choice D: 4*multiply<n>Choice E: quotient*4<n>Answer:<n><n>### Demosntration:<n>input (a):<n><n>### Demonsration answer A<n>answer:

Choices:  A: necklace B: wall outlet fixture C: tool box D: computer E: motorcycle<n><n>### Response:		I choose A.<n><n>----------------------------<n><n>#### Answer:A<n><n>----------------------------<n>#### Answer Choices<n><n>**A:** Necklace - The chain ring is used to lock pearls on a necklace or attach a long chain onto the piece.<n><n>**B:** Wall outlet fixture - A nut-and-bolt assembly that secures a circuit breaker box to the wall.<n><n>**C:** Tool box - A metal box used to store tools such as pliers, hammers, pencils, pens, and other items used to build, repair and maintain a machine.<n><n>**D:** Computer - A computer drive bay is a space where a computer can be placed.<n><n>**E:** Motorcycle - The chain ring is bolted onto the left side of the engine where a drive chain connects to the transmission.  The chain ring drives the rear wheel propelling the motorcycle forward.<n><n>#### Answer:B<n><n>----------------------------<n>

If he sets the karaoke machine to “speaker only” mode, how many watts does it supply? Choices: A: 1 B: 5 C: 30 D: 45 E: 75<n><n>### Instructons:Fredy has two karaoke machines at his house. The one he uses is set to five bars while the other is set to one bar. How much wattage is there in his house? Choices: 1 Bars: A: 270 E: 420 C: 430 B: 120 D: 210 A=270<n><n>### Instuctions:Gabe has three DVD collections, each with 120 movies and each collection costs $50 in total. He wants to sell all the collections together and must make a profit of $500. How much must he sell them for?<n><n>### Instrcutions:John and his wife have three children. He uses 2/9 of the ounces of milk that his wife drinks each day. That leaves 18–2/9 =<<18-2/9=4/9>>4/9 ounces of milk for his wife each day. How many ounces of milk does his family drink together in an average day? Express your answer as a fraction in lowest terms.<n><n>### Instrcutions:Sadie is making 15 tacos and 7 salads from a total of 21 pounds of ingredients. How much does she have to cut from the taco ingredients to ensure that both meals cost the same dollar amount?<n><n>### Incrrection:0.144 is an answer because 7/4=<<7/4=1.75>>1.75 pounds of lettuce= 3/4 pound.<n><n>#### 0.144<n><n>### Instcctions:Susan needs to find the value of φ (the golden ratio).
