Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:John was stuck in his house.  He couldn't get out the door.  He was very frightened when the smoke detectors went off, but luckily it was a false alarm.  Why might he be stuck? Choices:  A: fire B: belong to C: winter storm D: face south E: burn down<n><n>### Response:		<n>B<n>Rationale: Because he was so frightened by the smoke detectors going off he was stuck inside.<n><n>### Input<n>Jenny's alarm system was wired to the doorbell.   When her alarm went off, the doorbell ringed three times.   Did she or someone else enter the home?<n><n>### Response<n><n>no.<n><n>### Rationale:<n>it is unclear if Jenny or anyone else entered the home, so the answer is No.  It is also unclear if the alarm rang because Jenny entered, so it's a little bit of both.<n><n>### Animation:<n><n><img src="{{site.url}}/assets/docs/answers/20190425-answers-5182.jpg" height="auto" width="auto"><n><n>### Input (Animation)<n><n><img src= "{{site.url}}assets/docs/ansonswers/20101318-answers-5372.gif" height="auto"  width="auto" alt="" /><n><n>### Input Answer (Safety Tips):<n><n>#### No<n><n>> Safety Tip: If the alarm sounds and no one is in (or should be in) the home when they are expected to be, the answer is no. <n><n>### Input Problem:<n><n>### Problem Answer:<n><n>### Input animation:<n><n>### Answers:<n>Ratio analysis:<n><n>$$<n>\begin{array}{c c c c c c c} <n>\text{RATIOS TO LOOK FOR} &  \text{1} &  \text {2} &  \text 3   &  \text 4    &  \text 5 &  \text 6   \\ <n>\text{Gross Revenue} &  \frac{1000}{20}        & \frac{1020}{20}+100   & \frac{11020}{60} + 1000+100          & \frac{12020}{30} + 11000 + 100       & \frac{13020}{50} + 12000
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:The lady was getting worked up about the article explaining the uptick in accidents in their area, but her husband was dismissive of it stating that accidents what? Choices:  A: happen to people B: hurt people C: happen anytime D: happen often E: happen anywhere<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Demand:  What is the cost of three bags of cement? What is the cost of four bags of cement. What is then total cost of buying five bags of cement and one bag of cement if you buy three and paying the price you have if you paid for one bag separately?<n>### Response:3 bags is 90$, the 4th is 108 $, and for the 5th its 90+$108 is 198 $<n>### Demand<n>### For 5 bags of cement with just one additonal bag the cost is 108*$9+108=$996 $<n><n>### Demolition:The demolition crew is charging $7/square-foot for demolition.  The entire square footage of the building to be demolished is 2,500 square-feet.  What is the cost, in dollars, of demolishing the entire building?<n>Rationales:$7/2500=$<<$7/250=30>>30 dollars per square-foot<n>2500 square-foot =<<$2500>>2500 divided by 30 =<<$25*30/25=80>>80 dollars total.<n>#### 80<n>Answer:  $80.<n><n>### Response<n>### The total cost of  demolition is 80*3 = 240

Choices:  A: matchwinning B: cash in C: compete D: return E: celebrate<n><n>### Response:		Input:The car-rental agcy charges $30/ day for a car or $190/week for longer then 7 days rentals  If  Carmela rented the car for 9 days what did she pay total?<n>Rationales:$30 for each day x 9 days =$30 x 81 = <<30 x 9 =270>>81<n>Answers:c<n><n>Input:  You need to decide whether to buy two 4-foot-long 3-pound pieces of meat at a discount of 25% or one 8-foot-long 6-pound piece of meat.  If the smaller pieces cost 25¢/pound less than the larger pieces, should you buy two smaller pieces or one big piece?<n>Rationales:[Two shorter pieces of meat will still cost you 15¢/pound more than a larger piece (since 25% of 3 = 0.75).  You should buy the larger piece]<n>If you buy the larger piece it’s 8x6 pounds at 3 pound apiece =$24<n>If you buy 2 pieces it’s 4x4 pounds for 3 pound apce at 25%$2.5<n>So your options:<n>-The best option is to buy the bigger piece of meat which costs 72 pence for every 6 pounds,<n>-The best option would be to buy fewer smaller pieces, as then you get discounts for quantity which means fewer pieces mean cheaper prices.<n><n>#### 24 pence<n>Answer: 24<n><n>Input: Your doctor has prescribed you 10 days of antibiotics and wants you to purchase 14 day’s worth of medication. Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:What treatment might an old time doctor have tried to accomplish with leeches? Choices:  A: heart transplant B: distance himself C: perform surgery D: study medicine E: let blood<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>#### C<n>Answer:C<n><n>### Instructions: Answer the following multiple choice question in a math function.<n><n>### Input 1: Jennifer has set aside $35 for groceries this week. Her menu is as follows:<n><n>1. Chicken and vegetables for $2.00 per serving<n>2. 6 servings of fish for $3.50 per serving<n>3. 2 servings of tuna for $5.50 per serving.<n><n>### Response 1:<n><n>#### Answer 1:58<n><n>Input 2: Jennifer plans to feed herself from the food she bought for the groceries. She divides the total cost of all of the food she buys among the number of meals she will cook with that food.<n><n>How many meals does she get from the $35?<n><n>#### Answer 2:18<n><n>Input 1: 1 serving of Chicken and Veggies = $2.00<n><n>Input 2= $35<n><n>#### Answer 3:18<n><n>Response =18<n><n>### Instuctions: Answer the following short answer questions.<n><n>### Difficulty: Easy<n><n>#### How do you interpret a mathematical expression based on a comparison and/or an inequality, such as ‘greater than or equal to’, ‘less than or equal to’ ‘not equal to’, and ‘is greater than’?<n><n>#### Answer: Greater than or equal to, less than or equal to and not equal to are a subset of the number line. You can interpret the expressions as a location of a quantity or a distance from a value that satisfies a condition. For example, if you’re comparing 4 > 3, the expression ‘>’ can be looked at as 4 and 3 are not on the same line. In the other sense, if it was 4 < 3, the expression could be that the line 3 is to the left of 4. To interpret inequality signs, you go through each part separately to get a better understanding.<n><n>#### How do we apply the PEMDAS (parenthesis, exponents, multiplication, division, addition, subtraction) to solve a numerical expression using the order of operations?<n><n>#### Answer : <n><n>- First, take
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:They were competing in basketball, the goal was to what? Choices:  A: bounce the ball B: competition C: have fun D: race E: score points<n><n>### Response:		<n>#### Race<n><n>#### Competition<n>#### Bounce the ball<n>#### Fun<n>#### Score points<n><n>### Rationale:<n>#### Race:<n>### Competition:<n>### Bounce the ball:<n>### Fun:<n>### Score points:<n><n>### Input<n>What is the sum of 12, 16, 29, 27, and 25?<n><n>### Response<n>#### 126<n><n>### Rationales:<n>Each number is a multiple of 2 and 5 and every number is divisible evenly by 2 except for 27.<n>Thus the answer is the sum of each of these divisors.<n><n>### Input 6+ 8+6 = 20<n><n>### Input. 13 + 16 + 5 + 6 + 3 + 10 = 48<n><n>### Ratiocination:<n><n>### Add the digits: 6 and 8 yield 14, 1 and 1 yield 2 for a total of 16.<n><n>

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:What are you hoping to do when listening to an expert speak? Choices:  A: contagious B: wrong C: last forever D: painful E: blind<n><n>### Response:		 E: Blind<n>### Rationale: All answers except for the answer "B" are a verb and "It is the answer the question asked."  "B" is singular, which is not an acceptable verb and the question asked the meaning of love, therefore the only option left is "B".<n>### Instruction #5<n><n>### Input<n>- How much time does it take to drive 67 miles at a constant speed?<n>Choices:<n>A. 3 hours<n>B. 2 hours<n>C. 1 hour<n>D. 25 minutes<n>E. 15 minutes<n><n>### Response<n>- Answer A gives one hour and fifteen minutes.<n>- B,C,D are too large by five minutes at least.<n>- Answer E is a multiple of eleven minutes, which is too little difference in time.<n>- A is the correct answer.<n><n>### Rationale<n>- A is the only choice that satisfies the question.<n>- 67 miles is the only one that shows miles, and the 67 is not in a form of hours and minutes. (15, 30, 45, 60)<n>- Answer choice, B, C, D, and E, do not provide acceptable answers to question asked.<n><n>### Input #6<n><n>### Output<n>```<n>Enter an integer to sum with me!<n>47<n>```<n><n>- So the original integer is 47.<n>- The correct sum is 48.<n><n>### Output Rationale<n><n>- It is obvious that the answer from the calculator is correct.<n>- The calculator only asks you to enter an integer which is 47. <n>- The correct output is 48, which is derived from the sum of two integers. <n>- 47 + 1  = 48. <n><n>### Output #7<n><n>### Output (part III) <n>- How much time?<n>- How much time is 1 minute, 30 seconds?<n>- Answer<n><n>Input: 1 hour and 14 minutes for 9 hours and 1 minute.<n><n>### Answer 7<n><n>### Input (part I)<n>- If you’re traveling at 60mph<n>- 30 miles an hours<n>- It’ll takes at 
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Billy bounced the ball off the wall.  There was a target on the wall for him to bounce against.  Where might he be? Choices:  A: pool table B: toy box C: playroom D: park E: closet<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Rationales: <n><n>## Instruction:Answer the question posed below.<n><n>### Input:(Note that in this problem you will need to solve for values other than the ones provided.)<n><n>### Demo:<n><n>We have $200 and we spend $5.27 each week for 20 weeks in a year. If the rate is constant, how much should we save to earn $1000?<n><n>### Rationale:<n>```<n>220 - 5.27**2 = 1000<n>220 - (2.527**2 ) =1000<n> 220 - 6.314 = 100<n>1000 - 220 = 780<n>```<n><n>### Answer: 780<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:what do you do before going to party? Choices:  A: call 911 B: enjoy yourself C: get drunk D: having sex E: meet new people<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Rationales:I call 911 to notify the police.<n><n>### Input Choices (Choose one (A-E)):You are driving when you are stopped by a police officer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:The delivery man was delivering a whole crate of shampoo, they went through a lot of it at the what? How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Turkey is a nation in what part of the world? Choices:  A: middle east B: asia minor C: asia D: provide meat E: balkan peninsula<n><n>### Response:		It is an E<n>### Input:Cotton is a type what fabric made from the fiber that is the primary material of what natural fiber? Choice: A: to freshen dog breath B:to maintain clean teeth C: to relieve dry mouth D: to clean teeth and gums E: none of the above<n><n>### Rationale: It cleans her teeth<n><n>### Input When is the best time to spay a dog or cat? The best time to spay is when the pet is 8 weeks of age.<n>Answer<n>A: Spaying a dog or cat is the procedure that prevents unwanted litters with spray surgery.<n>It’s best to spay pets before they mature. They will not experience breeder’s syndrome and breeding behaviors.<n>I recommend spaying before the dog or cat is 1 yr old.<n>12months to 36months will be the most ideal.<n>#### Spaying before it’s 1 yr old<n>Answer: Yes<n>\end{code}<n><n>Comment: Welcome to SO! Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Johnny and bill fought over money.  Johnny wanted it to be over.  What might he choose to do? Choices:  A: control people B: settle everything C: buy food D: increase power E: kill bill<n><n>### Response:		<n>[Answer 2 is Correct]<n><n>Input: The average car costs more than $35,000. The price rises 5% each year. Write an expression that shows, in dollars, how much the car will cost when it is 10 years old.<n>Rationales: Write 5% = <<5%=0.05>>0.05.  I.E.  we know that % will be the equivalent of 0.05<n>Solve for 10 by multiplying the expression you wrote by 10.   $35000*0.05^10 =<<$35000.05^5 = 52500>>52500<n>$$<n>Answer: 52507.3272<n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:What European country is famous for its potato industry? Choices:  A: idaho B: casserole C: new hampshire D: root cellar E: ireland<n><n>### Response:		D, Europe is famous for its potatoes<n><n>### Input & Output:Jon has 1000 pennies, five nickels, and four of his coins aren’t pennies, nickels, dimes, or quarters.  How many of his coins aren't pennies or nickels?<n><n>### Response & Rationales: Since Jon started with 1050 coins, there needs to be 50 coins and he has 100, so 100-50=<<100-5=5>>5 coins aren't allowed to be pennies or nickel's<n><n>### Input& Output: The 32-bit value of the integer, x = 8053/282 rounded to a variable number of decimal Places. 4<n><n>### Input and Rationale:<n>4 rounded places<n>8053/4= <<8053/644=<12 >>12<n>#### 12<n>x=12<n><n>### Instructions:The first week of college is a time for new roommates to get to know each other. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. (a) If all the angles of a triangle are supplementary, the theorem of Thales holds.<n><n>### Response:(False)<n><n>### <n><n>The theorem of Thales is the statement that the sum of the measures of the angles of a triangle is two right angles and thus 2 x pi.<n><n>Supplementary angles are angles that add up to form a complete circle.<n><n>In a complete circle, three angles add up to pi, but this result needs not be true for a triangle.<n><n><n>###

Choices:  A: tree tops B: rain forest C: zoological gardens D: great outdoors E: zoo<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Input and Response:<n>Camp counselors spend some of their time singing, playing games with the children, and helping children with activities such as singing, clean-up, and arts and crafts. If there are 28 girls and 24 boys camping at Camp Yogi, what is the ratio of the number of girls to boys who were selected for the camp?<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:What does reckless driving lead to on a person? Choices:  A: injuries B: fatigue C: traffic jams D: tired E: accidents<n><n>### Response:		Choice 2- B<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple Choice question.<n><n>## Instructions:<n><n>Write a report that accurately summarizes the given information.<n><n><n>## Instrucctions:<n>The cost of a gallon bottle of bleach and a half-gallon bottle of cleaning detergent are shown.  What is the unit price of a gallon or a half-gallond bottle of bleach?<n><n>If the cost of a gallon of bleach is $3 and the cost of an equivalent amount of a half gallon of bleach ($3.50 - $1.00) is $2.50, then:<n>| |<n><n>## Instrucsions:<n>Input: Given the figure below, what are the coordinates of point A? <n>Rationales: Point A lies in the right-angled triangle ABC, and the length of AB is x units, and the length of AC is y units. <n>Given the following measurements: <n>(x) = 1.0 (y) = 2.5 (x+y)/2 = <<(x+y)/2=1>>1.0 (x-y)/2 = << (x-y)/ = 1.0>>1.0 (2x+2y)/2 = <<2x+2y/2=3>>3<n>#### 3<n>Answer: (A(1,3))<n><n><n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Where is a ferret getting lots of attention likely to be found? Choices:  A: trouser leg B: sick bay C: own home D: petting zoo E: mother's hair<n><n>### Response:		<n>#### (E): Mother's hair

Choices:  A: cupboard B: countertop C: water D: hardware department E: england<n><n>### Response:		E<n><n>Input: The car that can use 1x as much gas as a gas-guzzler. 1x stands for 1 gallon.  A gas-guzzler is shown in the above graph.  For how long can the gas-guzzler run on gasoline?<n>Rationales 1x as many gallons as a gas-guzzer and 1 is the same as 1x the opposite way:   1/(1x)=1/x   1/(1x) =1<n>1/x=<1/x=1>>1.<n>Gas-guzzer gas mileage is 5miles/gallon, and is shown in the graph.<n>The car that can use  x as much gas as a car that can use 5 gallons of gas per mile can run for: 5/x>300 miles.<n>Since 5/x<>>5/x<1>>1, the car can actually run for: 50/x>675 miles. 5x as far as the gas-guzzeler.<n><n>### Answer:E<n><n>### Input<n>A farmer has hay in a bale-storage barn. If he has room for up to 5 additional rows in his barn, how many bales of hay can he fit in the barn in one row?<n><n>### Answer<n>I counted the number of bales and rows. The answer is C which was 5. After this I counted the bales with the rows. If each row has 4 bales than the total of 5 rows would have 20 bales. I did the same thing for the total number of bales. In all there was 20 bales for the barn to be able to accommodate 5 rows.<n><n>### Input <n>An engineer is designing a new building. His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Jan went to the auditorium and listened to the speech. Where might he be? Choices:  A: crowd B: high school C: city D: somewhere E: theater<n><n>### Response:		C: city<n><n>### Input. The bakery needs a 1/8 x 1/4 inch x 10 inch piece of cardboard to make cookie boxes. The baker has 16 boxes of cardboard available. How many cardboard cookie boxes can the bakery make with 2 5/16 sheets of remaining cardboard?<n><n>\#4=<<4=1>>1 or #4=<<4=2>>2 cookie boxes<n><n>### Input What is the value of pi to 12 decimal places?<n><n>\(\frac{4}{1}\approx\frac{49}{12}\approx 4,028333333\)<n><n>### Input A 2500-mA, 12-V battery is advertised as providing 28 A·H of energy per discharge cycle. If an appliance runs at a current of 2.5 A for 6 hours in the morning and 3.5 A for 12 hours in the afternoon, how many charge cycles will be needed to provide power for 8 consecutive hours of use?<n><n>\(28 \times 18=824\)<n><n>### Instuction:Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n><n>For the following problem, provide the missing value or values that are correctly represented according to the example on your answer document:<n><n>#### 15/15=<<15/15='='>>A:  < 1 1/12 3/4 5/6 7/8 ><n><n>Answer: 15/12<n><n>```<n>#1 <n>Given: If a line is parallel to one side of an isosceles triangle, then the other sides are 1) equal in length<n>Answer:A < 1 < 2<n><n>#2 <n>Given: The square root of 2, denoted by the letter ‘\sqrt {2}’, is<n>Answer:A < < = ><n><n>#3 <n>Given: In the diagram below, angle R is an obtuse angle and triangle ABC is formed by angle R, angle S, and angle T. A line segment has been drawn to connect the midpoint of RS to the midpoint of S<n>Answer:A < = <<n><n>#
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:We were having a canned food drive and I needed to pick up some contributions, where did I go? Choices:  A: shelf B: cellar C: refrigerator D: cupboard E: grocery store<n><n>### Response:		I had to drive to a grocery store in the canned foods section.<n><n>### Input Choices: 15-29<n><n>### Input Codes:<n><n>1315429<n><n>## Input:<n><n>36-40<n><n>## Output:<n><n>17<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>#### 0 - 6: Choose the smallest<n>#### 7 - 12: Choose the greatest<n>#### 13 - 19: Choose the greatest by 3<n>#### 20 - 29: Choose the least greater than the second least<n><n>### Input 0 - 6<n><n>1356<n><n>### Output 0 - 6 = 13<n><n>### Input Code 0 - 6 :0132344<n><n>### Instuctions<n>0 - 6 : Choose the smallest<n><n>### Input : 7 - 10<n><n>#### 11 - 17<n><n>## Instuctions:<n><n>### 18 - 21<n><n>### Input Input Codes:<n>1821394<n><n>### Input Answer:<n>15<n><n>### Instudtions<n><n>### Input (22 - 30)<n>#### 31 - 39<n><n>### 40 - 49<n>### 50 - 110<n><n>### 23<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:The wheel was loose, and threatened to fall off when they were what? Choices:  A: footloose B: sailing C: fast D: tighten E: bind<n><n>### Response:		E: bind<n><n>##### Input:Choose the correct answer:<n><n>##### Input:"How many feet are in a yard?" You would be likely to say:<n><n>##### Answer:"More than 3"<n>#####<n>---<n>

Choices:  A: envy B: resentment C: winning or losing D: one winner E: two winners<n><n>### Response:		D (there should only be one winner not two)<n><n>### Input; A restaurant offers three menus priced at $7.00, $8.00, and $9.00.  To keep the prices per-person the same, they served each customer an equal number of portions.  The manager reports that the total cost of the food used on these menus was $145.  If there is one menu serving 20 people.  How many portions of food are used on each menu?<n>Rationales; When we start with $145, use each number as a denominator we get $7, $8, and $9 (I tried to use the fractions)<n>Therefore the answer is:<n>0.7,1.45,and 2.31<n>In other words each menu has 54 portions (145/2)<n>That is all the portions used that night (0.7 + 1.45 + 2.31 = 4.42)<n>And 4.42 portions of food used on one menu.<n><n>#### Answer:4.42<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following short answer question.<n><n>## Instructions:<n>Write a complete sentence in response to the quotation given below from The Great Gatsby by F. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Parents often yell in times of chaos, what are they trying to do? Choices:  A: guide children B: understand children C: control children D: care for children E: vent anger<n><n>### Response:		You have to ask parents the why first!<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:What could there be in a beauty salon? Choices:  A: city B: strip mall C: clerk D: neighborhood E: rooster<n><n>### Response:		<n>Choices:  There is a strip mall.<n>There is a clerk.<n>There is a city.<n>There is a neighborhood.<n>There is a rooster.<n><n>### Input1:<n>Which of the following is a part of the water cycle? Choices: A: evaporation B: transpiration C: ice melting D: cloud formation<n><n>### Response1:<n>There is a ice melting<n><n>### Instructions<n>Give the value of x.<n><n>-<n><n>Input: The water cycle begins with evaporation, the process by which water changes from the liquid to the gaseous state, releasing energy.  The process continues on with transpiration, the process by which plants expel large quantities of water vapor.  Water vapor turns back into liquid when it condenses, thus completing the cycle.  How much energy would be needed to completely melt an ice cube that measures 1 inch3 across?<n><n>### Rationales<n>You can get 1 inch3 for 25 mm.<n><n>And 1/sqrt = <<1/sqrt = 0.5>>0.5<n><n>And 25mm/0.5 = 50mm<n><n>So 1 inch3 = 50<n><n>And total energy= 1/3 * x * 107 = 983107<n><n>### Output: 9831 J<n><n>Input: What is the total cost of shipping charges to ship a 500-pound package from Virginia to Alaska?<n><n>### Solution:<n>Given is 37/3 = 12.33 per pound so 12.34x500 = 6166.00<n><n>### Input<n><n>What is the total cost of materials and labor to manufacture a car that will sell for $28,000?<n><n>### Answer<n><n>Given is 20 hours/car with 20 workers in the plant<n><n>20x$28=560<n><n>Given is cost for materials which is $4000/car<n><n>560+4000=5600
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:What feeling might propel one to instituting civil action? Choices:  A: complications B: tiredness C: anger D: trial E: court case<n><n>### Response:		I think you probably mean c.<n><n>### Input (What):How much does a single bed cost at 100 bucks a pop?<n><n>### Response (Answer):At $100 a bed<n><n>### Instructions (Instruction):Find the sum of the values in the set of 5.<n><n>### Submissions:20, 25, 30, 35, 40<n><n>### Answer (Response):The sum is 140.<n><n>### Rationales(Rational-1):20+25=<<20+25>=45>>45.<n><n>## Rationales(Rat-2):40+35=<<40+35>=75>>75.<n><n>## Total:75+45+45=80<n><n>### Instructor-Rationale: 45, 20, 20,100, 700<n><n>### Input-Rationale:The only even number on the bottom is the 45 and the 100; we combine those to the even number and we have to add 90 to that number but since it's a negative number 20 needs to be added too.<n><n>### Expected Output:480<n><n>## Output:80<n><n>## 257,247,449,329,595,636<n><n>### Instances: 1-2-3-4-5<n><n>#### Rationales for 5-2: 167, 133, 157, 257, 369<n><n>## Other<n>### Rational: 1:  $190+$120+$310=$$500+$310=$810$
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Where can you buy a fishing rod? Choices:  A: furniture store B: fishing camp C: hardware store D: sporting goods store E: engine<n><n>### Response:		<n>Answer: C<n><n>### Input<n>Choose which statement best solves the equation.<n><n>[A](12 + 9x - 5/x + (8x + 1) – 20)/x = -6 + 1x<n><n>[N/A]((18-8x)/x-9x)/x=(1)((8x–9x+6)–(10x)(9x+4))/(8+3((4x-5)x+4))x=x=0,x=10,x=x=x=10<n><n>[C](10x–2x^2 - 50) + 100 = 58<n><n>### Response<n>Answer:<n><n>

Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Choices:  A: jerusalem B: texas C: middle east D: china E: india<n><n>### Response:		Answer B because it is the only correct answer<n>### Instruction<n>What is the most expensive item on a menu?<n><n>### Demondrtion. <n>####  Pork Chop Dinner<n>In total the porkchop dinner cost $53.58<n><n>####  Grilled Chicken Dinner<n>In total, the grilled chicken dinner cost $59.05<n><n>#### $66.33<n><n>#### $69.14<n><n>#### $70.23<n><n>####$59.44<n><n>#### $63.05<n><n>### Solution:<n>Answer E because $20 grilled chicken dinner was the most expensive item on the menu<n>### Explanation<n>The most expensive item on the list is the grilled chicken because it costs $59.14.<n>The next most expensive item is the Chicken Fajitas with $44.95<n>### Input: What is the sum of the greatest two-digit numbers that are less than 382?<n><n>### Response<n>### Explanations:<n>#### 17<n>The sum of the greatest two digit numbers <382 is 17<n>#### 6<n>The sum of the two greatest two digit numbers < 382 is 6<n>### Solution:27<n><n>### Solution<n>- In 55 days, Tomas made $2.100 how much did he make in the whole month<n>- T 2500 in 55 days<n>- 47 days in a whole month<n>### Explanaton:<n>If you multiply 2500 by 47 you get 118500<n>27 dollars were spent<n>#### 118527<n>### Input:The first three odd integers are 2, 4, and 6.
