Choices:  A: amusement B: losing money C: charmed D: having fun E: win money<n><n>### Response:		If the family was playing cards, it was most likely a reason for entertainment.<n><n>#### A - Amusement<n><n>Input: What is a good reason for the family to play cards?<n>Rationales Choices:  <<<A,B,C,E>>><n>Response: <<A, B>><n><n>#### A - Entertainement<n>Input:What do you think it means to "play cards at a table"?<n>Rationales Choice:<<A,B,C>><n>Response: <<A>><n><n>### Input<n>What is the maximum amount of money that you could have on an American Express credit card? Give the response as a dollar number in decimal format. If there is no limit, do not enter anything (e.g., -999999).<n>If you have a credit limit, you must enter it here. Otherwise, click below and leave the credit limit box blank.<n>This is an input task, not an output task.<n><n>### Response<n>If there is a limit to the amount of money a cardholder can spend, enter that here. If there is no such limit, do not enter a response.<n>In the following list, you will find a number of credit cards. Look at the list and enter the maximum amount of money a card can hold in "U.S. Dollars that is shown here.<n>If a card holder has a balance to pay on their credit card, what is the minimum amount that they must pay to the credit card company?<n><n>### Input Task for the First Day of School<n><n>When you are buying a computer, a calculator, or some books for the first day of school, which would you rather buy first: a computer, a calcula, or a book?  To help you decide, explain what each item costs (as a number of cents) per item.<n>*IMPORTANT*: Be careful and consistent.  If you buy either a $13 toy for a $4 calculator for a $20 computer, the computer toy calculator purchase will cost $21.  If you want to buy two items that costs a total of $27 dollars, you will need to have at least $17 in your pocket, and pay for the other $10 at the store.<n>#### ANSWER:  To buy two items that cost a total of 27 dollars
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:The woman experienced great joy, but despite that this was a what? Choices:  A: misery B: sadness C: bad time D: sorrow E: play time<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>#### E<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n><n>## Instructions:Input:<n>A hurricane is approaching California’s central coast, and a farmer is planning to move 550 cows 90 miles to higher ground in order to protect them from possible coastal flooding.The animal transport truck holds a capacity of 25 cows. Traveling at 90 miles per hour, how long, in hours, will it take to transport the 550 c…<n><n>## Instrucciones:<n><n><n>Input:<n>**<n>How can we help you?<n></br><n>This request is already in progress.<n>**<n><n><n>How can we help?<n>Your feedback will help improve Agent responses in the future.<n><n><n>**<n>Wrong answer<n>**<n><n><n>We received your feedback, as we may not be able to provide an immediate response. In the meantime you can review the question and the steps for answering it below.<n><n><n>### Instructión:<n>Revisa los pasos para obtener una respuesta apropiada al siguiente encargo.<n><n>[Ejercicio](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1s219C4U2pEt16JwWiJJlThtD-WaA0w76B2j-ZdZ5_94/edit?usp=sharing)<n><n>### Demostración:<n><img alt="Módulo 1, Demo 8" src="https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/89080639/143338923-2e2f11f0-c9bd-4dff-a69a-8009ed86a983.png" /><n><n>### Instucción:<n>Aporte una respuesta apropiadamente completa al siguiente encargo.
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:The department store is located in the Northwest USA.  Where might it be? Choices:  A: new york B: big city C: town D: idaho E: shopping mall<n><n>### Response:		The answer is Choice E: Shopping Mall<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Find the number in the box that corresponds to the letter you think is best given the information in the problem.<n><n><n>### Rationales:<n>The store is located in the northwest USA.   <n>They ask you whether it might be in New York or a big city, town or idaho, or a shopping mall.<n>New York is a city and that's east of the Northwest. Also, idaho is a state in the Northwest. But the problem doesn't say whether it's  a state like Idaho or a city like Boise.<n>You also can't answer B and C because they are not cities, and they are not in the Northwest.<n>Also you couldn't say Big City or Town. Big city is a city like New York as opposed to a small city. Town is a city but is also not a state.<n>Shopping malls are also in the Northwest and cities. Shopping malls would require a trip to the mall and since the problem says just the Northwest, a shopping mall or malls would be good since they have so many in the Northwest. <n>That would be the correct answer for A and C, but not B or D, so E would be correct.<n>#### E<n>Answer: E<n><n>### Input<n>The car rental agency charges $35/day for a car. John rented a car for seven days.  How much, in dollars did he pay for the car rental?  Choices: $243 A B C D<n><n>### Response<n>The answer is Choice C:   <n>Input:<n>The car rental is $35 per day.  John rented a car that lasted an entire week or longer, so he paid $35 for one week. 7 days times 35 is 245, so he paid 245$.<n>We are not told the number of days he rented because he rented a car for an entire week.<n>### Input<n><n>A rental company charges $20 per day for a car and $20 to fill its gas tank.  How much would it cost to rent a car that burned 20 gallons of gas for each day it was rented.  Also, how

Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Choose one 1: EMT2: ESR2: fire fighter3: teacher4: student5: accountant6: police7: paramedic8: bus driver9: carpenter  10: secretary 11: barber 12: hair dresser 13: electrician 14: landscaper<n><n>### Rationale:<n><n>1) EMT, 2) ESR, 3) Fire Fighter, 4) Student, 5) Accountant, 6) Police, 7) Paramedic, 8) Bus Driver, 9) Carpenter, 10) Secretary, 11) Barber, 12) Hair Dresser, 13) Electrician, 14) Landscaper<n><n>Answer:<n><n>#### 14<n><n>Input: Which of the following vehicles is faster at 45 miles per hour? If it travels at a speed of 1/2 its speed 1/2 the time, what will be its average speed?<n><n>### Methods:<n><n>Speed = distance/time<n>Therefore: Speed = 1/(1/2xTime)<n><n>Distance/Time = 20/Hours<n>Distance = 20x2H = <<2x2x8H=32>>32<n>Therefore: Average Speed = 32/Time<n><n>This could be done as well:<n><n>Hours it takes to travel 20miles = 2Hours/2/2 =1Hour<n><n>

Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:What can happen in your mind while sleeping? Choices:  A: snoring B: talking C: get cold D: nothing E: might dream<n><n>### Response:		I believe that the correct answer is choice E.<n><n>### Input 2: What is the most important muscle to humans? Choices: A: Heart B: Lungs C: Stomach D: Brain E: Arms<n><n>### Response 2: I believe that the answer is choice E. This is the most important muscles to humans. Without this organ humans cannot function.<n><n><n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:If I take my heifer out East, where's a place we might end up? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Water is an important ingredient in what sugary beverage? Choices:  A: mountain dew B: glass C: soft drink D: whirlpool bath E: coffee cup<n><n>### Response:		The right answer is: A: mountain dew<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>Answer the following multiple choice questions.<n><n>Note: If more than one letter appears, then all choices that appear are correct for that question.<n>#### 1.1.0.1-0.7_0_0<n><n><n>### Demostration<n><n>1. $x+xy+y=x+y$<n><n>$$\begin{align} x+xy+y&=x+y\\ 1x-x^2+y&=1y-y^2\\ 1(x-y)+1(x^2-xy-y^2)&=1(x-y)^2\\ 1x^2-y^2+(1-x)y+(xy+x-y-1)&=0\\\end{align}$$<n><n>### Solution<n><n>#### 1.0.0.1_1_0_.00<n><n>To isolate $x$ from the quadratic equation it is best to use the quadratic formula as follows (where $a$: coefficient outside the squared term, $b$: coefficient of the linear term, $c$: constant term)<n><n>$$\begin {align} x=& -\frac{b+ ( \sqrt{b^2 +4ac-4c^2}),c}{2a}  \\ \\ \Rightarrow x=& -\frac{y+,-x^{2}-xy-y^2-1}{2x}\\\end {align}$$<n><n>Thus, the answer is $x= -0.5y- -2y^{2}-y-1 $<n><n>2. $10x^2 + 5x + 40 = ( 2x +30 )(x+5)$<n><n>$$\begin  {align} 10x^2+5x+40=(2x+30)(x+5) \\ 20x^2 +30x+45+40x^2=x^3 + x^2 x +60x+180x=x^2((-5+x)+(45+x^2))\\=-5x-45x^2+(-10x+80)x\\(-42+37x+(-45+49x)-2

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Choices:  A: rain forest B: tree tops C: toy store D: zoological gardens E: great outdoors<n><n>### Response:		<n>A<n><n>### Instructions:  There are three people who use the same car pool.  A driver drives to work with one person, and drives home from work.  Two other commuters share one car, and drive themselves to work with a third person.  During the workday, each worker works more than 6 hours.  In how many different ways can they rotate driving the car?<n><n>### Rationales:  For the first car pool driver, he has one choice of people with whom to ride, and two choices for going to work. (4) For the second car pool driver, she has one choice for driving to work, and then works for more than 6 hours (2).  For the third car pool driver, he only has one choice for going to work, but he works for more than 8 hours, so she has to make up the hours by driving home when the other drivers are at work.  So (5).<n><n>### Response Option:     9\*2\*2=4\*\*4=5<n><n>### Instructor Guide:  A. Which is greater? A: 30 days or B: 364 days<n><n>### Rationale:  A\*B=<<30*364=10940>>10940. 10940< 365*24 which is larger since the 365 is larger than the 364.<n><n>### A: 365; B: 365*10940 > 30*360<n><n>###  B: 360<n><n><n><n>### Instinctive response:<n><n>### Answer: 200<n><n><n>### Work:<n>Answer: 165<n><n>### RATIONALE:<n>356/20=<<356/2=18>>18 years.<n>18+18=<<18+18>=36>>36 years.<n><n><n>### RATIOS:<n>The ratio of years is always (the number of years)/(how many of the same item).<n>It can be represented using a variable, so that in the simplest case, it could just be 'a' for years and 'b' for items.

The passenger on the first car yells “You’re making a terrible merge decision, you idiot!”<n>Rationales:<n><n>#### The 45° merge is used for both a road and a highway.<n><n>A right 45° turn will place a driver in the center of a lane to merge.<n><n>A left 45° turn is used to merge when a driver is approaching a T-Junction or to go into an alley.<n><n>#### If both of the cars did a 45° turn while merging,<n><n>Then they would end up in the same lane and they would not overrun each other.<n><n>It takes 16 hours and 20 minutes to fly from San Francisco, California to Tokyo, Japan. Given that the airplane leaves at 6 A.M. and arrives at 4:30 P.M., when in Tokyo will the airplane be at an altitude of \(5 \frac{1}{4}\) miles above the ground?<n><n>Input: In 12 hours and 20 Minutes, the plane will be an altitude of \(s\)<n><n>Rationales: Let a 14 hour time-stamp be 6 A.M, and a 16 hour time-stamp (4:30 P.M) be \(t\)<n>If we were to solve the system of equations, \(20 t-12 s=0\) yields to the inequality \(t \lt s\).  Therefore when the plane arrives at \(t\), the plane will arrive at an altitude \((-3 s/t)\).<n>Since the plane leaves at \(6:00 A.M\)  \((-3s/t) \lt 0\)<n><n>We can solve \(-(3 t/s) \lt -0\)<n><n>or \(s \lt 4 t\) when plane travel time is considered<n><n>or \(s/4 \lt t\) when \(4t\) is considered as time<n><n>Therefore \(4\left(\frac{s}{4}-t\right) \lt 0\), which gives \(2 s \gt 4 t\)<n>And \(2

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:A government seeks what over it's people? Choices:  A: country B: trouble C: city D: sun E: control<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>Input:The population of a state in the United States increased by 47 percent over the previous ten years. What was the state's population in the previous decade if the current population is 2,170,000?<n>Rationales:"The population of a state..." means the total population of the state.<n>"(increasing by 47 percent)" means that the total population increased by 47% of the previous population.<n>Thus, the population in the previous deecade was 2.17*(100/47)=<<2.17*(2.17/47)>=86284.82>>86284 <n><n>#### 4.886748232307383220323147728064769879<n><n>Answer: 86285<n><n>### Input:(Throughout: You have $200.00.)Answer the following multiple choice questions.<n><n>### Rationales:This question is very easy<n><n>### Input:"I went to a concert at the stadium." How much, in dollars and cents, would it cost to buy a 3-day ticket to that concert: $?, $100, $200, $149, $150?<n><n>### Rationale:You have $200 and you have been to the concert so you have to choose one that costs less than you have.<n><n>### Answer:$200 is more than the $150 so choose $150<n><n>### Rationle:"I went to a ball game at the stadium. How much, in dollar and cents, does a ticket to that game cost: $?, $159, $119, $129, $342?<n><n>### Answer:The cost is $129<n><n>### Raitonale:"I went to a theater show. How much money, in dollars and cent, does it cost per person? $?, $38, $125, $10, $12?<n><n>## Raitonale:This question is very basic<n><n>### Answer1:The
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:The people wanted to take the scenic route, they chose the highway that cut through the what? Choices:  A: countryside B: united states C: beach D: atlas E: developed land<n><n>### Response:		<n>The group wanted to take the scenicium route, they chose the highwway that cuts through the developed land.<n><n><n>

Choices:  A: house B: fast food restaurant C: library D: conference E: paper<n><n>### Response:		The answer can be either conference or library. We can buy food in fast food restaurants though not necessarily consume there. The house can be for storage of food. The paper is too limited to have food and seating, and the library has plenty of seating. The table in the fast food restaurants could be rented for any special occasion. The conference has limited food but ample seating.<n><n>### Input How many minutes are in three hours?<n><n>### Rationales:Three hours is 1800 mins. If it takes 1800mins to get in 3 hrs, then to find the minutes in a minute one would divide.<n><n>### Response to 420 mins/min<n><n>### Input 560 minutes ÷ 4 = 140<n><n>### Response For 140 to get this, first 560 ÷ 5 = 112 then 140 ÷ 112 = 12<n><n>### Demotion:<n>Input: The 1-800 number was first introduced to customers in which year?<n>Year A: $1993<n>Year B: $1998<n>Year C: $1995<n><n>### Rationale: There are 800 as the last 2 digits of each year and 1993 is larger than 1995 but there is not a 9 as it was not the last 2 digits so there is no answer.<n><n><n>### Response 1-8064-836<n><n>### Input The 1-899 number represents what type of customer service provider?<n><n>### Choices: Bank A, bank B, bank C, credit union, and government agency.<n><n>### Rationals: Since 899 calls are answered by agents, they must be answered by phone which means they are a credit union, bank or government agency, but there are 99 and not 999 for banks, and government workers not agents.

Choices:  A: drinkable B: junk food C: medicine D: antidote E: nutrient<n><n>### Response:		E<n><n>Answer:E<n><n>### Input:"Choose" the most appropriate response:.<n><n>### Response:"Which is the most dangerous" is the choice that best completes the sentence.<n><n>### Rationales:<n>The answer choice "poison" is plural, so can't be selected.<n>The answer choice "junk food" is a noun phrase.<n>The answer choice that's plural is "food", and it's a noun phrase, so cannot be selected.<n>The other answer choices are adjective phrases of plural nouns.<n>The only answer choice that's singular is "antidote".<n><n>#### 5<n>#### 5<n>\end{code}<n><n>[Full Example](https://codepen.io/fjh1024/pen/pzmopGz)

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Where would a human expect to find manufacturing operations? Choices:  A: factory B: school C: grocery store D: band E: aircraft<n><n>### Response:		<n>The answer to this question is the letter that it is most similar to: A and B (2) is similar to groceries, so it would make more sense for it to be C<n>E and D (1) are similar to aircraft, so it would make sense for it to be E<n><n>#### 2<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Other Sources To Help Your Scores:<n>[Writing: Rules and the Conventions of Standard English; Lesson and Practice Test<n>](https://www.khanacademy.org/humanities/grammar/writing/x/rules-and-the-conventions-of-standard-english-lesson-and-practice-test)<n><n>[Mathematical and Computational Reasoning: Rules and Conventions for Reasoning with Numbers<n>](https://www.khanacademy.org /humanities/math-science-and-logic/reasoning-with-numbers/x/reasoning-with -numbers -rules -and -conventions)<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Where can you get a stray small dog? Choices:  A: living room B: animal shelter C: georgia D: pet shop E: dog show<n><n>### Response:		<n>```<n>If you don't have a dog show in your area, you would likely go to a georgia, an animal shelter, or a pet store to get a dog.<n>```<n>### Input: A student is on time once out of every three days. On these days, the student arrives to the school building ten minutes before the first bell. What is the number of minutes the student actually arrives at the building?<n><n>### Response<n>```<n>The student arrives to the building ten minutes before the sound of the 1st bell on ONE out of every THREE days.<n>```<n>## Resources<n>[Khan Academy: Decimals to Fractions](https://www.khanacademy.org/math/cc3-4th/cc-4th-fractions/cc-4thf-rational-numbers/a/decimals-to-fractions)  <n><n>

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Where can someone purchase a contraceptive device without a prescription? Choices:  A: pharmacy B: person C: drugstore D: bedroom E: mcdonalds<n><n>### Response:		Choose C.<n><n>### Choice E: mcdonutds<n>Which of the following is the probability of getting a head on a toss of a coin?<n><n>### Input Choice A: Pharmacy<n><n>### Response Choice: B.<n><n>### Input<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>During the summer, Jason rented a small house and he moved in with his best friend, Chris. Jason paid him $100 each week for renting the house. Later on Jason found a house that he liked better and moved in by himself.  He paid $100 the first week and $150 each week after that.<n><n>What was the total rent for Jason being in the house in 64 days?<n><n>### Output:<n><n>### Choices: D. $5,720<n>#### 5720<n><n>#<n># Assignment 1 – Practice 1b<n>#<n># Given the list below.  <n># How many different items in each set can be found when the lists are in order.<n>#<n># Input<n>#<n># Choice i is represented by item j<n>#<n># $A$=$1|2|3 |3 |3 |3|1 |4|4 |4|3|4|5 |5|6 |6 $<n># $B$=$7 |8 |8 |3 |3 |8 |4 |4 |2 |8 |8 |4 |7 $<n># $C$=$5|6 |6|6|7<n>#<n># $D$=$50|100|100 $<n>#<n># $E$=$70 $<n>#<n><n>i=j=0<n>total = 0<n>if choice(i) <n>    choice(++i)  <n>    total+=choice(i)<n>else:<n>        total=total+choice(i)+i<n><n>print i + total<n>A=1 C=6<n>print total<n>B=A<n><n><n>#<n># 1<n>#<n>#   $A$= 1|2|3|3|3|1|4|4|4|3|4<n>#   $B$= 7|8|8|3|3|8|4|4|2|8|8|

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Where would people be looking at some things which can move, but are not moving? There are 13. There are 7 girls and 6 boys.<n><n>### Response 1:<n><n>Input: How does this help?<n><n>### Response2:<n><n>Input: If there are 7, then we subtract by 1 and that’s 6. A man sells a baked pie, and in order to do so he must bake one first. Baking time is estimated to be 30 minutes.  Then each pie requires 7 minutes to serve.  What happens (1) total time to bake and serve, (2) how many pies can he bake in one hour?<n>#### 40 answers 40<n><n>### Rationales:Baking time is estimated to 30 min,<n>There is no need to bake more pies when he is baking, and the total time to bake is 40 he bakes and serves 7 minutes each so it takes 37 minutes to bake a pie and serve a pie and  bake 40 pies to take 1400 min which is 240 min or 40 minutes<n>#### <n>Answer: 43<n><n>### Input A tire manufacturer is advertising 4x3/90 on its tires. This means that its tires last four times better than a competitor’s tires, when compared to the same number of kilometres.  How many times better will a tire last if it lasts 10 kilometres to every nine kilometres of a competitor?<n>####<n>10/9=9/10<n>####<n>### answer 10/9 9/10<n>### Input: An oil rig drills 3 miles into the earth's surface each day. If the earth's surface is 6000 miles from its core, how deep will the rig be when it hits the core?<n><n>### Rationale: A rig drills 3 m per day<n>Each day equals 1 so add 36= 37 to the previous<n>Each day the rig drills is 37m<n>37=5/10 or 4.2857<n>37/3=12.3429(approx)<n><n>####<n>42<n>### Answer: 12.34<n><n>### Inputs: A 34-gau

Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:The window of the Honda was hit from the inside, not the outside. Where was most of the the broken glass found? Choices:  A: bridge B: in spain C: beach D: field E: street<n><n>### Response:		 E.<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:What creatures performing pollination are loved my millions? Choices:  A: birds B: action C: butterflies D: happiness E: anxiety<n><n>### Response:		<n>If you’ve read this far and you’re not sure which is the correct answer, then let’s say it’s A.<n><n>Another correct answer (e.g., C) would have to follow one of the incorrect answers (e.g., B).<n><n>### Instructions<n>Write a program that will select one of the following answers at random: A, B, C, and D.<n><n>Use a while loop to continue the program until the condition for the while loop has been satisfied.<n><n>After the while loop runs and stops running, display the chosen answer to the user.<n><n>####  Answers: A<n><n>####  B<n><n>####  C<n><n>####  D<n><n>#### Answer B:<n>For example the answers could be in an array and you could check if the user chose any of the correct answers in the array then it will output the correct answer.<n><n>```<n>// Array used to check if answer is correct<n>string[] correctAnswer = {"Answer", "Answer", "Answer", "\n"} ;<n><n>while (theUserDidNotChooseTheCorrectAnswer){...<n>       while (theUserDidNotChoseAnswer){<n>           theUserAnswer = choiceOfTheUser;<n>           if (correctAnswer.contains(theUserAnswer))<n>             break;<n>       }<n>      ...//output theUserAnswer to the user<n>}<n><n>//if it does not contain "Answer" the user chooses the wrong answer<n>```<n><n><n>### Instructor Comments: This challenge gives you the opportunity to apply some of those skills we covered over the course of the day.<n><n>Please respond to the prompts and then read this lesson to see if there are any issues.<n><n>### Additional Notes:<n>You can use a while loop for input and the for loop in this scenario.<n>You can also use the break statement in your code, so that if you answer is correct, it will return the final answer.<n><n>I think I’ve covered all the questions that need answering.<n><n>Have a great weekend.
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Deciding to watch tv or play with your cell phone might be a routine but they provide no help in being able to do what? Choices:  A: have tv B: fall asleep C: learn D: sitting E: dancing<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Explanations:Since the choices were not defined on what would happen to you if you were to watch tv or play on your cellphone, the answer would be to just sit on the bed.<n><n>A person while resting and doing nothing is most likely to fall asleep<n>These are all what a person would say while resting and doing something that would distract them from watching television or using their cell phone.<n><n>### Input. A company is selling widgets.  If a cost is $16.00 and a markup is $18.60%, the selling price is $:<n><n>### Response.:<n><n>### Examplations. $16.0 +.18 = X.X = $18.6. $18.6 + $16.0 = $34.6<n><n>### Input :A company is selling widget.  if the cost is x and markup is x+.15, the selling price is<n><n>Answer: $x*<n><n>### Exposition $x*1.15 = x+15.<n><n>### Explation 0.15=15/100<n><n>### Input A person that spent $36.00 paying for gasoline and toll fees on her drive is:<n><n>### Choice 1. Paying her deduct in full for the drive, paying her quarter payment for the drive, Paying $10 less than her deduct in full, Paying her deduct only $8 less than in full.<n><n>### Answer Paying her deduct for the drive<n><n>### Explantion Gasoline is a deductible.<n><n>### Expalantion 1 dollar is.001<n><n>### $36.0/100 is 36$.00<n><n>##Input: Which 3 digits represents the whole number greater than 279, and less than 399?<n>### Response : 371<n>### Explanation :<n>### 37 is the largest 3 digit number less than 39<n><n>##Input : <n>### Choice I: <n>### Choose 4 from the following numbers for this group:<n>### Choices:

Choices: A: Fertilizer B: Home improvement project C: Carpentry project D: Laundry room E: Bathroom<n><n>### Response <n><n>Answer C.<n><n>### Response<n>Answers E. Choice E was incorrect.<n><n>### Rationales<n>If I wanted to put fingernails in the home improvement project, it would be an add-on project.<n><n>The closest answer is laundry room.<n><n>I'd put them under the sink so that they didn't smell up the rooms.<n><n>A fingernail clippings and fingernail beds would need to go in a garbage can that's far away from the house because the house wouldn't be able to smell it.<n><n>If it was in the computer, it wouldn't be a good idea.<n><n>If it were in the closet, it would need to be in a trash bag or something first, then put it in the closet.<n><n>If it is in the garage, they could use it, but it's an outside accessory that isn't safe.<n><n>And in the bathroom, it doesn't have a place.<n><n>If I wanted a fingernail clipping, I'd have them stored in the bathroom.<n><n>### Question<n>Do you think the fingernails could be used to keep out mosquitoes?<n><n>### Response The fingernails could keep out the mosquitos.<n><n>### Explanation<n>The fingernails are made of the same material as the body. <n><n>It serves as a line of defense against mosquitos. <n><n>It's better than the other choices.<n><n>[Continuation of Input/Response from before]The home improvement project should definitely be an option you don't want to spend money on because fingernails are not needed. <n><n>They're used to hold your hands and they're meant to keep your hands from rubbing on the ground.<n><n>But, it could be used to provide a home for the dirt. <n><n>It could be used as a material that could be used to grow grass.<n>

Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Learning usually leads to greater what? Choices:  A: get to know B: gain knowledge C: intelligence D: education E: gaining knowledge<n><n>### Response:		<n><n><n>### Solution:
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Illegitimate designer handbags will not have a certificate of what? B is not home.<n><n>### Explanation:<n>####<n>Answer: B<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Writing a response to a prompt<n><n>### Instructio:<n>A restaurant makes their own bread every day. They prepare bread dough, let it rise, and bake the bread every day. The recipe calls for a 50% rise in the dough, which results in a final bread volume that is 3 times the original volume. What is the bread doughs original volume if the bread is 3 feet tall<n><n>### Example:<n>The restaurant makes bread. 3 feet tall.<n><n>### Demo:<n>The recipe calls for a rise in the dough and it grows by 50%.<n><n>The original volumn that was used was 1/50=<<1/50=0.02>>0.02<n><n>Which results in the baking dough being 500% times as big. 3 feet tall<n>Baking dough is 3 times bigger.<n><n>If you were to measure it out for the actual recipe, 3 feet in dough, and then make it in the oven which is 3 times bigger or 3 feet.<n><n>Dough was 1 foot original, 3 foot baked, 1 times bigger or 2 times<n><n>0.01=<<1/5>>1/5<n><n>3/2=<<3/2=1.5>>1.5<n><n>3 feet tall because of the original volumn of 1 foot, 2 times and 50% rise.<n><n>Now that you have a full size bread.<n><n>Bake the bread.<n><n>Which should be 3 times a bigger size.<n><n>Original size was 1/2<n><n>####<n>Answer: 3 feet<n><n>### Demand:<n>How much did it cost?<n><n>### Demo Respose:<n>The initial cost was $10,000 and to be precise that is what I got back for your services<n><n>### Demo Demand-2:<n>If I give you an extra $1,000 will you come do my laundry again<n>

How many seats are left over?<n>- The only exception is if there are two, one who can sit on the left and one on the right. Two kids sit on each side if that's the case, but that's it.<n><n>### Response (multi part)<n>Given 4, 6, then 2<n>The first four kids, then  four more kids for a total of 8<n><n>- Answer to 4, 6 is six: 8, 10<n>- Answer to 2, 8, 4 is One, one<n><n>Input: Tally up the two teams.<n>Rationales: <n>Each team has 10 players.<n>Add each team  and there’s 20.<n><n>### Input<n>- A and B are playing a tennis match. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Where does a marmoset not usually go? Choices:  A: dictionary B: wilderness C: fly D: underground E: colorado<n><n>### Response:		C) fly/flight<n><n>#### A: Dictionary<n><n>#### B: Wilderness<n><n>#### C: flight<n><n>#### B: Underground<n><n>#### A: Colorado<n><n>### Input:: The time taken for a jet on a carrier to turn around is given by the formula T(H) = 18 - 2H + H^2, where H is the number of hours between 0 and 24 hours, and T = T(h). What is the time taken for the jet to turn around if H = 1/4?<n><n>### Response:: 18<n><n>#### T(H) =  18 - 2(H) + H^2<n><n>H=1/4   -->  H = 1/2 * 720<n><n>-->T(H) =   <18-2(H) +H^2><n><n><n>H=1 -->  H = 720<n>--> T(1) = 18                                    (<18-2(1)+1^2>==18)<n><n>H=2 --> T(2) = 20<n><n>H=3 --> T(3) = 22, etc...<n><n>H=18 --> T(18) = 18<n><n>H=19 --> T(19) = 20, etc...<n>H=24 -->T(24) = 30, etc.<n>H=26 --> T(26) = 32, etc.<n>H = 28 --> T(28) = 34, etc.<n><n>### Input:[Choose the function with the simplest form that best describes the relationship depicted by the graph below.<n><n>### Response:[Choose the function to best fit the grapgh below. A = k B = C =...<n><n>#### BSQRT(5X + 4)<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>### Answer:<n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:I wanted  a side chair for people to visit me while I worked, where did I have it put? Choices:  A: building B: office C: library D: table E: bathtub<n><n>### Response:		I choose C because libraries have books, but do not have any chairs.<n><n>If I choose A, then I want the chair to be in the building where I work.<n>This is obviously wrong since it is not in the building where I usually don't work, which is the library.<n>If I choose B, then I wanted the chair at my work station.<n>I usually work in an office and not a library and the chairs in the library are already taken.<n>If I choose D, then I wanted to sit on the table while I work.<n>When I work, I can't sit down.<n>I can either stand or walk from place to place.<n>If I choose E, then I wanted the side chair in the bathtub.<n>I'm not a fan of baths.<n>I would think that the chair should not be in the bathroom.<n>#### C<n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:She was processing the wool, she kept her leg bouncing to operate the what? Choices:  A: hospital bed B: legroom C: spinning wheel D: grand piano E: rhythm<n><n>### Response:		<n>We were taught what to do when the leg bounces. So she’s operating the “spinning wheel”.<n><n>#### Response <n>E<n><n>### Input She kept her leg bouncy so she could the? Choices: A: exercise more B: make a spinning wheel C: buy some new clothes D: be more aware of it E: stay seated on floor<n><n>### Response She kept her leg bounce so she could do the A: exercise more 1<n><n>### Input The car-rental company would like you to leave the car as you found it. Which of the following options is the best to pay?<n>Choices: A: 20$ B: 30$ C: 190$ D: 20$<n><n>### Response<n>C<n><n>### Input If the temperature is 48 degrees Fahrenheit, and it increases 9 degrees each day, how many days will it take to reach 116 degrees?<n>Choices: 1: 8 days 2: 14 days 3: 3 days 4: 17 days<n><n>### Response <n>2<n><n>### Instructions.<n>We were given the questions and answers and told to answer the following questions.<n>1. Choose a category from the list below.  <n>2. Under that category, answer the question.<n>3. When you have a question and answer you can put it below.<n>4. When you think you’re done you can post as a comment.<n>5. Someone will grade this work and you will get 10% of your score.<n>6. This work will then be graded for you by your teacher.<n>### Category <n>Reading Comprehension<n>### Question <n>The city planner decided to use the parking lot in the center of the city for a community garden. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:When going to sleep what noise does a human make? Choices:  A: loss of consciousness B: relaxation C: snoring D: dreaming E: talking<n><n>### Response:		<n>I think the correct answer is option C because when one goes to sleep he/she snoring.

So for example, 'killing' contains one 'b', but it is only halfway correct.<n><n>### Example: The answer is 5, since 'aba', 'abo', 'abao', 'aabo', 'baba' are the 5 palindromes<n><n>### Demoscenes - Additional:<n><n>#### Example: If you have an array of 50 integers, 60% is 0, what's the remaining?<n><n>### Solution:<n><n>The sum of the array is 100. so 50*60 = 3000<n><n>Now, we don't know how we did, but 3000 > 100.<n>So 2 * 100/99 = 2.00454545<n>and we subtract it from 100<n><n>2.004/99 = ~ 2.01<n><n>### Example - DP:<n><n>#### Problem:<n>Flood a river with a water tanker so that the river level never falls below that of the first two digits of any 2-digit number. <n><n>How many full water tanks would you need to do this task?<n>e.g.: 16 is 16-5 which should never be below 17 but once 17 comes the next 2 digits are 6-2 = 4 and 4 is not full.<n><n><n><n>#### Problem: Flood a river with a single water tanker so that from a given base year, the river level never falls 60% below the year's average.<n><n>#### Note: the given year represents a value<n><n><n><n>#### Example:<n><n>-  Given:<n>```<n>00 - no water, cannot pass<n>01 - 3/5 water, can only pass 14<n>02 - 6/10 water, can pass 21<n>08 - 10/11 water,
