Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:To learn must have the right book, to work efficiently what must one have? Choices:  A: improve yourself B: become knowledgeable C: have tools D: persistence E: have more knowledge<n><n>### Response:		<n>"All of the above."  None of the choices alone is sufficient.<n>#### Answer:<n>1. [A, B, C, D, E]<n><n>### Instructions:Use 5,1,0 to answer the following addition and subtraction questions.<n><n>### Input:"3" + "2" = Output: "5"<n><n>### Input:-3 - "3" = Output:"-6"<n><n>### **Input:**3 + -9 = Output: "??"<n><n>### **Output:** "?"<n><n>### Rationale:<n>We need to multiply 3×9 to turn the subtraction 3-9 into the plus 3+9.<n>It turns out 3*9 = 27.<n>We can add it with a "+" to get 3+27 = 30<n><n>#### 30<n>___<n><n>### Instructed:A 6-foot ladder leans against the side of a 7-story building.  If the top of the ladder is 50 feet from the ground, how high is the top of the building, to the nearest foot?<n><n>### Demostration:<n>#### <n><n>Answer: 50<n><n>### Instuctions:<n>**Input:**A 6-foot plank leans against the side<n>**Output:**How high is the nearest foot to the top of the building:50-6=<<50-6=44>>44<n><n>### Rationales:<n><n>The top of the building is X-1.<n><n>the top of the stick is 50 units away from the building<n>The top of building is 44 units away from the ground.<n><n>50-X=Y,X-6=54.<n><n>X=54+6=Y.<n><n>X=60<n><n>####<n><n>Answer: 60<n><n>### Input-Instruction-Output:<n>Demonstration:<n>**Input:6-inch**<n>**Output:1 foot**<n>**Instruction:** Subtract inches to get feet<n><n><n>### **Rationale:** inches are 12 times bigger than feet<n><n><n>## <n><n><n> <n> <n>   <n> <n> <n><n>

If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:If you want to make a big splash in a river with a rock, from where should you throw it? Choices:  A: mountains countryside B: ground C: bridge D: mountain range E: surface of earth<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Answer: E (surface of earth)<n><n>### Input for exercise:Rental car questions<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple-choice questions.<n><n>### Rationales:What is the total number of animals that can possibly be transported by a single transport truck that holds a maximum of 20 head of animals?<n>The total number of animals can be computed using the formula:<n><n>$$Animal\_number = Animal\_capacity \; \times \; Animals $$<n>Since the transport vehicle can hold a maximum of 2 animals, the answer is ${20 \choose 1} = 19820$ animals.<n>What is the largest single number of miles it will take to transport animals to a specific site? How can you determine the greatest miles-travel of a single trip?<n>In order to solve the problem you need to consider the constraints of how long it takes to travel (2 hours/mile) and the maximum capacity of your transport vehicle (20 animals).<n><n>$$Total\_miles\_traveled = 20 \times (200 \mbox{ miles/day})$$<n>When this problem was solved for $m=7820\mbox{ miles}$, you can repeat the calculations where $m=20 \times (150\mbox{ miles/day})$.<n><n>How much per mile is it to transport animals?<n>This can be calculated by dividing the total cost by the total miles traveled, ie. ${800\mbox{ miles}/ {40\mbox{ trips}}=20\mbox{ triops/hours} = 0.5 \mbox{ dollar}/mile}$.<n><n>### C<n>$Animal\_capacity \; \div \; Animals  = Total\; \mbox{ number of animals }$<n>$Total\; \mbox{ miles\; traveled} \; \div \; Trips\; \mbox{ taken} = \mbox{ miles traveled per single trip}$<n>$Cost\; \div \; Total\; \mbox{ miles traved} = \mbox{ cost per mile traveled} = $<n><n>### Democracy for me<n><n>### Instructor:Ask each student to raise hands and answer the following questions as indicated in the chart.<n><n>### Demo:<n>Hand Raised: 
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Where are people likely to find food? Choices:  A: opera B: supermarket C: building D: conference E: apartment<n><n>### Response:		<n>**Answer:** A<n><n>### Rationale:<n>B: Supermarket C: Building D: Conference E: Apartment<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Input: A student asks, "How long will it take to travel 700 miles at a constant speed of 60 mph?"  What does a good response say?<n><n>### Demmistration response:<n>Input:  A: 12h B: 12 hours C: 60mph D: 700mi E:?<n><n>### Answer:<n>A:120mins B:120miles<n><n>### Input Response:<n>The car rental rate for a compact car is $30 a day with an additional charge of $20 per day for an extra driver. If the rental rates are $50 a day and $25 per day for an extra renter, which rate is greater?<n><n>### Rationales:<n>The compact rate, if multiplied by the number of days, provides the amount you pay for the car. The compact car costs $30*(7days) = $210. The non-compact car at $50*(6days) = $300 The compact car is $50 more expensive than the non-compact car.<n><n>### Answer::<n>50<n><n>### Input<n>The taxicab company charged $1.60 per mile for a short ride and $2.00 per mile for a longer ride. If the driver is paid the flat rate of $45 for the short ride and $60 for the long ride, which paid more, the driver or the customer on the short ride?<n><n>### Response<n>The driver<n><n>### Rather:<n>The driver has a total of $45+$60. The customer has 1.60*$45+2*2.00; 1.60*45= $81 and 2.00*$60= $120 total. The driver has more money.<n> <n>

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Choices:  A: nailed B: carved C: polished D: eat cake E: petrify<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>#### D<n><n>Answer:  None of the above.<n><n>### Question:<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Answer the following multiple-choice problem.<n><n>### Problem:<n>In 1979, the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) received more than 1,000 complaints about a new drug, thalidomide. (Thalidomide, a drug sometimes used as an immunosuppressant, was discovered in the 1950s but not approved in the U.S. until 1998.) Many of the complaints came from pregnant women who had taken the drug during the first weeks of their pregnancies and were now seeing stillbirths, miscarriages, and serious birth defects in the babies they had been carrying. In 1961, German birth records revealed that 50 babies born with malformed or missing thalidomide-affected limbs had been born to mothers who had taken thalidomide during their first trimester. In the U.S., an analysis of state health records indicated that, between 1961 and 1964, more than 10,000 babies experienced thalidomide’s toxic effects. Since those effects were sometimes subtle, these thalidomide babies usually experienced them just months after going to their pediatrician or emergency room with some other, unrelated complaint. By the time the thalidomide connection was documented, however, thousands of thalidomide survivors had been born and were having to live with the effects that noone else was talking about or acknowledging. The FDA requested that the manufacturer, a company called Distillers Laboratories, withdraw the medication. Thalidomide continues to be prescribed in certain countries for certain uses, and there are some reports that it is being used in pregnancy. Thalidomid can cause serious side effects, including an increased chance of developing cancer. It is also associated with a very long list of serious birth defects when taken during pregnancy. Researchers aren’t sure how often this problem happens. When some people take thalidomide, they experience no major side effects. Others may have

If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:John and Jane were a couple. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:What do you get for not moving your car during the required time? Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:The game was on sale. There are a total of 13 people in the area that will be driving there, but a certain section of the road is already blocked off by 100 feet of barricade. The only people allowed in this section of the road are the employees of the new grocery store and people that have appointments with them. However, people can wait in the parking lot behind the barricade, or they can drive around it to the other side of the store. If there are 13 people driving to work and 100 people walking to the store, how many of them will have their appointments in the part of the store with the barricade?<n>Rationales : The number of people that can’t drive past the barricade is 13+100=<<13+10=113>>113<n>Of these,90 are already walking over the bridge so only 23 of these people can have appointments with people at the other side. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:What does a chef do when working in the evening? Choices:  A: cook dinner B: study french cooking C: taste sauce D: prepare food E: thin sauce<n><n>### Response:		E (thin sauce)<n>### Demonsteration:<n>Input: What does a chef do when cooking dinner? Choices:  B: cook rice C: stir soup on the stove D: taste sauce E: pour sauce in boiling water<n><n>### Response B (cook rice)<n>### Rationales:<n>B: cook rice cooks rice<n>#### C (stir soup)<n>Input: What does the chef do when stirring a pot of soup on the range top? Choices:  D: taste sauce  E: check seasoning  F: add ingredients G: thicken soup H: turn heat down to low<n><n>### Response D (taste sauce)<n>## Rationales:<n>D: taste sauce tastes sauce<n>#### H (turn heat down to low)<n>Input: What should you do if the pot of soup begins to boil over while cooking it on the range top? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:After his mother saw his report card he knew he was going to be doing housework, what could have prevented this? Choices:  A: sneezing B: fatigue C: house clean D: feeling satisfied E: getting good grades<n><n>### Response:		C A: Sneezing B: Fatigue C: Housclean D: Feeling satisfied E: Getting good grades<n>C<n><n>### Input<n>The two largest gasoline brands in the state have combined to sponsor a 200-mile drive, so that participants can win prizes. The two brands have agreed to sponsor $60,000 among the three drivers who arrive at the finish line first. They have also decided that whoever finishes in third place will also win $2,000. If a 3-man team drives with a Ford pick-up truck with 3 drivers who take turns driving and no replacement drivers and $1,800 was spent on gas, how much will each of them receive if they finish in first or second place?<n><n>### Rationales: Since no replacement driver is provided and the team is 3 man team.<n>The 3 drivers taking turns can take a total of 24 hours.<n>Hence they have only 24/3=<<24/3=8>>8 hours to finish the journey.<n>First team(75 minutes 30 seconds faster than the 3rd team) wins $60,050 (60050 is approx. 75min 30sec)<n>Second team (11 minutes 15 seconds faster) wins $60050 (63050 is appro 70min+15sec)<n>So first team will receive $60051 (60051seconds) and second team will receive $63049 (63049sec)<n>Thus, total amount won by both is $60048+63049=<<60048%2B63049=%20123097>>123090 seconds<n>Thus, Second team received amount (11 mins,30 sec faster) while third team did not received any amount.<n><n>

The cheapest rental is $204 for 8 days. What is the rental cost?<n>Rationales<n>The rental charge for one day is 35=<35=35/1>35/1.<n>The total rental cost is 8*35+20=<8*35+60=204>.<n><n>Answer:204<n>Rental price: 204 dollars<n><n>Input: Jesse uses the same route to get to work and back. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:What will telling many people about an embarrassing situation lead to? Choices:  A: notoriety B: emotional distress C: riot D: bad dreams E: annoyance<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Rationales:Notoriety will lead to bad dreams. A bad dream could lead to emotional distress. While emotional distress could lead to riot, this is not what the situation depicts. Riot leads to annoyance but the question suggests emotional distress so B is not the answer. Similarly, telling people about the embarrassment will lead to annoyance for sure, but this could very well lead to emotional distres. Therefore, notoriety is the correct response.<n><n>### Input<n>Which is the smallest value that will produce the largest remainder when divided by 7?<n><n>### Response<n>e<n><n>### Rationale<n>Since 7 has no remainder, all numbers divided by 7 that produce a remainder will have the same number of remainders. For example, if we take the smallest multiple of 7 such that the quotient is 2 (27) then 7, we will divide the quotient 27 by 7 and we get a remainder of 3. Then taking the multiple of 21 (21*4=84) we get 3 again. As we cannot find a positive number greater that 7 that will produce 3 remainder when we divide the positive number by 7, we need to look for negative numbers. And in case of them the smallest is -7. So, because e=2 and when we multiply by 7 we get -2 again so the answer is e.<n><n>### Answer<n>e<n><n>#### 💭 This question would be answered in a very similar way using only fractions.<n><n>### Question : If you increase an amount of $100 dollars by 20% you have more money than if you increase the amount by 5% by 10 dollars? True or false.<n><n>### Response :<n><n>### Response rationale : Yes, because $1.00 increase is $20% of $10 increase.
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:James needed a garage because he spent a lot of money on what? Choices:  A: bike B: downtown C: building D: tool storage E: car<n><n>### Response:		Answer the following multiple choice question about the question, and write your response appropriately in the box below the question.<n><n>Rationales: James does not yet own a bike since he has only just started getting a bit more money. He does own a building which is in a separate block. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Where would you sit in a chair to watch four-legged animals complete? Choices:  A: communication B: suffering C: pain D: laughter E: embarrassment<n><n>### Response:		Answers the multiple choice question.<n>E. This is the answer to a real-life situation. This person may be angry about the fact that you broke your leg or they may not know what else to say or what else to do, so they are just asking you a question.<n><n>## 5 minute Writing Task<n><n>The purpose of this task is to help students generate texts quickly and independently; the texts generated may be too short for analysis (i.e., the time allowed is not enough for students to generate and analyze a complete response). A five-minute writing task should be used as an exit task for the day.<n><n>### Purpose <n>The purpose of a five-minute writing is to help students generate a written response, preferably independently, in five minutes. <n><n>### Sample Tasks<n>5 minute writing task-Tell me about ___________<n><n>### Procedures and Formats<n>You will use the same writing rubric to evaluate 5 minute writing tasks as you use for longer writing tasks. Please note that in a 5 minute writing, the rubric refers to the overall purpose, not the specific task. <n><n>## Notes <n>Use this table to organize your rubric for the 5 minute writing tasks. <n>If you do not have a rubric for a specific response type, choose one that makes the most sense to you and then fill in the response criteria. <n><n>Note that the scoring criteria are the same for all three response types in a rubric. <n><n>

They only care for her feelings.<n><n>### Output:<n><n>### Your answers should meet the following criteria:<n><n>- They should not include any statements that are not mathematically correct.<n>- They should use proper syntax.<n>- They should be written with minimal grammatical errors.<n>- They should match the requested formatting in terms of size, spacing, and margins.<n><n>### For more help - Review the attached example.<n><n>### Example:<n><n><img src="images/Sample.jpg" width="700" height="700" /><n><n>### Hint/Feedback:<n><n>For this task, we have to ask the user a question based on the input provided, answer the question correctly according to given input, and output the result accordingly.<n><n>We are required to have one or more input lines. This input will include a question and one or more choices. Each choice will have a rational. At the end of the input we will print out (1) your answer to the question, and (2) the following instruction to the user with the name the task and direction.<n><n>Each time you solve a task, print out a message similar to the following:<n><n>- Your answer to the task is correct.<n><n>or<n><n>- Your answer is incorrect.<n><n>### Hints and Feedback:<n><n>We are required that you ask user a question, input one or more choices and output a number with correct answer (if any).<n><n>### Helpful information:<n><n>For example, for the first task:<n><n>- In the given input, there are 3 input lines, each one include 1 choice and 1 correct answer.<n>- In your response, you are require to ask the user a multiple choice question and print out the correct answer according to the user's response.<n>- The user will print out (1- correct response, 2- no correct response, 3- any error response) based on the user's response when the user sees your output.<n><n>### Help for this task:<n><n>You are given the following input:<n><n>```<n>Instruction:Please answer the following multiple choice question by selecting the answer choice that is most suitable to answer the question.<n><n>Input: The car rental

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:What would you change the learning process to be if someone does not like learning? Choices:  A: interesting B: fun C: joyful or painful D: very important E: free<n><n>### Response:		<n>If they do not want to learn anything new, it would be as simple as making the learning process interesting.<n><n>### Input<n>What would you not add to the learning process to make it better? Choices:  B: fun C: joke or A: interesting D: very important or E: free<n><n><n>### Response<n><n>I would not add something like that, it will be a distraction from learning. Something that might distract and be a distraction from what you are trying to learn.<n><n>###Instruction:Answer the following problem.<n><n>###Input: How much does a house cost? Is the cost of the house always the same? Or, does it change?<n><n>###Answer:<n>No. The prices of houses change all the time.<n><n>###Question:<n>Why do the prices of houses change? Choices:  Is it because people need to move to higher quality houses? Or B: new houses can be much less than old houses. Or could it be because people need to sell and move away? C: people don't keep good repairs on the house they have owned. D new houses can be much cheaper than old houses. E: People keep fixing up their houses to look better so they are worth more money.  Why or why not?<n><n>###The answer:<n>Houses that are new can be much cheaper. They can be built with a lot of the cheaper materials. For example, people choose to buy cheaper houses when they are building cheaper houses, or cheaper houses to keep on the market.<n><n>###If house prices changed too quickly, then not enough people would buy houses. Choices:  A B C: D: E:<n><n>###If no one wanted to buy houses, then the real estate agents would not be able to work.<n><n>###Is there anything we can do to bring house prices down?<n><n>If the real estate prices went down, then more people might want to buy houses. This way, a family would be able to buy a house for less than half of the cost.<n><n>###<n>What should we do to bring prices down? Choices:  Make more houses and sell them for less money. B: sell them for a much cheaper price. C: build houses for less money so they can be sold more cheaply. D: E:<n>###If people
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:The person was looking up airline and hotel prices, what was he looking to do? Choices:  A: control computer B: separate things C: go on vacation D: cross street E: go out<n><n>### Response:		The answer is A. The person is going to control the computer. That is checking up on prices.<n><n>### Input/Instruction:Answer the following fill-in-the-blank question.<n>### Demonstraion:<n><n>Trevor rents an apartment and pays $500 a month rent. He uses 120 kilowatt hours of electricity each month. Electricity costs $0.13 per kilowatt hour. How much does Trevor pay in total for electricity each month? <span style="background:#d4d3e3">A </span><span style="color:#B0B6EA"><strong>$</strong></span><span style="background:#6261A5"><strong>5<n></strong></span><i >30</i ><span style="color:#4C4E8F">.00 </span><span style = "background:#7FB0CD">a</span><span style = "#C8D24D">nd </span> <span style = "#333168">b</span>.<n><n>### Rationales Answer:<n><n>\*Trevor rents and apartment and pays $ 0.05 \* each month.<n><n>\*Trev wants to pay $ 500.05 per month to rent a place to live.<n><n>\*He will use 120 \kilo\wats \* each month and each kilowats costs.13, so.13 \* 120 = 15.60.<n>So he will use 15.6 kwh of Energy and he pays.13 per kwh so this comes out to.18 which is $1.80 to use the Energy.<n><n>\*For his total billing:<n><n>15.6 x.18 = $2.87.<n>Since this is part of his billing cost.<n><n>\*.18 +.13 =.31.<n>So we add the total billing of $2.87 and the total for electricity of.31 which comes out to $3.18 or the letter a stands of $3.18.<n><n>### Reference:Glazer, S.R., & Levine,
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:The woman picked from an apple tree while surrounded by other trees, where was she? Choices:  A: illinois B: woods C: new york D: indiana E: farmer's market<n><n>### Response:		E, since you are picking an apple from an apple tree surrounded by other trees you are at the Farmers Market.<n><n>### Input, Write the number 4! so that it matches the pattern (ex: 3! =)<n><n>### Response, 4! <n><n>### Input<n>Choose a number: 2<n><n>Write a mathematical statement so that you change the order while leaving the sum unchanged between parentheses<n><n>#### Answer: 15 <n><n>### Response<n><n>### Question<n>Choose a number less than 15 or greater than 15  Write a mathematical statement so that your change the order while leaving any one sum unchanged between parentheses. You then empty one marble more from the bag and then fill the bag again.<n>How many marbles do you have in your bag by this time?<n><n>### Demystication<n>The 10 marbles was filled to the bag with 3 removed the bag will count by 3 (10-3)<n><n>The bag then got one more marble that takes it to (10-3)+1=7<n><n>The bag took out again 1 more marble<n><n>And then filled again to count by 7<n><n>So it will be (10-3)-1+7<n><n>And the answer will be: (7+1)-1 = 8<n><n>### Input :: A plane flies to an airport. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. Choices:  A: bus stop B: street corner C: roadblock D: fast food drive thru E: city<n><n>### Response:		D and E would be my answer<n><n>### Instructions: If A person B purchases a new car at $25,000 before sales tax, and the sales tax is $1,000, what is the total price for which the car is purchased?<n><n>### Demostration: The only answer choice that meets the requirement is D<n>First, write "before sales tax" because the final total is "after sales tax".<n>Now, you know that your price is $25,0.00 plus that $1,00.00 sales tax = D.<n>You know that $25,0,000 + $1,00 = D<n>Rationales: Since the sales tax amount was $1000.00 the total price paid was $25,0100.00. D = $25,095<n><n>### Answer: 25,096<n><n>### Instinctions: The only answer choice (A) that meets the requirement is H.<n><n>### Rationales: The area of the parallelogram is given as IHMN + ___.<n>Because the area of the parallelogm(IHMN) is 8 and the area of the paralellogam is given as IHN+_, the paralellogram cannot have an area less than 8.<n>If the area of the paralllegom is greater than 8, then (IHN) can't have area greater than 8, and the whole thing is an IHN.<n>#### 8<n>Answer: 8
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:What appliance uses water and soap? Choices:  A: washing machine B: space shuttle C: blender D: disneyland E: surface of earth<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Input<n>Input: When is the best time to buy a car? Choices:  A. His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. We know the last digit is odd, therefore the second digit must be odd.  We know both digits are odd which means $17=7\cdot2+1=1\times1+7=3+7=10 \neq 9$  therefore the third digit is even.<n><n>### Answer: $101010$<n><n>### 10101<n><n>### Input 4<n>#### What value has 1 greater than the divisor, is 1 greater than all the divisors and 9 less than the divisor?<n>#### Choices:<n><n>A: $12$<n><n>#### B: $5$<n><n>####

Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Choices:  A: infect B: reproduce C: mutate D: eat food E: make computer malfunction<n><n>### Response:		<n>A virus is a software program that is loaded onto a computer and hides in a computer's memory. It's used to do two things:<n><n> 1.  Replicate. It can copy itself and, if the computer is running at the time, may spread to other files on the computer.<n> 2.  Access. It can access files on the computer and either modify them or copy them to different computers on the network.<n><n>Viruses usually find ways into a system through holes in the operating system or application software. (They may find holes in the operating system because of design flaws or through unwritten exploitable programs.)<n><n>Viruses are most often used to steal data. They may also cause other problems such as shutting down the system or deleting the data on the hard drive.<n><n>These two things, replicating and accessing, make viruses the most common software issue in the world today."B" - The answer was that viruses primarily do both of these things at the same time.<n>Even a non-human, computer virus still spreads from computer to computer, infecting files on each computer it touches as it does so. Even if you could keep a virus "boxed" and not in your computer, you would still have it, just not as part of your operating system.<n>The primary reason to get rid of a computer virus is because of the security problems that it causes.<n><n><n>#### Answer: <n>A<n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:What is a place that might not always have a queen? Choices:  A: bee hive B: england C: castle D: deck of cards E: chess game<n><n>### Response:		The queen and card deck are both associated with cards. However, a card deck will always have cards, where the queen is the first piece removed in the game of chess.<n>Answer: England does not always have a queen.<<n>####<n>

Ex: 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 9. You use these numbers and apply arithmetic properties to create another sequence to find any type of numbers. Some of those properties are multiplication, division, addition, and subtraction properties.<n><n>### Input for question: Can you explain and defend your answer?<n><n>-Defend and explain why we cannot cancel out the parentheses in your answer.<n><n>#### Answer: We must use the properties that we have learned, the order matters. So if the number is 42 we cannot write it as 21.

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:The little girl was raised selfish, she didn't even care when she was doing what? Choices:  A: crack B: antipathy C: being mean D: disinterest E: unfeeling<n><n>### Response:		<n>> **A:**<n><n>### Input<n>Input: The girl's boss wanted her to ___ in a meeting so she could answer questions better. Choices: A: Listen B: Practice C: Prepare D: Memorize E: Behave<n><n>### Response<n><n>> **A: **<n><n>### Note: <n>- **Pick up vocabulary:**<n>	- **Lecturer:**<n>	- A person that does not want to talk about you because they feel they do not like you and would rather avoid your company<n>- <n><n>### Input <n>> A: Do you know what your teacher wants you to do this week?<n><n>### Response <n>Answer:<n>>**Yes, I do**<n><n>### Note<n>- **What does the answer mean:**<n>	 - The person knows but the other person doesn't<n><n>### Input :<n>> A: Is it hard for you to learn languages?<n><n>### Answer:<n>>** Yes, it is difficult for me to learn new languages.**<n><n>### Answer :<n>> **I can do it, in the beginning it is hard, but later on, after I get used to it, I learn the language quite quickly.**<n><n>## Output:<n>- > **What do you make of his personality?**<n><n>- > > **If he had studied less and had spent more time watching movies, he would have developed a nicer personality.**<n><n>- > _<n><n>- > **I have heard great things about some of the restaurants around these here streets and alleyways.**<n><n>## Input<n>- > **If you give me your number I can easily invite you for lunch.**<n><n>## Answer<n>>**Sure I would love that.  It will be nice to meet you.**<n><n>## Notes:<n>- **What does "it will be nice to meet" mean?**<n>	- the person would like to meet the other person for the first time<n><n>## Input 3 :<n>- **Do you know when our next meeting will be?**<n><n>## Answer :<n>>**No, we don't have a meeting schedule this week.**<n><n>- **What does it mean?**<n>	 - The week is too short to have a scheduled meeting
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:What can happen to you when eating hamburger from someone that you do not know that does not happen when you usually eat a hamburger? His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:It was a vast complex, the launch pad was just one part of what? Choices:  A: movie B: cape kennedy C: space center D: military installation E: spaceship centre<n><n>### Response:		The correct answer is A and B. This can be done by going through the options listed and eliminating the incorrect ones. For the first choice B, the correct answer given isn't kennedy but cape kennedy. The other options C, D, E are all inaccurate and incorrect.<n><n>### Input-Demonstration:<n>Which of the following sequences is the same as<n>1 7 11 15 19 23 27<n>Which of the squares in the below grid represents a mathematical sequence?
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:He wore the wrong shoes while walking all day, now he has what on his heels and toes? Choices:  A: exercise B: moving forward C: feet D: blisters E: locomotion<n><n>### Response:		E<n><n>### Demostrations:<n>* The word locomotion means the action of moving from one place to another while also having its literal meaning of the action of moving from a place, typically a standing or sitting position, to a stationary one.<n><n>			I'm glad to make a trip to the new supermarket just down the street!<n><n>* Choosing an answer that is not one of the answers given.<n><n>		The word A is right!<n><n>### Answer Key:<n>Answer: The word is "E"<n><n>		**Exercise 2.** What on his heels and the toes has he got? Choices A, B, C, D,..., E, F,<n><n>### Input : A 7 year old had 238 grams of sugar before playing sports in the rain in 61 degree weather. He sweated 248 drops of water. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:When he was a small child he called the giraffe mascot a cow, it was a fond memory of the now defunct what? Choices:  A: toy store B: story book C: great outdoors D: countryside E: wildlife refuge<n><n>### Response:		It was a fond memory of _E_<n><n>### Instructions:Input: The teacher is using the following number scheme for grades in Mathematics:<n>0=F50-<50-F=<50F=F<n>How many students in her class earned an A grade the last day of class? Choices: <n>A: 47 B: 2 C: 31 D: 37 E: 0<n><n>### Answer: _B_<n><n>### Rationale: F is equal to <50F.<n>And any student who has a grade less than or equal to 50F got a F.<n>47 = 47 < 50<n>2  < 50<n><n>### Input<n><n>The teacher is using the following weighting scheme to calculate grade point averages:<n>90% of each weighted grade will go <n><n>in the "weighted grade" column, <n><n>whereas the remaining <n><n>will go there. <n><n>### 1. What does the line 90% of each mark will go here mean?<n>(Choices:  <n>0. Each ruler has a single letter on it that cannot be reordered without changing its value. Select the letter from the list that is the most likely to be chosen first by chance?<n>Rationales:(L)If you pick one randomly there is a 1/60=<<1/60=1/6>>1/6 chance of getting the letter L.<n>(M)If you pick one at random there is a 2/60=<<2/60=2/6>>2/6 chance of getting letter M.<n>(N)If you pick one with random there is an 7/60=<<7/60=11/6>>11/6 chance of picking the letter N.<n>This is why the number 11/6 is closer to the probability than the number 2/6, 2/6 < 11/6<n>####  n<n>Answer: 11/6 Likely<n><n><n>
