If x units are added to the length, what is the perimeter, the new length, and the area of the rectangle?<n><n>### Question number 2.<n><n>What is the largest number divisible by every whole number from 1 – 15?<n><n>### Response to question #1:<n><n>The perimeter is 80 and the area is 40<n><n>Addition equals the number before it, and you get 120<n><n>Length before the addition is 90 and you get 170<n><n>Length after the addition is 120 and you get 290<n><n>### Response for question #2.:<n><n>The largest number divisible by all numbers except 1 is 144.<n><n>### Explanations of questions:<n><n>### Question #1<n><n>You have a rectangle that is a certain measure and the next one after it is 25 + x = 25 + x so its length is added to x then you get the perimeter of x + length then you get the area<n><n>The first length will be x and width will be 80 which will get the area of x<n><n>### Question 1<n><n>The

Choices:  A: gy mnasiu m B: motel room C: seashore D: bath room E: locker room<n><n>### Response:		E: locker<n><n>### Rationale: A shower is an expected convenience in a locker room.<n><n>### Input<n>> A shower is an unexpected convenience when you rent a bathroom.<n><n>### Answer<n>B: motel room<n><n>### Rationales<n>A motel is a roadside hotel, which is frequently accessed by a car.  Since a shower is expected in a hotel room, it is an unexpected convenience to a car.<n><n>### Questions<n>1. What type of response should an expert provide:<n>A. Correct.<n>B. Correct if appropriate.<n>C. Correct if appropriate or additional.<n>D. Correct or additional.<n>E. Correct.  An expert provides a statement that shows the correct answer along with a detailed explanation of how the answer is correct.  The detailed explanation is in the form of a mathematical proof of some type.<n>2. What is a response from someone working on a task.<n>3. If you are taking advantage of the opportunity to ask a question about a task, you are engaging in the task:<n>A. Solving.<n>B. Giving expert advice.<n>C. Assisting.<n>D. Answering.<n>4. A response from someone helping you learn about a task is:<n>5. A response from someone giving their opinions about a task is:
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Where can you store you tent and keep it on your person? Choices:  A: sleep in while camping B: camp ground C: woods D: bag E: backpack<n><n>### Response:		Sleep in while camping<n><n>### Input :What is a good way for a camper to stay clean and dry? Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Lindy was a senior. Which of the following could be a value of <t?<n><n>1.  t = r<n>2.  t = s<n>3.  t = r + s<n>4.  t = r – s<n>5.  t = r <sup>2</sup> + s<n>6.  t = 4r r + 5 s<n><n><n>#### 6<n>Answer: 6<n><n>### Rationales<n>#### t = r + s or t = r - s<n>#### t = r * <sup>2</sub> + s<n>#### t = 4r * r + 5 * s<n><n>### 5. Answer: 4<n><n>### Additional Input:-Let’s say the total number of people who use a gas station or grocer’s store everyday is 100, then how many people will use the cash register every day at an average? Answer:- If each transaction takes 7 minutes on average. Then for the 100 population how many transaction is there?<n><n>### Answer:- Let the total number of transactions = 100*7 = 700 (700 people will make purchase of 700*1 = 700) Average time for each transaction = 700/7 = 100<n>Number of transactions in a day = 100*(7- 1) = 99<n>Number of people or customers in a day = 99*(1-100/99)=3.008<n><n>### Input<n><n>-What type of number is $1,236,983<n><n>-What types of number are both 256 and 0.454?<n><n>### Response <n><n>-$1,236 is dollars and $983 are cents<n><n>-0.454 is a fraction<n><n>### Input-What is the value of the 2/4 fraction?<n><n>### Rationale<n><n>2/4 = 2*4/4 =2/1.<n><n>### Response<n><n>2/4 is equal to 1/2, which when converted to decimal is 0.5.<n>### Input:-The value of this percent formula?<n><n>### What type of number are both 5.0 and -4.085?<n><n>### Calculate the sum of these two fractions

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:A gentleman is very wealthy and flaunts it, where does he likely live? Choices:  A: europe B: big house C: tuxedo D: palace E: men's room<n><n>### Response:		<n>-C = man flaunts money and status but likely not have the money<n>-A = europe = big houses and flair<n>-E may be someone who may want to rub it in<n>-B=tuxedo=classy or expensive<n>-D = palace = someone who spends money<n>####  E<n>Answer: the men's room<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Why is waiting for the doctor difficult for people who need to do work? Choices:  A: having appointements B: being late C: have time to think D: time consuming E: impatience<n><n>### Response:		<n>Waiting is very difficult because you have to focus on it and it uses your time which is very valuable.<n><n>### Response Analysis:<n>Waiting in doctor’s office or other medical treatment appointments is difficult.  There is really no rhyme or reason to it though.  You could go anywhere from 15 minutes to nearly all day, depending on what kind of medical treatment you are facing.  Waiting in the office or waiting for your results, can be quite frustrating.  If you are having pain, it can be so bad that you can barely handle waiting for the doctor. Waiting is a time consuming activity and sometimes the amount of time you spend waiting on someone else, can be the time you need to do the work on a separate project.  So, there is very little benefit from waiting and it really is a waste of time that you could have used to spend on projects. There are several implications regarding your answers.  In our daily conversations with our clients, people feel the need to be impatient and in too big of a rush.  It can be very important for these clients to try their very best to be patient.  It is also very difficult to try to be patient with everything and to make sure you’re not in a rush.  I have found that being in a rush is a common occurrence and it has helped me avoid being in a rush.<n><n>### Rationale:The first reason for the doctor is having appointments.<n>#### A<n><n>Answers: A<n><n>### Rationales:What are some benefits of hiring a person for an on-site position? Choices:  Choices: Choices: Choices:: Choices:A: no distractions B: no waiting C: can work at home D: have a home office E: work around hours<n><n>### Response<n>Since a person in an on-site position does not have a choice but to work at the business location, they don’t have the distractions to leave work and come back later.  Also, since there is no leaving and going back to work, people don’t have to wait around for the doctor’s appointment or anything else.  People who have an on-site position also have their own workspace, which is really beneficial and helps with productivity.  There’s not really a lot of difference between work hours.

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Where would you put a handle if you want to bring it with you? Choices:  A: hatred B: surprised C: compliments D: dedication E: solutions<n><n>### Response:		In all, the choice is D. Hatred, surprised, compliments and dedication all relate to the person. You would think that this person would be focused on improving on themself. The choices are either positive or negative, but solutions isn’t related to the person in question.<n><n>## Rationale for answers<n><n>### Instructions answer:<n><n>#### Demonstration: answer<n><n>### Instructing answer:<n>Input: The price of gasoline is $3.00 a gallon. A tank of gas holds 15 gallons. How much does one tank of gas cost?<n>Rationales answer: One tank of gas costs $3*15=<<3*15=45>>45 dollars.<n>#### Demonstrational answer:<n>#### Demonstratinal Answer:<n>#### Demontratinal Answer:<n><n>### Instincting answer:<n>Rationales:<n><n>A: If you’re in a car, you can have the steering wheel stick to the dashboard while driving.<n>B: If you’re walking through mud, you don’t want your feet to be stuck to the ground because you could slip and potentially injure yourself.<n><n>C: Compliments are a lot more nicer than hatred because hatred tends to kill a person and compliments help make someone better and more confident.<n><n>**D:** You could have your focus on driving with hate or with compassion at heart. You don’t want to be focused on hate because hate can lead to destruction. You want focus on driving and doing your best to get where you need to go quickly and safely.<n><n>**E:** Solutions aren’t specific to the person, but more of a general description. If you think about why you’re giving that compliment, hatred, surprise, or compliments. You would think that you’d be focused on the individual and trying to improve them, not yourself.<n>

Choices:  A: from the sky B: map C: cross counties by car D: country E: michigan<n><n>### Response:		D as the only answer that has the exact spelling to what is given by "view the county highway as a line" rather than view a view of the highway.<n><n>### Input<n>How many days did Jack sell his newspaper for $0.50 each day?<n><n>#### 2<n>Answer: 2<n>### Demonstaration<n>Input:Jack sold the newspaper for $0.75 the 1st day.  $1.00 the second day.  $1,050.00 the third day.<n><n>### Response<n>#### 2<n>The only answer would be 2 days because of the given information.<n><n>### input<n><n>The number of days required to travel 40 miles at a speed of 15 miles per hour equals <<0>>0 days.<n><n>### response:<n>0. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:The farmer chose plants he could make bird feed from and use of again the next year, he only planted what? Choices:  A: raise corn B: seed plants C: grow plants D: seed crops E: farm land<n><n>### Response:		I chose answer D. Seed Crops<n><n>### Output:<n><n><n>The car-rental agancy charges $25/day for a car rental that last up to 30 days. Marci rented a car for three weeks. How much did she pay for the car-rental?<n><n>Input:<n><n><n>The farmer chose plants that wouldn’t need to cut-back growth in future years. He planted a field with what?<n>Answers: A, B, C, D, E, F or G<n><n>### Input<n>The farmer chose a plant that wouldn’t need cutting back growth in future years. The farmer planted in the field with what?<n><n>### Answer and Explanation<n><n>The correct answer is G: Other plants<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:If you're betting with a shark, where are you likely playing? Choices:  A: aquarium B: mediterranean sea C: south pacific D: pool hall E: pacific ocean<n><n>### Response:		The "pool hall" is the only one out of the choices that is not a body of water. So the answer must be the "Pool Hall"

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:HOw do you carry potatos home? If Dave saves $1, 500 toward the cost of the truck, he will use in-house financing at a rate of 7% APR (annual percentage rate). The interest rate increases to 7% on the first day after 6 months. A loan for 10 years requires a down payment of 23% of the truck price. How much, in dollar, must Dave put down to get the deal?<n><n>#### **Question1:**Explain "Dave's saving will be of $1,500 toward the price of the truck" and "Dave will use in house financing at a rate 7%". How this will help in completion?<n>##### Answer:"<n>1. Dave's saving will be to the price of the truc and Dave paying in installment will help him to purchase the truck from his own saving.<n>2. Dave uses finance so he needs to pay on loan.<n>**Note:** In installment means you are getting some relief in paying some amount against the installment which you should pay. So you can pay the remaining amount in easy or installments.<n>**Note: 1**<n> <n>### Question 2:<n><n>#### **Explain "The interest rate increases 7% on the 1st of the 2nd month" and why "it is increasing at the end of 6th month"?<n>##### Answer:"The interest rate is increasing on 1st of the start of month which would be in the 2nd month. It will increase 7% when the first day of month starts in the 6th month.<n><n>### Question 3:<n><n>#### **Show on your diagram what percentage Dave puts toward the truck by taking the down fee?<n>##### Answer:<n>I am showing Dave's saving or down payment.  Downpayment means the part of the truck is deduced from the
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Where do almost all people live? Choices:  A: football stadium B: apartment C: surface of earth D: car show E: house<n><n>### Response:		<n>Answer: A<n><n>### Input<n>In 1952, a plane left New York and flew to London at a speed of 400 miles per hour. How many hours did it take to fly to London?<n><n>### Response<n>Answer: 8 hours<n><n>### Note:<n>Sorry to ask this much but I will be much happy if you can help me on every instruction given.<n><n>#Languages spoken

Only one is correct.<n><n>What is the correct way to write the equation? Choices:  A: flower garden B: garden center C: pot D: pot E: formal garden<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>A rosebush can be put in a garden center but only if it is a single plant nursery. A rosebush can also be placed in a pot or container in a formal garden. Lastly, a formal garden is the preferred place to put a rosebush. Choices A and D are incorrect because a rosebush cannot be planted in a flower garden without being in a pot. Choice B is not an option because a rosebush requires special knowledge in order to properly care for and maintain it.<n>#### Pairwise Contrast<n>When comparing two sets of features two types of contrasts can be drawn. A difference of a feature (A-B) and a proportion of features (A/B).<n>Consider the below example:<n>A feature can be defined as something used to distinguish one type of plant from another.<n>B feature can also be defined as the opposite of A feature.<n>In this example there are 3 plants: sunflower, dandelion, and a rose. Each plant has A and B feature.<n>A: Sunflower has a yellow flower and B: it is not round.<n>A: Dandelion has a white flower and B: it lacks petals.<n>A: Rose has red flower and B: it has thorns/prickles.<n>```<n>  A sunflower can be distinguished from rose and dandelion because a sunflower has a round flower.<n>  A dandelion can be distinguished from rose because it lacks petals and a sunflower can be identified from a dandelion because dandelion lacks thorns.<n>  A rose cannot be distinguished from a dandelions because both plants share the same color.<n>```<n>Now what if rose and dandelions have identical A features but dendelions possess more than a single B feature.<n>```<n>  In the above case even if a flower is brown and non-petaled there are only to options. Its either a dandelion or a rose. This is because two plants do not share more than a single feature.<n>  The rose is considered to be the preferred choice because this is the only option that has no B features.<n>```<n><n>A more complicated example might have 2 features with distinctive roles and relationships.<n>Now consider that there are 4 plant types: cherry,

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Bob needs a level to hang a shelf but cant find one in his home. Where would he go to get one? Choices:  A: glass of water B: build evenly C: garage D: carpenter's shop E: video game<n><n>### Response:		You will need to create an if statement, or any of the others available in the course if you know how to use them.<n><n>### Answer: E<n><n>### Input<n>Fred gets a check of $543.77 per week but makes $9.12 per hour. When can Fred work 40 hours per week and receive the same amount in his checks as he did before he took this job? Choices:  $1030 B $559.34 C $623.67 $D $711.42 D $962.65<n><n>### Response<n>You will need to make a table to show the weeks that Fred can work for the correct amount of pay. Also, you will need to determine the number of hours Fred needs to work to make that amount. Finally, create a second table of the amount of overtime if Fred does not work 40 hours. You must also state when the overtime starts and ends.<n><n>### Input Answer: B<n><n>### Input <n><n>A car rental agency charges $32/day for each day that you rent a car, plus a charge of $19/day for each additional day that you want to rent a car. You have rented a car 60 days. How much did you pay for each day that you rented a car? Choices: 42 B $62 C $140 $D $260 E $480<n><n>### Response <n>you need to construct the equation first, then you can solve and get the amount that you had to pay.<n><n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Where in a town would you put your shed? We get 0;15.<n>50 =<< 65 / (65+15+2.5) =50>>50,<n>50 =<<65/(65*2) = 50>>50<n>#### 25<n>Answer:25:25<n><n>### Instructu ion:Answer the following multiple - choice question
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:What does a master carpenter use to put holes in objects? Choices:  A: drill B: learn C: require obedience D: understand E: spoon<n><n>### Response:		<n>You should understand that the correct answer is E and not A, B, C or D<n>#### Answer: E<n><n>Input: A man walks 5 miles due north. Then he turns around and walks 5 miles back due south. How far from his starting point is he now?<n><n>### Demosntration:<n>Input: He traveled north 5 miles so he will travel south 5 miles to get back to his starting point<n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n>### Input 2:What does a Master Carpenter use to drill a hole? Choices: A: patience B: drill C: the correct screwdriver D: the right size bit E: the appropriate screw<n><n>### Response<n><n>You should understand that a master carpenter uses the correct tool with an appropriate size<n>#### Answer: E and not A,B,C or D<n><n>Input: How far apart are the cars driven each day? Choices: A. None of the numbers are correct B. One mile C. 2 miles D. 3 miles E. 4 miles<n><n>Input: 1x2=<<<<1x2=2>>2<n>1+2=<<<<1+2=3>>3<n>2+3=<<<<2+3=5>>5<n><n>### Rationales: The answer is E because they were 1 mile apart for 2.<n><n>### Answer: E<n><n><n><n>### Input Choice A. The carpenter uses a drill to get started.<n><n><n>Input Choice B. He then uses a bit with a shank diameter the same as the diameter of the screw he is using.<n><n><n>### Choice C. He adjusts the drill to the correct depth to reach the screw through the desired surface.<n><n><n>## Choice D. The bit is at the same angle as the drill to ensure that the screw he is drilling into is level when he drills into it.<n><n><n>Input: How many days in a row do 3 of these animals eat grass?<n><n><n>### Animal 1<n><n>An animal has teeth and hooves. His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. (Hint: Find an inverse.)<n><n>### Instuctions A:What is an inverse of this function?<n><n>### Demostration:<n>F(x)=5x^2+4<n><n>x=5^0/5^2+4<n>0x=1<n><n>x=0<n><n>F(x)=4+3x<n><n>x=3^0/3^2+4<n>3x=8<n><n>x=0.125<n><n>An inverse of F(x)=4+2x is f'(x)=4-2x.  In general, a function f has an inverse if the corresponding function \(f^{-1}(x)=f(f^{-1}(x))\), where \(f^{-1}\) stands for the inverse function.  That is, if f is a function, then \(f^{-1}\) is defined to be the function that satisfies f^{-1}(f(y))=y.<n><n>### 4-2x<n><n>F(x)F(x)=4 F'(x)x^2<n><n>F(x)+F'(x)x=4<n><n>F(x)(1+x/4)=4<n><n>F(c)F'(c)=1.<n><n>F'''(x)=-4<n><n>#### 1<n>Answer: f'''(x)=-x^3<n><n>### Demosntration:f'''(x)=-3(x^2+x)<n><n>x=5,<n>3*(5^2+5)=<n>3*9=<n>1,9<n><n>f'''(5)=-1,9<n>f'''(5)<n><n>### Instutitions B:  Explain what the question means.<n><n>### Demo:<n><n>### Instutions C: What does this expression stand for?<n><n>$$<n>\int_3^6 \sqrt{x^2-4}dx<n>$$<n><n>### Demo<n><n><n><n>#### 2<n>Answer:<n><n>### Input-Question: A. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:John is getting something important.  What does this make him feel? Choices:  A: then have B: headaches C: stoic D: being happy E: wanting more<n><n>### Response:		C
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:He got a job dancing and waving an advertisement, he got to be outside instead of stuck inside the what? Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Where are a lot of offices in New York? Choices:  A: school building B: skyscraper C: business D: grocery store. E: work<n><n>### Response:		A: school building<n><n>### Rationales:The majority of the people are at work, therefore the school is the most likely location.<n><n>### Answer:A: school building

However, the paint is sold by the gallon.  He could save money if he bought in bulk and he could find a way to transport the paint home.  If the gallon contains 288 square inches of space, how much volume is each quart (about 32 fluid ounces) of paint?<n>rationales: 32 fl oz paint = (32 fl oz) / ( 288 sq in) = 0.1141 cubic in = (0.114 in) * 12 in = 1.2 in3 or 0.00288 cubic ft<n><n>output answer: 1.2 cubic inch<n><n>input: a new car will require 16.5 gallons of gasoline in the first year. How much fuel will 14,000 miles require?<n>rationales for 14000 mi = 1400 mpg and 30 days = 1000 gal but not the other way around!<n>solution: 16.5 gal/year * 30 days/year = 540 gal/ year and 540 gal / 1000 = 0.54 gal/day<n>so far 0.54x30 = 1.62 so far 1.62 gal/day 1400 mi/ day =14.08 gallons/day<n><n>output answer:14.08 gal/day<n><n>input: a box has a 7 1/2 square foot window and its area is 8 1/2 by 9 1/4 square feet.<n>find the area of the box, rounded to the nearest tenth.<n>rationales for A = LxW: <n>7.5 ft x 9.5 ft = 70.25 sq ft<n><n>output answer 70.26 sq ft<n><n>input: tom has a 5 foot by 7 foot storage unit in his garage.  he wants to place his tools in the unit.  the rental costs $42 every 4 weeks.  tom has 4 racks for his tools

If we add receipts and sales tax together, what is the total she’ll pay?<n><n>### Input Rationales: Sweater and scarf cost $24.5, each.  3.50 is 10% of $34.50. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Reading a newspaper gives you a what about local current events? Choices:  A: get angry B: concern C: worrie D: education E: learning about world<n><n>### Response:		Input 65 65<n><n>### Instructions<n>### Task2<n><n>Tiffany has decided to visit a city 5 times as far from her home as the distance from the city to the airport. In miles, the travel distances are city to home, city to airport, and home to airport. What values of x will make trips 1, 2, 3, 4, and 5 equal x?<n><n>### Demnstration:<n>R: Tiffany has a one way trip to the city at 100 miles. Tiffany also has a one way trip from the city to the AirPort<n>D: Travel 1 is 100 miles and from home to the airport is 100<n>Therefore, a two way trip from home to the city to airport is 200 miles<n>The return from the airport is 2/200=<<2/200 =10>>10<n>R: Travel 2 is 100 from the home and then return is 100 + 100 = 200<n>Therefore travel 3 is at most 200 miles.<n>The return from the city to the Airport is 1/200 = <1/200=20>> 20<n>D: Traveling 3 is 200 and from the airport to home is 100 and the return of travel 3 is x or <<1/200>>1/200.<n><n>Therefore,<n>Travel 4 : 200 + 1/20 =<<200 + 200>>600<n><n>and then the trip from the airport to the city is 200 +10 =<<20 +100>>200<n>The return again is the same as travel 4 is 600+100  =<<600 + 1600>>2600<n><n>And again the travel 5 is the one way from the Airport to home which is 1600 and the return from the city to airport.<n><n><n>### Demestication<n><n>R: Traveling from the city to the home is the same as from home to the air
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:I'm watching tv because there is nothing else to do, what do I expect to get from this? Choices:  A: erections B: entertainment C: boredom D: get fat E: sadness<n><n>### Response:		<n>#### A<n>Answer: A<n>

He was a clown, and acted very ridiculous.  This cheerfulness turned off people who expected the funeral to be what? Choices:  A: solemn B: compete C: serious D: somber E: straightforward<n><n>### Response:		<n>### Instruction<n>You should write the best response that appropriately complements the request.<n><n>#### Response<n>Most families had trouble keeping up with their medical expenses. How difficult it would be for a woman to decide whether or not she would be a stay-at-home wife. When we look at the statistics about stay-at-home wives there are very few women who actually find this to be a dream.<n><n>#### Rationales<n>I would be so upset if I were a stay-at-hone wife. The medical expenses were the only thing to hold us up. If I would have had a lot more money than that would be different. I feel like most women who had children have been held back with the medical expenses. I think most men do not realize what wives go through when they have a child. Most women do not have the financial backing that they would need.<n>One thing that a wife has to do when being a stay-at-homemother is they have to cook, clean, and do the laundry. When a woman was a stay-at- home-mother she got the kids ready for school the laundry and other things around the house. If she has the help of a maid is usually more difficult. A woman that does not work outside of the house has to do the cooking, housework and everything.<n><n>#### Answer:<n>Most families had difficulty in keeping up with their medical bills.  A woman would only be able to be a stay-at home wife if she had large amounts of money.  According to a survey, it was not a very large percentage of women who chose to stay at home with their children.  As for being a wife, it was the best for some, worst for others.  It is not a dream job, there are things to consider also.<n><n>### Response<n>I believe this response complements the request.  Its tone is respectful but makes the reader consider the question.  It makes the reader contemplate the reality if he or she was a ‘stay at home wife’.  The rationale explains the situation from a personal viewpoint and includes good analysis.

Fill in the table by selecting the appropriate term.<n><n>### Input Table<n><n>### Demonsration:0,1,2,3,10,8,9,10,6,12,14,12,11,14,16,13,6,15,14,2,17,18,13,19,16,20<n><n>### Response Table<n><n>### Instuctions:In the sentence below, which of the bold lettered words or phrases are the independent clauses?<n> <n>### Instruction<n><n>### Demostration:I wanted to meet you at noon and I wanted to walk.<n><n>### Response<n><n>### Independence:I wanted to meet<br/> You at noon<br/> You at walk<n><n>### Insttructions:In the following question, identify which of the groups is mathematically correct.<n><n>### Test Set<n><n>### Demosration:42 ÷ 3=14<n><n>### Test Answer<n><n>### Test Group:42 ÷‎3=14‎<n><n>### Instrusctions:Which two choices correctly match the following pairs of words?<n><n>### Test Example:Rapid: slow<n><n>### Test Match:quick:slow<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Where did the person have to walk downstairs to get the tool? Choices:  A: hardware store B: basement C: garage D: repair shop E: the library.<n><n>### Response:		<n>It is a hardware store.<n><n>### Input<n>A clown performs in 13 towns in a 4-day week on his tour.<n>Suppose that on each day he travels to the first town, performs at that town, travels to the second town and performs there, and so on. How many hours does the clown spend traveling on each of the days of his tour?<n><n><n>### Input Solution<n>This question can be solved in two ways. First, you can figure out on which days the clown travels to the next town and when he stays in town to perform. Next, you can figure out the total time it takes him to travel to all the different towns. Another way to solve this is to figure out the time he has to spend at each of the towns and multiply it by four to get hours he spent traveling on each day. This is a different solution, but it works.<n><n>### This can be solved this way:<n>On day 1, the clown travel for three hours and performed for one hour. Total hours spent on day 1 : 4<n><n>Next, he performed on day 2 for 6 hours.<n>Travel:  0<n>Perform: 1<n><n>Then on day 3 he performed for 4 hours.<n>Travel : 0<n>Perform : 4<n><n>And on day 4, he performed on the last town for one hour, and traveled back to his hotel for 3 hrs.<n>Total time spent on day 4 for performing:4<n>Total time spent on traveling 3 hours<n><n><n>### This answer can be obtained using the following equation. A clown travel for 3 hours at the beginning of the week and travel for remaining 4 days. Thus, a total of 7 hours traveling. If a clown travel for five hours each day, the total performance time is 4(7/5). This gives (7/5)4 or 75/5 hours in total. Therefore, the clown spent 75/5/4=5/4=75/4=7.5 hours traveling each day (3/7 of a day).<n><n>### Input Answer: The clown traveled for 5 hours on day one. Total time spent on traveling = 5<n>The c
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Where do people traditionally get information about the world? This answer means the lizard was dead.<n>2: The refrigerator was the same temperature that a desert would be. The desert can reach up to 100 degrees in some parts of the desert. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. Choices:  A: hiding B: accidentally C: expectation D: knowingly E: planned<n><n>### Response:		The choice that matches and describes how George did what he did.<n><n>### Answer: B: accidentally<n><n>### Inputs: A: ___________ B: ___________ C: ___________ D: ___________ E: ___________<n><n>### Answer for above inputs: A: hiding B: secretive C: planned D: knowingly E. accidentally<n><n>## Question/Answer<n>### Write a procedure that can be applied to the task input.<n>Input: The car rental agency  charges  $30/day  for a car, or  $190 for  the  first week  for  a  rental  that lasts an entire  week  or longer.  Jennie  rented  a  car  for 11 days  How much in  dollars,  did  she  pay for  the  rental?<n><n>### Code:Rules: Car rental agency: charge  $30/rental  day  <1500 for the first week.  <3000 for 2 weeks  <4000  for 3 weeks <5000   for  4 weeks  <6000  for  5 weeks  <7000  for       6 weeks <8000   for 7weeks  <9000  for   8 weeks     <10000   for     9 weeks  >=10000<n><n>def daily_rate(days)<n><n>rate = 4500<n><n>days << 1<n>loop while rate < days:<n><n>rate = rate + (30/1)<n><n>if days < 1500:<n><n>rate = 190<n><n>elif days < 2000:<n><n>Rate = 450<n><n>else:<n><n>return "You must rent from here if greater than 10000"<n><n>### Answer1: ___________<n>daily_rate(11)<n>If days is < 150:<n>return 190<n>else:<n>return 450<n>def daily_rate<n><n>if days <150:<n><n>rate1=190<n><n>else: rate1=450<n><n>return rate1<n><n>### Input

How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:She a deep love for all her friends, every Friday she had an open invitation for them as she loved to host and what? Choices:  A: wait for B: eat out C: entertain D: please parents E: paint<n><n>### Response:		Answer: D: Please parents<n><n>### Input<n><n>What is 450 plus 315.<n>#### 665<n>Answer: 665<n><n>### Choices<n><n>Rationales:450 plus 450 == 900<n>Plus 315 add the three figures 900 + 315 and get the answer 1215.<n><n>### Input Choices<n><n>Rebecca wants to borrow an amount equal to the number of days in January (31).  The bank will loan up to twice the principal amount if a 5%​(5%=0.05)​ of the principal must be paid back by the end of the year.  The bank will not loan more than four times the principal amount, nor will it lend for more than two years.  The bank does not believe that Rebecca's credit history is good enough for an unsecured loan.  What is the largest amount Rebecca can borrow from the bank?<n><n>#### 3850<n>Answer: 6500<n>Option C.<n>### Input<n>When I divide, I want to know if 2 is a factor.  In this case, 2 is not a factor of 12.<n><n>### Rationales<n><n>Since 2 can only divide into even numbers, it can't divide into any of the numbers of the array.<n><n>#### 12<n>Answer: 12<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:The circus monkey waived a white surrender flag, the conductor joked the monkey must work in the what? Choices:  A: french government B: friend's house C: zoo D: south africa E: madagascar<n><n>### Response:		B The zoo<n><n>### Answers:b<n><n>### <n><n>### Input The flip of one coin at four:44:44 o’clock in the afternoon will be a heads and one coin at five:55:55 o’clock at night will be a tails.
