Choices:  A: learn about subject B: learn new C: find truth D: is bliss E: judge<n><n>### Response:		Ignorance is not an excuse for crime since learning is the remedy for ignorance.<n><n>### Input;The lawsuit against the city was thrown out based on the premise that the city owed no duty to residents because of the way the ordinance was worded. Which of the choices provided correctly explains why that argument fails?<n><n>### Dem:The city did have a duty and the ordinance is not strong enough to withhold duty. Duty needs to be done and the ordinance does not do that.<n><n>### Response;The argument on why the lawsuit was thrown out is the ordinance not strong enough to withstand duty and it does have a duty to do it and the ordinance did not do it.<n><n>### Answers provided:<n><n>### <img src=image.png width=200 height=200><n><n>### Input :<n>When using the PERT project planning method to estimate duration, which of the choices provided describes the way PERT estimates duration? Choices: Estimate each activity once and then multiply the effort by the duration. Estimate effort for both a most likely and pessimistic case and then find the average. Estimate effort and then count how long it will take based on available resources. Estimate effort for a most likely case and then estimate the total duration using a duration distribution curve. Estimate effort for each of n possible outcomes and combine the duration estimates to find the average.<n><n>### <center><n><img src=image.jpg width=200> <n><n>### Answer:<n><img src=3-2.png width=100 height=100><n><n>This question could have easily been made by adding the average (duration of a given activity x number of iterations for each activity) and then multiplying the average by the success rate (how often the activity was done in the best case scenario, and the number of iterations), or by the duration of an activity and the success rate (how many times the activity was done), which is essentially what the method is doing but this was chosen from the information given<n><n>Input : <n>> The answer is <n><img src=example3.jpg><n><n><n># Screenshot <n><a href="https://i.imgur.com/U0lE0UX.png" target="_blank"><img

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:The teachers needed to get their classrooms ready for the school year.  What is one thing they might do? Choices:  A: talk too much B: teach children C: open boxes D: answering questions E: giving homework<n><n>### Response:		<n>Teaching their class<n><n>### Rationale:<n>They are in charge of the classrooms<n><n>**Instructions for Question 01**<n><n>Below is a statement of a task that describes a situation. Write a response that explains whether the given task can be completed.<n>Input: You have a long driveway that your car cannot make it up.<n>You call a tow truck that you do not want to pay a fortune for.<n>You contact your local police station.<n>It sends you a list of people you can choose from.<n>You finally decide to go with a guy named "Tow Truck Joe" who promises he will treat your car delicately.<n>Explain if this can happen and why.<n>Rationales: I would not use Tow Truck Joe because he will not take care of my car. He might try to charge you lots of money or damage your car.<n>The tow truck company that I would try to use would be the one you call for your first emergency.<n>#### Answer:<n>yes, there is a tow truck company or someone who will come tow your car and you will pay the normal price.<n><n>### Input 1: The teachers assigned their students to help out in the classroom.<n><n>### Response 1: My children were supposed to be helping out.<n><n>### Rationales 1: They were supposed to help out. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:If you socialize by having trivial conversations it is called what? Choices:  A: make friends B: mingle C: meet people D: small talk E: meet new people<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>### Input<n><n>The car-rental agence charges $30/days for cars for the first week of a rental or for longer.<n>The first 7 days were 4*2.366=<<4*2.316=2.728>>2.728.  86+2.728=<<86+2.532=110>>110.<n>32.4 days.<n>I'm unsure of how to work out 220-98=<<220-95=25>>25.<n><n>#### 25<n><n>Input: The amount of time it takes you to eat a hamburger varies with the amount of food you order. If the menu prices are $5.49, $7.99, and $9.99, what is the price of an item that takes you one hour to eat?<n>Rationales:(It will take 30 minutes to eat each hamburger)<n>2 items = <<2*1*1=2>> 25.25<n>5 items = <<5*1*3=15>>15.00<n>60 minutes<n>9 dollars per hour = 3.33 dollars per hamburger<n>9.00*3=<<9.00*2.33=21>>21 and 112.33/21.00=<<112.3/21=5>>5<n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: Two people walk from a point of reference X to point Y at a constant rate of 2.447 miles/hour.  If it takes them 5.484 hours to travel the 5.053 miles, what is the linear rate in miles per minute that these two people travel?<n>Rationales::Let X = the starting point and Y = the endpoint.<n>Given that the rate these people travel is x miles per hour, the distance traveled will be y=x*t,<n>where the constant t = 5.4835.<n>Solving for x: y=x*t=(2.447*
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:If a person is seeing new things, what do they most often feel? Choices:  A: curiosity B: excitement C: boredom D: wonder E: fear<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Input A: What is 14 divided by 3?<n>Rationales I can cross multiply.<n>6*2=30÷6*5=15 =<<6*5=30>>30<n> <n>### Response: 5<n><n>### Input B: What is 9 divided by 4?<n>Rationales Subtraction method.<n>Subtacted 7=<<7=4>>4<n>9-6=3<n>3x3=<<3x3=9>>9<n>Therefore 9/7 = <<9/7=9>>9<n><n>### Response 9/7 = 3<n><n>### Input C: What is 7 subtracted by 9?<n>Rationales Same as A<n><n>### Response Subtraction method.  7-9=0<n><n>### Input D: What is 10 subtracted by 5?<n>Rationales As well as B Same as A<n><n><n>### Response A Subtraction method. 10-5=5<n><n>### Response C A: 3x3=9<n><n>### Input E: What is 7/2 minus 8?<n>Rationales 5-1=<<4-1=3>>3<n><n>### Response E: 3<n><n>## Instruction:Complete the following problems.<n>### Instruction1:Which type of diagram is each shape shown?<n><n>### Input1:<n>1. <n>A. rectangle (<<5>>rectangle)<n><n>B. rectangle (<<6>>rectangle)<n>C. rectangle (<<4>>rectangle)<n>D. circle (<<2>>circle)<n>E. rectangle (<<3>>rectangle)<n>F. rectangle (<<2>>rectangle)<n>G. rectangle (<<1>>rectangle)<n>H. rectangle (<<31>>rectangle) <5 rectangles<n><n>### Response1:<n>A Rectangle<n>B Rectangle<n>C Rectangle<n>D Circle<n>E Rectangle<n>F Rectangle<n>G Rectangle<n>H Rectangle<n>I Rectangle<n><n><n>## Instruction 2:<n>Write a complete sentence about each word<n><n>### Input2:<n>Rationales 2: a person or people who are a member of a club or organization with special

Choices:  A: mouth B: jars and all faces C: kentucky fried chicken D: hand E: human<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Instructions:<n>In this paragraph, identify the logical fallacies in the arguments. Click here to check.<n><n>### Paragraph:<n><n>Most people do not buy their first home after high school.  They rent living quarters and wait until they have some money saved for a down payment and then purchase their first home.<n><n>### Argument:<n><n>- The government has programs to help people buy houses.<n>- People take these programs instead of saving up money, because if you save up money, you won't qualify for this program.<n>- The government would like to help people but it is impossible because the economy is very bad.  Every time they help one person, they hurt another person<n><n>### Logical Fallacy:<n><n>- **Ad Hominem**<n>- The writer is attacking the credibility of the speaker, but not by showing that the speaker’s opinion is wrong through logical reasoning.<n>- The writer is saying that the speaker’s advice is bad because the speaker is bad.<n><n>### Correct Answer:<n><n>### Instraction:<n>Incomplete the sentence with an appropriate transitive verb.<n><n>### Sentence:<n>A) When I finish _______, I will be done. B) I work hard to finish my assignment.<n><n>### Correction: When I finished _______, I would be done.<n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Where can you buy socks and jeans? Choices:  A: washing machine B: laundromat C: clothing store D: closet E: shopping mall<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Answer:C<n><n>## Part 3<n><n>### Input(Multiple choice question is given. Chooses one choice and describes how the answer can be reached.<n><n>#### Instructor (Writes an instruction that describes a problem):The car-rental agenc y charges $30/d ay for a ca r, o r $190 f or t he first week for a r ental that lasts an entire weak or longer (Jennie rented a ca r for 11  days.  How much, in dollars, d id she p ay for t he rental?)<n><n>#### Demonstration (Response that completes the request):<n>I will go to washing machine.<n>I will put clothes from the closet inside the washing machine.<n>Then I will choose the socks and jeans from the laundry basket and then put them in the closet.<n>#### Answer:In 11 days it is 11 times the amount, since she spent 190 dollars. The cost is 190 times 11 = $2190<n><n>#### 2190<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:The shark was migrating between continents, where did biologists find it? Choices:  A: fresh water B: gulf of mexico C: open ocean D: television program E: coral reef<n><n>### Response:		Answer choice A: fresh water<n><n>#### 41<n>Answer: 45<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Choose the best response to complete the request below.<n><n>### Input A: In Australia, a 125 lb. person burns 500 calories walking for 90 minutes. An adult in the United States weighing 235 lb. burns 625 calories doing the same exercise. Which country is most likely to be located on a tectonic plate with a much lower population density? Choices:  a: Austria b: China c: Japan d: Switzerland e: Canada<n>#### 246<n>Answer: 2091<n>

How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur. Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Input:The flight took 6 hours.  The train took 15 hours to arrive at your destination, if you left at the same time.<n><n>### Answer:21hours<n><n>### Input How much did the tickets cost total?  Input The plane ticket costs $425.  The train ticket costs $225.<n><n>### Rationals:<n>Since the flight is $425 and it takes 6 hours to get here, the plane should cost at least $425/6=<<425/6=.6>>6.  The train costs $225 and takes 15hours to get here, the train should cost at least $225/15=<<225/1=.1>>1.<n><n>Since the plane is more expensive than the train so if we combine the two, the trains cost would be $650, so combining the cost $350.<n><n>##  Problem<n>In which game are cards played in succession to determine which player has the highest card?<n><n>* Checkers<n>* Chess<n>* Solitaire<n>* Poker<n><n>## Answer:Solitaire<n>Poker is a game of poker<n><n>Solitair is a game you play on your own so it is played in succession.<n><n>

If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:What type of water transportation is human powered? Choices:  A: turn away B: let down C: have to sleep D: run E: row boat<n><n>### Response:		<n>It’s A,turn away<n><n>### Input：Choose True or False,<n><n>### Response：<n>“There are only three ways to cook bacon.”<n>### It’s true<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following problems.<n><n>### Response:"1421568" (four digit)<n>In what order would you subtract 6 from 3,4,5, and 6?<n>1+-3=2+-4=3+-5=4+-6=<n>#### -8<n>710<n>Answer: -8<n>In what order would subtract 8 would you subtracts from 3,4?<n><n>### Input:"1027547"(Four digit)<n><n>### Response:(Answer: "0"<n><n>### 96"<n><n>Input: A large company has 96 engineers.  They’d like to break their team into small groups.  If they make 16 6 member teams, how many engineers will be left over?<n>Rationales. We know that there is a 6+6 = <<6+6=12>>12 person group, but they only have 96 total members, so that means there are 96-12 = <<96-12=84>>84 people who did not make a group. (84 is the correct answer.<n>#### 84<n>Answer: 84<n><n>Input: What is the missing number? 0 3 6 _ 0<n>Rationales: If you have 0 3 9, the 0 and are added up but not the 9, because if you have 12, you need to have a 0 for the addition or subtraction to be right, so you need to add the 9 to get 12.<n>#### 3<n>Answer: 3<n><n>Input: Is “13609” an even or odd number?<n>Answer: 8<n><n>Input: What number can you add to 47 to make it even?<n><n>Answer: 1<n><n>### Output<n><n>![Output](./images/output.PNG)<n><n>Output:<n>#### 72
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:What do customers do in a store? Choices:  A: hunt B: pay merchants with money C: mail orders D: spend money E: demand satisfaction<n><n>### Response:		<n>![](../static/image/response/hunt/1/hunt.png)<n><n>### Response Explanation:<n>A: hun=hunt<n>B: mer=merchants<n>C: mai=mail<n>D: spen=spend<n>E: sat=satisfaction<n>

How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Why would a company be going public? Choices:  A: revealing information B: being ridiculed C: problems D: more funding E: telling all<n><n>### Response:		<n>```python<n>import tkinter as tk<n>class A(tk.Tk):<n><n>frame_one_content=tk.Label(main_canvas,text='Revenue',bg='blue',font="Helvetica 60 bold")<n>frame_two_content=tk.Button(main_canvas, text="+", width=7,command=frame_one_change)<n><n>frame_one=tk.Frame(main_canvas,background ='red', padding=10)<n>frame_one.grid(row=0,column=0)<n>frame_two=tk.Frame(canvas = main_canvas)<n>frame_two.pack(fill="both","expand =True")<n>frame_one.pack(fill ='both',expand = 'yes',padx=0,pady=0)<n>frame<n>frame_one_change(frame_one,frame_two)<n>frame_two_change()<n><n>def frame_one_change(parent_frame, children_frame):        <n>    parent_frame.update(text=parent_frame_change)<n>    children_frame.update(info=children_frame_change)  <n>    children_frame_change=tk.Label(children_frame,text='The company is going public so people now know about it',bg='blue',width=20,font ='Helvetica 85 italic bold')<n>    children_frame=tk.Frame(parent_frame,background ='blue', padding=10,relief=RIDGE)<n>    parent_frame_change_frame=tk.Label(parent_frame,text='Revenue for the company: $500 million/year',bg='blue', font='Helvetica 30',width=20)<n>    parent_one_content_frame=tk.Canvas(parent_frame,borderwidth=2,background="green")<n>    parent_frame=tk.Button(parent_frame_change_children_frame,text="More funding",width=10,command=children_frame_refresh,padx=0,<n>                            pady =0)<n>    parent=tk.Frame(root,bg='yellow',padding=8)<n>        root.mainloop()<n><n>frame_two_click_handler(children_frame,root)<n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:What eastern state is home to a mountain? Choices:  A: switzerland B: pennsylvania C: picture D: asia E: austria<n><n>### Response:		Answer: A<n><n>### Input2:If a man is 20 years older than twice the age of his son, then the son’s age is? His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. The two values of 1 and negative 7.<n><n>### Input:"4" is greater than "3" Choices:A: True B: False<n><n>### Response:"3".<n><n>### Reasonthe number "4" is greater than the number 3 for that "4" is a natural number and 3 is not a natural number for a natural number being one of a set of numbers including 1, 2, 3, and 4.<n><n>### Note"The set of natural numbers also includes 5, 6, 7,… and so on. They are also called counting numbers"<n>### Reference:"What are Natural Numbers?"[https://www.mathwords.com/n/natural_numbers.htm](https://www.mathword.com/n/natrural_numbers.h)<n><n>### Note2"The set of natural number is the collection of whole numbers that include 0"<n><n>### Reaasonthe set of natural number also includes 5,6,7,….and so on. The include 0 is also a natural number. However, the set of natural number starts from 1. This is because no natural number include 0<n><n>### Reference:"what are natural number"[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Natural_number](https://en.wikipediaorg/wiki/Natrual_number)<n>

How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:What do people look for when competing against someone? Choices:  A: edge B: desire to win C: friendship D: rivalry E: skill<n><n>### Response:		Competing for a position might be more challenging than a competition where you have more control of what happens.<n>A game of cards or chess might give you an advantage through skill and preparation, and may not require much competition beyond that.<n>However, people still prefer to compete in games of skill and preparation where they feel they will be judged fairly.<n><n>### Input : Choose a choice below to demonstrate how that choice demonstrates the concept of chance and data distributions.<n>A: The probability in a single game of roulette. B: Chance distribution in a single game of blackjack. C: Probability distribution in a long distance swim competition. D: Chance of a hurricane reaching the coasts of Florida. E: The average size of a chrysanthemum.<n><n>### Response : D: The chance of a hurricane making landfall can be estimated by looking and historical data, but the effect of the weather in addition to wind speed and directions can contribute to it reaching the coast.<n><n>### Output:Write a response that describes the output of the following statement as it applies to the input description. <n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Three quarters of what are covered by the ocean? Choices:  A: waterfalls B: underwater C: beach D: surface of earth E: river<n><n>### Response:		The correct answer is underwater. 25% of the earth's surface is covered by rivers.<n>#### E -> D<n><n>### Input : A cement mixer is on the top of a hill. A horse is at the bottom of the hill, and he goes in to get water. On the horse's way back up the hill he falls and breaks his leg. Is the horse better off? Choices: <n><n>A: Yes. Because the leg will heal faster.<n><n>B: No. Now the horse can't get water.<n>#### B -> A<n><n>### Input; Is this question an analogy? Choices:  Yes. No. I don't think so.<n><n>### Response; No, this is not an analogy.<n><n>#### No -> No<n><n>### Input A: Which is less expensive to produce, 300 gallons of ice cream or 600 sticks of licorice? Choices:  Ice cream 1 to 3 sticks.  Licorice  1 dozen stick Licorice 6 to 8 <n><n>#### 6 to 8 -> Ice cream<n><n>### Input B: Which weighs more, a ton of sand or a ton of rocks? Choices:  Rocks 10 tonnes Sand  10 tonnes<n><n>#### Sand  10 tonnenes -> Rocks<n><n>### Input C: I weighed 6000 pounds on a scale at the butcher and I found that the scale had been wired incorrectly. The train-yard operator was standing on top of a signal bridge at the time of the accident. How did the two trains get entangled in the switch?<n><n>### Response.<n>The key to solving this problem requires understanding that the two trains were traveling on parallel tracks in the same direction in a single track railroad yard. The question asks you to describe a problem that would cause two trains traveling on parallel tracks to collide.<n><n>One problem would be a mechanical failure. The train-yard operator might have a failure of his switch and accidentally turn on both switches, causing the two trains to collide. It's also possible to have human error here, as the train-yard operator could be switching switches without proper knowledge of the switches that he is using. The question does not ask how the trains got entangled, so it's unclear if the problem was mechanical or human.<n><n>### Input<n><n>Input: A friend gives you an envelope full of $1 dollar bills. How much is in it?<n><n>### Input A friend gives you an apple. How many apples does your friend give you if he gives you a second apple? What if you give back one apple, then what does he have? Choices: A: none B: 1 C: 2 D: 3 E: 4 F: 5<n><n>### Response<n>The question asks for the number of apples. Since there is no context or condition given, we can assume that the friend gives you any number of apples. Assuming that you start with 1 apple, your friend can still give you a second apple, keeping the question unchanged. If you keep the same number of apples and return one of the apples that you were given, then you still have the one extra apple.<n><n>### Answer 2<n>The first response did not account for returning an extra apple.<n><n>If your friend gives you 2 apples and you return one, this gives you 1 apple.<n>If you return the first apple that you received:<n><n>your friend still has 1 extra apple.<n><n>After returning 2 apples, your friend still has 1 apple.<n><n>Returning two apples will leave you with 0 remaining app

Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Where could you find a laundry room that is only used by staff? Choices:  A: house B: hotel C: green house D: college E: dorm<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Rationale A:<n>Input: The laundry room that used to be in Ms. Marcy's house was only used by the family that lived there. So it would be in their "house." And Ms. Marcy just moved to her new house which she rents out. So the new residents would be living there. And the old residents have already moved out.<n><n>### Rational B:<n>Input: A)<n><n>Input: A hotel would have a laundry room where staff was the only people allowed to use it. That way they would be cleaned up and ready for their guests to relax on their beds. But they would likely be a lot more expensive so guests would probably have to pay for that luxury.<n><n>#### 30<n>Answer: B<n><n>### RATIONAL C:<n>Input: C)<n><n>Input: C) A) Green house would never need to do their wash. They could have someone come everytime they need to get washed off there plant food and water.<n><n>#### 20<n>Answer: C<n><n>### RANTIAL D:<n>Input: D) They have a laundry and it could be just for people who are on campus only. Everyone else would have to travel and stay somewhere to do thier wash. Even though some are allowed they would likely need to be in their dorm room to use it.<n><n>#### 10<n>Answer: D<n><n>### Rationally E:<n>Input: E) At a dorm the people who lived there would have used the laundry room. And since they are all college students they probably wouldnt have wash cloths in every room. And when someone else moved in the only had to move all of their stuff around and get set up.<n><n>#### 0<n>Anwser: E<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:The artist didn't use many colors to capture the view, he was famous for his very plain what? Choices:  A: landscape B: east side C: countryside D: middle america E: georgia<n><n>### Response:		D answer: Georgia<n><n>### Explaination:<n><n>Input is: The artist didn't use too many colors to capture the countryside. He was famous for this very plain landscape. That means we can cross out (A) & (B). Next, he painted this very plain countryside. That means we can eliminate (C) & (D) as well. Finally, he painted this very colorful east side. That means we can get it down to one answer. We can choose (E) as the answer because East side implies something that's at the east, and not landscape.<n><n>Rationales:<n><n>```python<n>def test():<n>    assert answer == ('E')<n>```<n><n>__Answer:__<n>E<n><n>### Input<n><n>Cameron will be charging the same price for his services as the other plumbing companies in his area. In his opinion, he's also charging people 10 times the money he spends fixing a problem, and the company down the street is charging 20 times more.  His new prices will be $200 for minor fix, $400 for an average fix, and $600 for major fix. If he's charging $600 for a major fix, how much will Cameron's company make off someone using the services for the first time in a week, based on his new prices?<n><n><n>### Input and Output:<n><n>Cameron's charges are:<n>* minor fix: $200  <n>* average fix: $400  <n>* major fix:  $600<n><n>Cameron thinks he's charging 10 times the amount he should be for a major fix, and thinks the average fix is twice the price, and the minor fix is equal to it's cost. We know that the major fix is worth the most, since it's the most time consuming.<n><n>```python<n>import math<n>def test():<n>  assert answer == math.floor(round(majorfix10x / majorfix))<n>```<n><n>__Test case__<n> 1. Test the minor fix, major fix price and minor fix 10x price<n>2. Calculate the minor fix 10X price<n>3. Test if they match<n><n>Output: The output should give 
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Wanting to avoid the cabbage spoiling, where did he put it? Choices:  A: grocery store B: refrigerator C: freezer D: plate E: supermarket<n><n>### Response:		<n>I would put it in the fridge because it's cold and since it's warm outside it'll spoil.

There is no more gas left.<n><n>### Rationale<n>If there is less than 50 gallons, you have spent the 50 with the remaining amount you are still using or adding to the cost.<n><n>### B:<n>375<n><n>### If there is only 1/2 as much gas left as there was the day before, how much was left?<n><n>### C:<n>6.25 gallons<n><n>### Rules:<n>A+B=1+2=<<3>>3<n><n>### If a store sells 12 bags and 4 are stolen, how many are left?<n><n>## Instructions:<n><n>##

If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Where is disease often spread but shouldn't be? Choices:  A: ghost town B: third world country C: human body D: rug E: hospital<n><n>### Response:		A. GHOST TOWN<n><n>### Rationales :A ghost town is a town that has been abandoned<n><n>### Input:- The average number of people that can fit in a rowboat is 6.<n><n>### Response- B. THIRD WORLD COUNTRY<n>- The average speed of a car traveling over water is 30 MPH.<n>- The average speed a car travel over land is 20 MPH<n><n>### RATIONALES-  The boat is faster because there are more people in it so this goes to third world countries since countries are usually more populated then a small town <n>### Input:- In one day, a doctor's office can examine a maximum of 30 patients.<n><n>### Rationale:- The doctor's office can accept no more than 30 patients per day<n>### Input : What is not a real number?<n><n>### Rationales :- Zero is not a Real number<n>### Input:- This year you saved $4,000.<n><n>### Input :- A doctor can examine up to 30 patients per hour, which means the most patients he can see in a day is 30 hours(since it is maximum). <n><n>### Ratiulances:- That means the most patients he'd see each day will be 1, and the total cost for the doctor is 30*1=$30. <n><n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Where is a snake likely to reside? Choices:  A: tropics B: nightmare C: wyoming D: bushes E: feild<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>I think the correct answer is bushes.<n><n>### Input;<n>Ask an employee how she would prepare for a business trip.<n><n>### Response;<n>I would get ready to leave as soon as I was given the date and place that the trip was to start. <n>I would pack a bag that would be fully equipped with all of the necessities for the trip that I may need.<n><n>### Rationales:<n>Getting ready:<n>- Get everything ready to go.<n>- Put things in bags that are needed for trips.<n><n>Get Equipment:<n>- Clothes for the journey<n>- Money for food and incidentals<n>- Toiletries<n>- Presentations and anything I need to be a successful businessperson if needed for the trip that I need to make.<n><n>### A.M. asks J.W. how he would prepare. He responds:<n>- I would give it some thought and pack appropriately.<n>- I would make sure to remember all of the essentials.<n>- I would bring everything that I needed to make the trip a smooth and comfortable experience.<n><n>### B.M. asks J.'W. how she would prepare. She/he responds:<n>- Putting together an adequate collection of items that are not only needed but are also wanted is very important.<n><n>### C.A. asks L.W. how the person would prepare. They respond:<n>- There is a procedure in place for planning a trip.<n>- A certain period of lead time is required.<n>- The employee makes a list with the supplies needed.<n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. Choices:  A: soccer game B: fairgrounds C: movie theatre D: countryside E: state park<n><n>### Response:		<n>C<n><n>### Rationales:<n><n>Cotton candy and popcorn are only sold at fairs and carnivals. That makes 1B.<n>The movies theaters are the exception to our rule and they don’t sell popcorn and cotton candy.<n><n>E is the countryside and movies are not sold there.<n><n>A is a soccer match where popcorn is not sold.<n><n>D is the state park. The movie theater was ruled out and the park will have both cotton candy and pop corn.<n><n>That leaves only choice B.<n><n>#### <n>Answer:<n>C<n><n>Input: A dog jumps off a bridge 28 feet above the road. He hits the road 30 feet away from the bridge and runs away at a constant 20 feet per minute.  At what speed was he traveling when his legs left the bridge?<n>Rationales -<n>The height is 28-30=<<28-30=-2>>-2.<n>Thus, y=y+x<n>dy=dy+dx<n>dy=-2<n>dy=-2<n>dx=20<n>dx=20.<n>The speed = dy/dx = <<dy/dx=-2/20=2>>2.

How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:What do all humans have on the side of their head? Choices:  A: two feet B: two ears C: horns D: lay eggs E: one head<n><n>### Response:		<n>__A__<n><n>### Rationale:<n>Answer: D<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:What has highly criticized security? Choices:  A: university B: concert C: home D: terminal E: airport<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n><n>- 7

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Choices:  A: feel pleasure B: look attractive C: compliments D: interesting experiences E: joy<n><n>### Response:		A and D<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the question given below.<n><n>### Input<n><n>Today I purchased a 10.5 lb bag of cake mix that costs $0.39/lb. I also purchased a can of frosting that costs $0.79/lb. If the cake mix had cost $0.30/lb and the frosting cost $0.35/lb, what is my percentage profit of buying the cake mix and frosting together? I used 6 cups of mix and 1 cup of frosting to make my cake. I also used 6 cups to bake the cake and the remaining 2 of frosting.<n><n>### Rationales<n><n>* To get the answer for my profit percentage the total cost of both items will be added together when my price of 10.5lbs bag of cake mix = $4.05, the cost of the frosting 1 pound = $0.079(0.79)and since the 6 cups of frosting were used up in the production of the cake, I will be getting 5.9 cups of cake which can be calculated as 5.9 cuits of cake per pound, $ 3.73 per pound and the total cost of my cake and it's materials including both cake mix and frosted is $ 7.78 and after calculating both cost together $0.844.<n><n>### Answer: 21.6<n><n>### Instctions:Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n><n>## Input:<n>A 24-ounce can of whole pumpkin costs $2. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.
