Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Where would you find isopropol alcohol and safety glasses? Choices:  A: pub B: restaurants C: in a park D: supermarket E: chemistry lab<n><n>### Response:		I believe that I should pick A. If you had any questions, please don't hesitate to reach out.<n><n>### Input The two sides of the square above are each colored either blue or yellow. They are painted on watercolor paper on which the colors will not mix. Find a way, using only a brush and water, to color the entire square blue.<n><n>### Response :I would try to color the squares in a way<n><n>### Instruption How many years have passed since John was born? Choices: 1962 B 1954 C 1952 D 1965 E 1956<n><n>### response :i think the choices are as bellow<n><n>### Insturctions:A certain company is having a sale this weekend on tires of a specific size. You are thinking about buying a car in the near future. The company will have tires for $79. In how many years, to the nearest month, will the price of this same size tire be half the price it is now?<n>Rationales : In 6 months<n>since 79/2=<<79/2=39>>39 weeks<n>to make the tire costs half of what it is now<n>$79/2=<79/2=$39>>39weeks<n>6 months will be <<<6months=<<6weeks=>>3weeks>>3weeks<n>in 6 months<n>#### 3<n>Answer: 3<n><n>### Input In a certain town, the residents are required to take out certain insurance as part of their tax obligation. One year, John Doe, and a group of friends, each received information from their agent about this special insurance called “Hazard and Liability.” The following day, John called the agency to get more details. They sent him an insurance application, explaining that the insurance covers “all risks” and “all liabilities.” In particular, “all risks” meant damage to any structure and any item in the structure, unless intentionally or deliberately damaged. John also read that the insurance would cover legal fees incurred in settling a dispute with someone who sued you for damage to their property.<n>#### Choice: 1 a. John’s agent told him that they
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Where can you get in shape and drink at a juice bar? Choices:  A: fridge B: limejuice C: square D: gym E: refrigerator<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Input/ Rationale:<n><n>I would like for you to answer any/ or all of the following questions.<n>* What are your main take-aways for this week?<n>* How will your knowledge of probability improve your day to day life?<n>* What connections can you make between your studies in probability and math class?<n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Billy's mother tripped over a stuffed animal.  She yelled at him not to leave his things where? Choices:  A: toy store B: hall C: bathroom D: amusement park E: fairgrounds<n><n>### Response:		<n>### Correct answer:E: fairgrounds<n>It is best to put your stuff, including your toys, in a secure place away from your house.<n>### Other possible answers:<n>Because toys are important to Billy's mother, she doesn't want them scattered in the hall.  Toys are also important to Billy and his parents don't want to step on them.  He could buy some of them from the fairground.  That isn't necessary, they can go to toy store.<n><n>### The toy store has a lot of toys, and it isn't safe.  The stuffed animals aren't there for long.<n>### Choice D: amusement park<n>He has already tripped over them and doesn't like them, so it is the worst place to keep them.<n>### Correct answer text for other response choices:<n>Billy's mother doesn't want him to place his toys where they wouldn't be seen, like in a hall.<n>Billy's father wants him to place them in a room with his own things.  But, it is best to put your things, including your toys away from your house.  This will keep them safe in a private place.<n>Billy' socks would be messed by the hallway.  The toys may be safe, but they aren't.  Keeping them in Billy's room is the best solution.<n>The toy store has a whole lot of toys, but they aren'toys anymore.  They are in the hall, and they are messed.  It isn't the best place to put things in your house.  If you don't have an entertainment park where the toys aren't visible, you still need to store them somewhere else.<n>

Choices: A: the entire average B: the entire range of numbers C: middle number D: median E: mean<n>#### 278<n>Answer: D<n><n>### Input"Divisible" is the math term is used to? Choices: A divisible is the number of parts that can be divided evenly into another number B: is the number of places to which you can subtract one or more times C: a sum that can be divided by another number D: is the number of numbers that can be multiplied by a number E: the number of things that can be made from another number<n><n>### Response:"Divisible" is defined as the number of parts that two or more numbers can be divided into.<n><n>### ResponseInput: What is the total length, in inches, of a snake that has a body that is 4 feet long? Choices: A 24 inches B 4 feet C 48 inches D 36 inches E 36.5 feet<n><n>### Rationales:In order to determine the total length, we must know the perimeter of the body. The perimeter of the snake is equal to 4 times the length of the snakes body plus 2 sides. Since the snakes body length is 4, then the 2 other sides will be the snakes tail and head which totals 6.  Then the perimeter will equal 4 times 4 plus 6.  The perimeter will equal 12 inches.  Then to find the total length of the snake, we simply multiply the perimeter by the circumference of the snake.  The circumference will equal 12 divided by 3.6 will equal 3.3 feet.<n><n><n>#### 474<n>Answer: 474<n><n>### InputThe number of degrees in a right angle is? Choices: A. 45 degrees B. 90 degrees C. 105 degrees D. 75 degrees E.0 degrees<n><n>### Response A right angle is equal to 90 degrees.  Since its divided by 1/4
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:Where would you put silverware once they've dried, but you're not ready to use them. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:What do you feel from playing football? Choices:  A: exhilaration B: pain C: death D: getting hurt E: get hurt<n><n>### Response:		<n>If you picked either B or D as your answer, you are wrong. If you don’t get to your goal, you get hurt. If you do get to your goal, then you didn’t get hurt. That is the difference between getting hurt and getting into an accident. If you don’T get to your goal, and you are in an accident you died.<n><n>### Input:-You are a math tutor -Judy is a high school student -Judy wants to master the Pythagorean Theorem.  Judy is studying for an average of 5 hours per week.  How many weeks does it take Judy to master the Pythageorean Theorem?<n>-Judy: It takes me an average of 5 hour for me to master a theorem and I have 8 different subjects I want to master. I want to master the 8 different subjects without extra cost but not by wasting the time. What should I do?<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Complete the question.<n>#### 28 weeks<n>Judy, you need to dedicate your time. First you can spend 5 hours per week studying a theorem. For the first week you need to study the Pythagoreans theorem then after 1 hour you can move onto the next theorem and so on. The theorem you learned last week is the theorem you must work on next week to master your theorems. Since you need to master all eight theorems in total, the 8*5=365 hours you would need to master all your theorems to be correct. The next theorem would then take 50+50=<<50+50=>100>>100 hours to master for a total of 100+100=<<100+190=33 weeks>>33 weeks. Then, you multiply 33*2=<<33*2=66>>66. That gives you an average cost of 8 hours per week. To get all the theorems that you don’t need to invest the extra cost. In summary, it would take all students about 8 weeks.<n>12*5=<<12*5=60 16 weeks for an average student and it would take an average 16 week.<n><n>### The question you may ask: Is

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:What is someone likely to feel after receiving a gift that is not common? Choices:  A: special B: personal C: offended D: unique E: rare<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Answer the following multiple choice questions by selecting the best response. If you are unsure of your answer or if no one answer fits your rationale, select choice (E).

Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:A person who wants to make more at their job but can't will often need to find a what? Choices:  A: eyes B: biology laboratory C: shower stall D: old cheese E: decaying matter<n><n>### Response:		E<n><n>### Demostration:1. Eyes: The pink eyelids of a calf are due to the milk of the cow. They grow in the cow and are made up of collagen, a protein, and they have some vitamins and minerals. The pink color comes from the protein, the collagen. You know that calcium can turn a fluid (like milk) into a solid. If cow milk changes to the pink eye of a calf, then that must mean calcium is present.  2. Laboratory: Milk is used in biology classes because it’s easy to work with and it’s easy to see with microscopes because it reflects blue light. You can find cheese growing on things in your fridge that have cheese in it (or you can put old cheese on something and let it sit).   3. Shower stall: Cheese is made from milk. When you shower, you might have cheese growing on the shower stall if you had an old chunk of cheese.   4. Decaying matter: Bacteria eat old food. They eat decaying matter, which is where they might find old milk.   5. Old cheese:<n>Old cheese is made from milk, and you can find it growing on things that have old cheese in them.<n>#### A<n>Answer: E<n><n>### Input#:On a day that it’s snowing and the temperature is around zero degrees Fahrenheit,  an animal eats 0.2 pounds of grass.  What is the animal’s metabolic rate? Choices: 1.9 calories per minute 2.1 calories per hour 3.0 calories per day 4.2 calories per minute<n><n>### Response#:1. B<n><n>### Demos:1. B 2.C 3.A 4.D<n><n>### Demons:1. On one day where the temperature is zero degrees F, the animal eats 0:2/0\2 pounds of grass, or 0.2 pounds.  Thus, this animal’s metabolism rate would be 0.2 pounds divided by 45.7 minutes, which is 0.467 pounds per minute= B<n>### There are 60 minutes in

Choices:  A: airplane B: construction site C: shops D: engine E: broken bone<n><n>### Response:		The first possibility is to make sure that the rod is in the car.  If not, go to the engine.  If not there, a trip to the shop.  If that fails, visit the construction site.  If not there either, check the engine.  The final possibility would be to visit a broken bone.<n><n>### Rationale:<n>All the possible locations begin with the engine other than the one final possibility, which begins with the construction site.<n><n>### Answer:D<n><n>### Instructions:<n>### Input:The average person has 4 of each type of shoe.<n>Given that the average person has 4 pairs of each type of shirt.  Write a response that appropriates completes the request.  <n>Answer: The response should read that there are 16 total pairs of shoes.<n><n>### Input/Rationale:<n>The average person has 2 of each shoe.  Since there are 4 types of shoes, that means they have 8 pairs of shoes.  The shirt rule applies to both shoes and pants.<n><n>Answer: There are 24 pairs of shoes.  24 times 1 shirt + 6 times 2 shirts = 4 pairs of pants on the average person.  Since they have 40 shirts, you subtract the 2(pairs of pants)<n><n>### Input：This sentence is true if and only if you are able to read it and understand it. Answer: This means that if one cannot read it, then they also cannot understand it.<n><n>### Coding/Rationale/Answer:<n>True 1 False 0<n><n>### Input : Which is greater: 400 or 504? <n>#### Answer: 400 because 504 divided 2 is a whole number<n><n>### Instrument:<n>What are the first and last numbers that evenly divide 2830?<n>#### Rationale:<n>The lowest number that divides 2830 is 2.  There is no evenly divide that would give the last number.<n><n>#### Answer:<n>Since 2 and 14 are both even and they both divide 283 evenly, the number must be either 10 or 21 or any even number between 1
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>Input: Jason has a carriage house that he rents out.  He’s charging $50.00 per day or $500.00 for 14 days.  Eric wants to rent the house for 20 days.  How much will it cost him?<n>Rationales: He wants to rent for 20 days and there is a deal if you rent for 14 days so that leaves 20-14 = <<20-14=6>>6 individual days<n>Each individual day is $50.00 and he will have 6 individual days for a total of 50*6 = $<<50*6=300.00>>300.00<n>14 days costs $500.00 and 6 days costs $300.00 for a total of 500+300 = $800.00<n>#### 800<n>Answer: 800<n><n>Input: Melissa works on a poultry farm. She drives to town twice each month to buy supplies. If it takes her 3 hours to drive to town and back, how many hours does Melissa spend driving in a year?<n>Rationales: Melissa spends 2x3=<<2*3=6>>6 hours driving each month.<n>Since there are 12 months in a year, she spends 6x12=<<6*12=72>>72 hours driving each year.<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>### Input:It was breakfast time.  Brad ordered eggs, toast, and something to drink. What might he drink? Choices:  A: coffee B: throw up C: food D: getting drunk E: wine<n><n>### Response:		It was breakfast time, so he might have ordered A) coffee instead of B) throw up C) food<n><n>### Rationales:<n><n>### He could have ordered coffee<n>### food<n>A) coffee<n>B) throw up<n>C) food<n>D) getting drunk<n>E) wine<n>A) coffee<n>
